name: 2 Icing recipes
ingredients:
Cream Cheese Icing 
1 pound Cream Cheese, softened
1 Stick Butter
2 cups Powdered Sugar
2 tsp. Vanilla Extract


Simple Poured Icing
2 cups powdered Sugar
1-2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
directions:
Cream Cheese Icing
In a mixing bowl, beat the top 4 ingredients together until they're light and fluffy.
Add food coloring or leave it white.

Simple Poured Icing
Mix Powder Sugar and enough lemon juice to form a thin glaze.
Add food coloring or don't.

name: 3 Ingredient Banana Hacks
ingredients:
Pancakes:
1 ripe Banana
2 Eggs
Pinch of cinnamon
Muffins:
2 ripe Banana
4 Eggs
1/2 cup blueberries
Cookies:
1 super ripe Banana
1 cup quick cooking Oats
2 Tbsp Raisins
directions:
Pancakes: Mash bananas and then stir in eggs and cinnamon. Heat some oil in a pan and pour a ladle of the mixture to form rounds. Brown on both sides.
Muffins: Mash bananas and then stir in the eggs. Lightly grease a muffin tin and drop blueberries into each well. Cover with the mixture and bake at 350F for about 15 minutes.
Cookies: Mash bananas well, and then stir in oats and raisins. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes.

name: 4 Dipping Sauces
ingredients:
Honey Mustard Sauce:
1 Tbsp. Mustard
1 Tbsp. Mayonnaise
1 Tbsp. Honey
Barbecue Sauce:
1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 Tbsp. Ketchup
1 Tbsp. Honey
Sweet Chili Sauce:
2 Tbsp. Sweet chili sauce
1 Tbsp. Mayo
Coriander, chopped
Cheese Sauce: 
Gorgonzola cheese, crumbled
1 Tbsp. Cream
1/2 tsp. Mayo
directions: Simply mix the three ingredients together and serve with fries or chicken nuggets.

name: 7-UP Jello Salad
ingredients:
2 packages lemon or lime jello
2 cup hot water
2 cup 7-UP
4 bananas, sliced
2 cups small marshmallows
1 large can crushed pineapple, drained (save the juice)


Reserved pineapple juice
1 Tbsp. flour
1/2 cup sugar
1 egg well beaten
1 cup whipped cream
directions:
Mix jello and water.
Let cool in refrigerator for 1/2 hour. Chilled not set.
Add: the 7-UP, bananas, marshmallows, and crushed pineapple.
Mix everything into the jello.
While jello is setting, Prepare topping.
Using the remaining ingredients, Heat juice, flour, sugar and egg until thickened.
Cool and add whipped cream.
Spread on jello.

name: Agua Fresca
ingredients:
3 cups Watermelon
1/4 cup Lime juice
1/2 cup simple syrup
1/2 cup water
directions: Blend all ingredients together. Pass through a fine mesh strainer and transfer to a pitcher. Chill in the fridge. Serve with ice.

name: Apple Balsamic Chicken
ingredients:
1/2 cup Chicken broth
1/4 cup Apple cider or juice
1/4 cup Balsamic vinegar
2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Garlic powder
1/2 tsp Dried thyme
1/2 tsp Paprika
1/2 tsp Pepper
4 Bone-in chicken thighs (about 1.5 lbs), skin removed
2 Tbsp butter
2 Tbsp All-purpose flour
directions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the first nine ingredients. Place chicken in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Pour broth mixture over meat. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting, set pressure to high, and set time for 10 minutes.
When finished cooking, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure according o manufacturer's directions.
2. Remove chicken and keep warm. Skim fat from cooking liquid. In a small saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually add cooking liquid. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened (2-3 minutes). Serve with chicken.
notes:
Prep: 15 min.
Cook: 15 min + releasing

name: Apple Crisp
ingredients:
3 apples
1/2 cup flour
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup butter or margarine
3/4 cups oats
directions:
Put apples in buttered 9" pan.
Mix brown sugar and flour.
Cut in butter.
Stir in oats.
Spread over apples.
Bake 350 for 35-40 min.

name: Apple Dip
ingredients:
8 oz. Cream Cheese
Lots of Caramel sauce
Apples
directions:
Mix all of the cream cheese with how ever much of the caramel sauce tastes good.
Add caramel to taste.
Add more caramel as topping to the dip.
Cut up an apple and eat with the dip!

name: Apple Pie
ingredients:
9 apples peeled, cored and sliced (no seeds)
1 Tbsp. lemon juice
3/4 cup sugar
2 Tbsp. all- purpose flour
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1/8 tsp. ground nutmeg
directions:
Peel apples, cut out the core (including seeds, seed husks, etc.) and slice.
Put in Pie Crust and cover with thin rolled out dough.
Cover the edges of the pie with tin foil for the first 25 minutes to prevent over browning.
Bake at 375 for 25 minutes with the foil on.
Take the foil off and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack.

name: Apple Salad
ingredients:
1 small package strawberry jello
1-1/8 cup boiling water
3/4 cup orange juice
Rind of 1 orange
1 can crushed pineapple, drained
1/2 cup sugar
3-4 grated apples
directions:
Dissolve jello in water then add remaining ingredients.
Set in a ring mold and fill center with tinted whipped cream and sliced bananas.

name: Apricot Balsamic Glazed Pork Tenderloin with Ginger Rice and Sesame Green Beans
ingredients:
1 Thumb Garlic
1 clove Garlic
2 Scallions
2 Tbsp Soy sauce
1 Shallot
1 Chicken stock concentrate
1/2 cup Jasmine rice
10 oz Pork tenderloin
1 Tbsp Fry seasoning
1 Apricot jam
5 tsp Balsamic vinegar
6 oz Green beans
1 Tbsp Sesame oil
directions:
Wash and dry all produce (except for green beans). Peel and mince or grate ginger. Mince or grate garlic. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Halve, peel, and mince half the shallot (mince whole shallot for 4).
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add ginger, garlic, and scallion whites; cook until softened, 1-2 minutes. Add half the stock concentrate and 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups for 4 servings). Bring to a boil, then stir in rice. Cover and reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Cook until tender, 15-18 minutes.
Pat pork dry with paper towels; season all over with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp Fry Seasoning (2 tsp for 4 servings- we sent more). Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides and cooked through, 15-20 minutes. Turn off heat; transfer to a cutting board to rest. Wash out pan.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in same pan over medium-high heat. Add minced shallot and cook until softened, 2-3 minutes. Stir in jam and vinegar. Simmer until syrupy, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stir in 1/4 cup water (1/2 cup for 4), half the brown sugar (use all for 4), and remaining stock concentrate. Bring to a boil, then lower heat. Let bubble until thickened, 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in 1 Tbsp butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Pierce green bean bag with a fork; place bag on a plate. Microwave until tender, 1-2 minutes. (TIP: No microwave? No problem! Steam beans in a small pot with a splash of water until just tender, 5-7 minutes.) Carefully transfer green beans to a medium bowl. Toss with sesame oil; season with salt and pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork; season with salt and pepper. Stir any resting juices from pork into pan with glaze. Slice pork crosswise into medallions. Divide rice, pork, and green beans between plates. Drizzle pork with glaze. Top everything with scallion greens and soy sauce to taste.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 45 min. Calories: 720

name: Bacon and Cheddar Potatoes
ingredients:
4 pre-cooked unpeeled white potatoes
Olive oil
Salt to taste
7 oz Cheddar Cheese
5 1/2 oz Diced bacon
directions:
Cut the potatoes in a canoe shape.
Place the potatoes in a greased baking dish with olive oil and bake at 200 degrees for 30-40 minutes.
Arrange the potatoes on a plate and cover with warm cheddar.
Place crispy diced bacon on top.
notes: Check temperature F or C

name: Bacon and Eggs Bowls
ingredients:
250g Thickly sliced bacon, roughly chopped
3 large Eggs
270ml Milk
1/2 tsp Milk
Pepper
Pinch of Nutmeg
1/2 cup Gruyere cheese, grated
4 Buns
directions:
Fry the bacon in a pan set to medium heat until crispy. Transfer to a paper towel lined pan to absorb excess oil. Set aside. Whisk the eggs, milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg in a bowl. For extra flavor, you can add any herb or seasoning of your choice.
Slice the tops off the buns and remove the bread from the center, creating bowls. Place the bowls on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil. Evenly distribute the bacon and cheese between the bread bowls, then pour the egg mixture on top. 
Bake at 320F for 30-40 min, until the egg has set and is lightly browned. Remove from oven and enjoy.

name: Baked Chicken Breasts
ingredients:
6-7 boneless chicken breasts
Swiss cheese
Stove top stuffing
2 cans cream of chicken soup
Half cube butter
directions:
Place slice of Swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.
Sprinkle Stove Top stuffing crumbs on top.
Mix cream of chicken soup with spice packet from Stove Top mix.
Spread on top of stuffing crumbs.
Dab with half cube of butter.
Cover baking dish with foil.
Bake at 350 degrees for an hour.

name: Baked Chicken Breasts
ingredients:
6 or 7 boneless Chicken Breasts
Swiss cheese
Stove Top Stuffing
2 cans cream of chicken soup
Half cube butter
directions:
Place a slice of Swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.
Sprinkle Stove Top Stuffing crumbs on top.
Mix cream of chicken soup with spice packet from Stove Top mix.
Spread on top of stuffing crumbs.
Dab with half cube of butter. 
Cover baking dish with foil.
Bake a 350 degrees for 1 hour.

name: Baked Onion Cheese Rings
ingredients:
1 Onion
1 Small Package potato chips
1 Slice mozzarella cheese, cut into strips
1 Slice cheddar cheese, cut into strips
Flour
1 egg, beaten
directions:
Put potato chips in a Ziploc bag and crush until they are like crumbs.
Slice the onion into 1/2 inch thickness and separate the rings.
 Arrange cheese strips inside the onion rings. Repeat, alternating with the mozzarella and cheddar cheese.
Dip the onion rings in flour to coat them. Then dip them in the beaten egg.
Thoroughly coat the rings in potato chip crumbs.
Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
Enjoy with tomato sauce or ketchup.

name: Baked Tomato and Egg cups
ingredients:
3 Roma tomatoes, halved and seeded (look for larger Roma tomatoes)
6 eggs (smaller eggs fit better)
salt and pepper to taste
fresh herbs
toasted bread for serving
directions:
Preheat oven to 450ยบ
Place tomatoes on a baking sheet. You might need to slice a tiny bit off the bottom of each tomato to keep them level on the pan.
Crack eggs and gently place in the cavity of each tomato.
Season with salt and pepper. I added dried red pepper flakes for a little heat.
Bake for 6-7 minutes if you like your eggs runny. 8-10 for soft set.
Remove from oven and top with fresh chopped herbs.
Serve as is or on top of a crusty piece of toasted bread. This is also wonderful stuffed into a toasted bagel.

name: Baked Ziti
ingredients:
16 ounces ziti pasta 1 package, (or Penne pasta)
1 onion chopped
1 pound lean ground beef
pepper, to taste
garlic powder, to taste
onion powder, to taste
1 tsp minced garlic
2 (26 ounce) jars spaghetti sauce (feel free to add any veggies to this sauce)
8 slices Provolone cheese
1.5 cups sour cream
2 cups shredded Mozzarella cheese
2 Tbsp grated parmesan cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta, and cook until Al Dente, about 7-8 minutes; drain.
In a large skillet, add onion, ground beef, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and minced garlic over medium heat. Cook and then drain grease.
Add spaghetti sauce, and simmer 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Spray 2 (8 x 8 inch) pans with non-stick cooking spray. Layer as follows in each pan: 1/4 of the pasta, 1/4 of the sauce, 4 slices of Provolone cheese, 1/2 of sour cream,  1/4 of pasta, 1/4 mozzarella cheese and 1/4 of sauce mixture. Top with grated Parmesan cheese and remaining mozzarella cheese.
Bake covered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cheeses are melted.
notes: Works as a freezer meal

name: Balsamic Vinegar Noodles
ingredients:
Cooked Rotini Noodles
Mozzarella Cheese 
Balsamic Vinegar
Salt
Pepper
Mixed-up salt 
Basil
Tomatoes (cut up in cubes)
directions:
Cook the Rotini noodles.
Add cheese, vinegar, salt, pepper, and tomatoes.
Mix until noodles are a medium brown.
notes: The picture represents the choice to use lettuce instead of pasta.

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Bread
ingredients:
1 cup butter
2 cup sugar
2 tsp. vanilla
2 tsp. lemon juice
4 eggs
5 ripe bananas, 4 mashed and 1 coarsely chopped
1 tsp. salt
3 1/2 cup flour
2 tsp. baking soda
2 tsp. baking powder
1 cup dairy sour cream
1 (12 oz.) chocolate chips
directions:
Cream butter and sugar.
Add vanilla, lemon juice and eggs, beating well.
Stir in mashed bananas.
Sift together salt, flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Combine with banana mixture.
Add sour cream, (nuts), and coarsely chopped banana.
Turn into 2 greased loaf pans or 7 small loaf pans.
(Top with more chopped nuts.)
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or 1 hour for small pans or until surface springs back when touched.
Cool in pan.
notes: 1/2 cup nuts (optional)

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Bars
ingredients:
1 cup packed brown sugar
3/4 cup Butter or margarine, softened
1 Egg
1/2 tsp Salt
1 1/4 cups Mashed bananas (4 medium)
4 cups Old-fashioned rolled oats
1/2 cup Chocolate chips
1/2 cup Craisins
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg, salt and bananas until well combined. Stir in oats, chocolate chips and Craisins and mix thoroughly.
Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Banana Cream Pie
ingredients:
3 ripe sliced bananas
Pudding
directions:
Poke the bottom the pie crust with a fork.
back at 375 for 25 minutes.
Slice bananas and place in the bottom of the pie crust.
Spread Jell-O over the bananas.

name: Banana Crush
ingredients:
2 cups sugar
3 cups water
1-1/2 cup orange juice
1/4 cup lemon juice
3 bananas, mashed
1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice
3 quarts 7 UP
directions:
Combine sugar and water.
Cook to a syrup.
Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients.
Let cool.
Pour into ice cube trays and freeze. 
To serve, put 2-3 ice cubes into a glass and fill with 7 UP.
notes:
Great for parties
Ice cube trays needed

name: Banana Granola Drops
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour
1/2 tsp Baking soda
1/2 tsp Salt
1 tsp Ground cinnamon
1/2 cup Butter or margarine, softened
1 cup Firmly pack brown sugar
1 Egg
1/2 tsp Vanilla
1 cup Mashed bananas
1 cup Granola
directions:
Preheat oven to 375 F
In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
In a large bowl, beat butter and brown sugar until smooth and creamy. Add egg, vanilla and bananas and beat until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix well. Stir in granola.
Drop by Tablespoonfuls, about 2 inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Banana Nutella Ice Cream
ingredients:
4 Bananas, chopped frozen
1/2 cup Nutella
directions:
Peel and slice bananas and put in storage.
Place in freezer for 3 hours or until frozen.
Place bananas and Nutella in food processor and run until contents are smooth and blended.
Can be served like soft serve now or transferred to loaf an and place in freezer for 2 hours to get normal ice cream texture.
notes: Rather than Nutella, add raspberries or other fruits.

name: Banana Quick Bread
ingredients:
1 cup granulated sugar
4 oz. unsalted butter
2 large eggs
3 ripe bananas
1 Tbsp milk
1 tsp ground cinnamon
2 cups flour
1 tsp baking powder
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp salt
directions:
preheat oven to 350 F.
Cream the sugar and butter in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beat well after each addition.
Ina small bowl, mash the bananas with a fork. 
Mix in the milk and cinnamon.
In another bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add the banana mixture to the creamed mixture and stir until combined.
Add dry ingredients, mixing just until flour disappears.
Pour batter into paper lined muffin pans and bake 15-20 minutes, until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

name: Banana Split Cupcakes
ingredients:
429g all-purpose flour
265g caster sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
3 tsp Baking powder
375ml of Milk
125ml Vegetable oil
125g unsalted butter, softened
2 Tbsp Greek yogurt (or sour cream)
1 tsp vanilla extract
2 large eggs
2-3 drops yellow food coloring/gel
2 ripe bananas (mashed)
200 ml Chocolate sauce
Crushed peanuts to sprinkle
20 maraschino cherries
directions:
Preheat your oven to 355F or 320F for a fan forced oven. 
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitter with the paddle attachment, add the flour, baking powder, caster sugar and salt. Turn mixer on low speed and allow it to mix well. 
Add the softened butter and let it mix until it resembles a fine sand like texture.
Next, add milk, eggs, yogurt, yellow food dye, oil and vanilla extract in a large bowl and whisk well.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients in a slow and steady stream. Scrape down the bowl, add mashed banana, and mix for another 20 seconds.
Fill each cupcake line 3/4 of the way. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow them to cool completely before frosting.
To finish off the cupcakes, core the center and fill with chocolate sauce. Fit the end of your piping tip with a 1M tip and frost the cupcakes in a swirl motion. Drizzle chocolate sauce over the top. Sprinkle with crushed peanuts and top with a cherry.
notes:
Frosting - Vanilla Buttercream Frosting
Cake - Recipe can be used for 8" cake tin - adjust baking time to 30-40 minutes.

name: Bar-B-Que Meat Loaf
ingredients:
2 Ibs. ground beef
1 cup fresh bread crumbs
1 onion, finely chopped
1 egg
1-1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 (8 oz.) cans tomato sauce
1/2 cup water
3 Tbsp. vinegar
3 Tbsp. brown sugar
2 Tbsp. mustard
2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
directions:
Mix beef, crumbs, onion, egg, salt, pepper and 1/2 can tomato sauce; form into a loaf.
Combine rest of tomato sauce and all other ingredients.
Stir and pour over loaf.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Baste occasionally.

name: Basic Crepes
ingredients:
4 eggs
1 cup flour
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup water
1/2 tsp salt
2 Tbsp melted butter
directions:
Measure all ingredients in to a bowl with a whisk until smooth.
Season crepe pan with a little butter, margarine, or oil.
On low to medium heat.
Spread a thin layer of crepe batter over the pan.
Cook without browning on both sides, roll over your filling of choice.

name: BBQ Cheddar Pork Burgers with Chipotle Aioli & Potato Wedges
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
2 Tbsp Mayo
1 tsp Chipotle powder
4 Tbp BBQ Sauce
1Tbs Fry Seasoning
10 oz Ground Pork
1/2 cup Cheddar Cheese
2 Potato buns
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion; mince a few slices until you have 2 Tbsp (4 Tbsp for 4 servings). Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve buns. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise with chipotle powder to taste (start with a pinch, then taste and add more from there if desired). Season with salt and pepper; set aside.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add sliced onion and season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, 10-15 minutes. TIP: Lower heat and add a splash of water if onion begins to brown too quickly. Stir in half the BBQ sauce (you'll use the rest later); cook until sauce is warmed through, 1-2 minutes more. Turn off heat; transfer to a medium bowl. Wash out pan.
While onion cooks, toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, half the Fry Seasoning (you'll use the rest later), salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and tender, 20-25 minutes.
While potatoes roast, in a large bowl, combine pork*, minced onion, remaining Fry Seasoning, salt (we used 1/2 tsp; 1 tsp for 4 servings), and pepper. Form into two patties (four patties for 4), each slightly wider than a burger bun.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for onion over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook until browned and cooked through, 4-7 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with cheddar; cover pan until cheese melts. While patties cook, toast buns until golden.
Spread bottom buns with remaining BBQ sauce. Spread top buns with chipotle aioli. Fill buns with patties and caramelized onion. Divide burgers between plates and serve with potato wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1100

name: Bellissimo Bruschetta Burgers with Herby Potato Wedges & Parmesan-Roasted Asparagus
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
4 oz Grape tomatoes
6 oz Asparagus
Chives
Parsley
1 clove Garlic
1 tsp Garlic powder
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
5 tsp balsamic Vinegar
10 oz Ground Beef
1/4 Parmesan cheese
1/2 cup Mozzarella cheese
2 Tbsp Mayo
 2Tbsp Ketchup
2 Brioche Buns
directions:
Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Quarter tomatoes. Thinly slice chives. Pick parsley leaves from stems; finely chop leaves. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Trim and discard bottom 1 inch from asparagus. Place 2 Tbsp butter (4 Tbsp for 4) in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until softened, 10 seconds. Stir in garlic powder and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Toss potatoes on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, half the Italian Seasoning (you'll use the rest in the next step), salt, and pepper. (For 4 servings, spread potatoes out across entire sheet.) Roast on top rack for 10 minutes (you'll add the asparagus then).
While potatoes roast, in a second small bowl, combine tomatoes, vinegar, half the chives, half the chopped parsley, and a pinch of garlic to taste. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside to marinate, stirring occasionally, until ready to serve. In a medium bowl, combine beef*, remaining chives, remaining chopped parsley, remaining Italian Seasoning, salt (we used 3/4 tsp; 1 1/2 tsp for 4 servings), and pepper. Form into two patties (four patties for 4), each slightly wider than a burger bun.
Once potatoes have roasted 10 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Carefully toss asparagus on empty side with a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Push stalks close together and sprinkle with Parmesan. (For 4 servings, leave potatoes roasting and toss asparagus on a second baking sheet; roast on middle rack.) Return to top rack and roast until potatoes are browned, asparagus is tender, and cheese melts, 10-12 minutes more.
While asparagus roasts, heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook to desired doneness, 3-5 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with mozzarella; cover pan until cheese melts. Meanwhile, in a third small bowl, combine ketchup and mayonnaise.
Toast buns; spread cut sides with garlic butter. Fill buns with patties and bruschetta topping. Divide burgers, potato wedges, and asparagus between plates. Serve sauce on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1160

name: Birthday Cake Popcorn
ingredients:
6 Tbsp Popcorn kernels, un-popped (6 to 8 cups popped)
8 oz White chocolate
1/4 cup Vegetable shortening
1 cup Yellow cake mix
1/4 cup Rainbow sprinkles
directions:
Pop popcorn in an air popper, or in a microwave using a paper bag, 3 Tbsp at a time. Transfer to a large bowl.
Melt chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl for 30 second intervals (stirring each time) until melted. Add vegetable mix to the chocolate/shortening mixture and stir then add the sprinkles and stir again.
Pour the warm chocolate mixture over the popcorn, and stir until evenly coated. Use your hands, get messy.
Pour the popcorn onto a baking sheet line with wax paper to harden at room temperature.

name: Black Forest Brownie Cups
ingredients:
Nonstick cooking spray
1 Package Fudge Brownie Mix, Duncan Hines
1/3 cup Butter 
1 Egg
3/4 cup Cherry Pie filling
3/4 cup cool whip
Unsweetened Hersey's Cocoa Powder
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
Spray muffin tins with non stick cooking spray (1 3/4 inch muffin cups.
In a large bowl, stir together brownie mix, butter cut into pieces, and egg. (Mixture should be thick.)
Scoop 1 Tbsp. of the brownie mixture into the muffin tins.
Push the mixture up on the side to make the bowl.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and chill in the refrigerator for 5 minutes or until the middle sinks a bit.
Fill each sunken center with 2 tsp. of Cherry Pie Filling.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick comes out almost completely clean.
top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of Cocoa Powder.
notes: Try topping with ice cream after cooking for 20 minutes instead of Cherry filling.

name: Blueberry Freezer Jam
ingredients:
3 cups blueberry
1/2 cups sugar
2 Tbsp. Lemon Juice
2 Tbsp. pectin
directions:
Blueberries, sugar and lemon juice in saucepan.
Simmer over low heat.
Mash fruit.
Stir in pectin.
Pour in jars and leave a 1/2 inch at the top/
Boil water and then put jars in for 10+ to seal the tops.

name: Blueberry Jam recipe
ingredients:
5 cups blueberries
1/4 cup water
3 cups sugar
1 cup honey (clover)
directions:
Bring blueberries and water to a boil.
Mash and stir for 5 minutes.
Add sugar and honey.
Boil uncovered for 30 minutes on medium heat.
Pour in jars leaving 1/4 inch at the top.
Boil water and put jars in for 10+ min. to seal them.

name: Blueberry Jello Salad
ingredients:
2 small packages of black cherry jello
1 cup boiling water
1 can blueberries
1 small can crushed pineapple
1 large package cool whip
directions:
Thoroughly dissolve jello and boiling water.
Add blueberries and pineapple, juice and all.
Let partially set.
add 1/2 of Cool whip and mix well.
Pour in bowl or pan and cover with remaining Cool whip.
(Sprinkle nuts on top.)
Return to the refrigerator until completely set.
notes: 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

name: Blueberry Smoothies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Milk
2 Tbsp Frozen grape juice concentrate
1/4 cup Frozen blueberries
1/4 - 1/2 cup Vanilla Greek yogurt
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Put milk, juice and blueberries into a blender. Blend for about 30 seconds.
Then add the Greek yogurt and honey. Blend well.
Either serve it as a smoothie or turn it into Popsicles.

name: Braided Cheesy Garlic Bread
ingredients:
Dough:
2 1/2 cups All-purpose flour
2 1/4 tsp Active dry yeast (one packet)
1 1/4 cup Warm milk
1/2 tsp Sugar
1 tsp Salt
Filling:
1 Head of garlic, peeled and minced
4 Tbsp Fresh parsley, finely chopped
1/3 cup Parmesan, grated
1/2 cup Butter, softened
1/2 cup Mozzarella, shredded
directions:
In a bowl, combine warm milk, yeast, and sugar. Once the mixture becomes foamy, gradually mix in the flour and salt. Knead the dough into a smooth ball. Cover and allow the dough to rise for 1 hour in a warm spot.
Meanwhile, make the filling: combine all ingredients in a owl, except the mozzarella. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 350F. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to form a rectangle. Spread the filling over the dough and make sure to leave an inch around the edges. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top.
Roll the dough into a log lengthwise. Slice the roll in half lengthwise leaving one end (about 1 inch) intact. Twist the two sides into a braid, while trying to keep the cut sides facing up.
Grease a loaf pan and place the braided dough inside. Cover and allow to rise again for about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Uncover, brush with olive oil, and bake for about 30-35 minutes.

name: Bread Sticks
ingredients:
1 Tbsp. yeast
1-1/2 cup warm water
1 Tbsp. honey
1 tsp. salt
3-1/2 - 4 cup flour
1/2 cup margarine
directions:
Melt butter in 9x10 inch pan.
In a bowl, dissolve yeast in water, stir in honey.
Mix salt and flour; stir into water mixture.
Knead dough for 10 minutes.
Roll into a rectangle the size of the pan.
Sprinkle with garlic salt or onion salt or sesame seeds and Parmesan cheese.
Let rise for 15 minutes.
Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Bread Sticks
ingredients:
Dough:
1 tsp Sugar
1 envelope Instant yeast
4 cups Bread flour
1.5 tsp Salt
1.5 cups Warm water
2 Tbsp Olive oil
Topping:
1/4 tsp Garlic powder
1/2 tsp Salt
4 Tbsp Butter
1/2 cup finely Grated Parmesan cheese
directions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add water, sugar, and yeast. allow to,stand for 5 minutes, or until yeast bubbles up.
Add flour, salt, olive oil, and remaining water to yeast mixture. Using the dough hook attachment, mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl to form a ball. If the mixture is too wet, add a Tbsp of flour at a time until this happens.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap or towel, and allow to rest in a warm place until dough doubles in volume (approx. 1.5 hours).
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Divide dough in two, and then cut into eight pieces. Using your hands roll each piece into a cylinder. Using a sharp paring knife, cut the dough into eight equal 10" bread sticks. Gently shape the dough so that they look like bread sticks, and transfer to a lined baking sheet coated in cooking spray. Make sure to slightly space them apart.
Bake for 7-8 minutes, until just slightly golden.
Melt butter with salt and garlic powder. Brush over warm bread sticks, and top with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.

name: Breadsticks
ingredients:
Dough:
1 tsp Sugar
1 Envelope instant yeast
4 cups Bread flour
1.5 tsp Salt
1.5 cups Warm water
2 Tbsp Olive oil
Topping:
1/4 tsp Garlic powder
1/2 tsp Salt
4 Tbsp Butter
1/2 cup Finely grated Parmesan cheese
directions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add water, sugar, and yeast. Allow to stand for 5 minutes, or until yeast bubbles up.
Add flour, salt, olive oil, and remaining water to yeast mixture. Using the dough hook attachment, mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl to form a ball. If the mixture is too wet, add a Tbsp of flour at a time.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap or towel, and allow to rest in a warm place until dough doubles in volume (approx. 1.5 hours).
Preheat oven to 425F.
Divide dough into two, and then cut into eight pieces. Using your hands roll each piece into a cylinder. Using a sharp paring knife, cut the dough so that they look like bread sticks, and transfer to a lined baking sheet coated in cooking spray. Make sure to slightly space them apart.
Bake for 7-8 minutes, until just slightly golden.
Melt butter with salt and garlic powder. Brush over warm bread sticks, and top with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.

name: Breakfast Ramekins
ingredients:
Prosciutto
Cherry tomatoes, halved
Eggs
Cracked pepper
Grated Parmesan
Chives, to garnish
directions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Layer the bottom of your ramekin with prosciutto. Toss a handful of halved cherry tomatoes, add an egg and season with pepper and grated Parmesan.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, depending on how well-done you like your egg yolks.
Garnish with more grated Parmesan and chopped chives.

name: Broccoli Cheese Soup
ingredients:
1 Tbsp melted butter
1/2 medium onion chopped
1/4 cup melted butter
1/4 cup flour
2 cups half and half
2 cups chicken broth
1/2 Ibs fresh broccoli florets or a 12 oz. bag of frozen broccoli
1 cup carrot, shredded
8 oz. cheddar cheese, shredded
salt and pepper
directions:
Saute onion in Tbsp butter until translucent; set aside.
Cook 1/4 cup butter and flour using a whisk over medium heat for 3-5 minutes.
Stir constantly and add half and half.
Add chicken broth; simmer for 20 minutes.
Add broccoli, carrots and onions.
Cook over low heat 20-25 minutes, or until broccoli is tender.
Put portions into blender and puree until smooth.
Retur to heat; add cheese and season.
notes: cook time 1 hour

name: Brown Sugar Bourbon Pork Chops with Apple Pan Sauce, Scallion Mashed Potatoes & Roasted Brussels Sprouts
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
8 oz Brussel sprouts
1 Apple
2 Scallions
10 oz Pork chops
10.8 grams Brown sugar bourbon seasoning
1 Chicken stock concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour cream
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces. Place in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain and return potatoes to pot. Keep covered off heat until ready to mash.
While potatoes cook, trim and halve Brussels sprouts lengthwise. Toss on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast until lightly browned, 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, halve, core, and dice apple into 1/4-inch pieces. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens.
Pat pork* dry with paper towels; prick all over with a fork or knife. Season all over with McCormick Grill Mates Brown Sugar Bourbon Seasoning. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer pork to a plate. Wipe out pan. TIP: If the pork begins to brown too quickly, reduce heat to medium.
Heat 1 Tbsp butter and a drizzle of oil in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add apple and scallion whites; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until golden, 4-6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate, 1/2 cup water, and 1/2 tsp sugar. Cook until sauce is thickened and apple is tender, 5-7 minutes. In the last 2 minutes, return pork to pan until warmed through. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat. 4 SERVINGS: Use 2 Tbsp butter, 3/4 cup water, and 1 tsp sugar.
Mash potatoes until mostly smooth. Stir in scallion greens, sour cream, 1 Tbsp butter, and a splash of reserved potato cooking liquid. Season with salt and pepper. Keep covered until ready to serve. 4 SERVINGS: Use 2 Tbsp butter. TIP: If needed, add more reserved potato cooking liquid a splash at a time until potatoes are smooth and creamy.
Divide pork, mashed potatoes, and Brussels sprouts between plates. Top pork with apple pan sauce and serve.
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 660
Switch out brussels sprouts for Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Vinegar and Honey recipe

name: Bulgogi Pork Tenderloin with Roasted Carrots & Lemony Rice
ingredients:
12 oz Carrots
1 Lemon
2 Scallions
1/2 cup Jasmine rice
10 oz Pork tenderloin
4 oz Bulgogi
1 Tbsp Sesame seeds
directions:
Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and cut carrots into 1/2-inch-thick rounds. Zest and quarter lemon. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens.
In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups for 4 servings), and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, toss carrots on one side of a baking sheet with a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. (For 4 servings, spread out across entire sheet.) Roast on top rack for 10 minutes (you'll add the pork then).
Meanwhile, pat pork* dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add pork; sear, turning occasionally, until browned all over, 4-8 minutes. Once carrots have roasted 10 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Flip carrots and carefully place seared pork on empty side. (For 4 servings, place pork on a second sheet; roast on middle rack.) Return to top rack until pork is cooked through and carrots are tender, 10-12 minutes more. TIP: If carrots are done before pork, remove from sheet and continue roasting pork.
When pork and carrots have 5 minutes left, melt 1 Tbsp butter in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add scallion whites and cook until fragrant, 1-2 minutes. Stir in bulgogi sauce and 1 Tbsp water. Bring to a simmer, stirring, until warmed through, 2-3 minutes. Turn off heat. TIP: If sauce is too thick, stir in a splash more water.
Fluff rice with a fork. Stir in half the lemon zest (add more zest if you like), 1 Tbsp butter, and a squeeze of lemon juice; season with salt and pepper. Thinly slice pork crosswise. Divide rice, pork, and carrots between plates. Drizzle pork with sauce. Sprinkle with scallion greens and sesame seeds. Serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 700

name: Butter Ball Cookies
ingredients:
1/2 Ib. real butter
4-6 Tbsp. powdered sugar
2 cup flour
1 tsp. vanilla
directions:
Mix all ingredients.
Roll into walnut size balls.
Bake for 15-18 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cool on wire racks.
Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar.
notes: 1 cup walnuts, chopped

name: Butter Cream / Chocolate Frosting
ingredients:
1/3 cup butter or margarine
4-1/2 cups powdered sugar
1/4 cup milk
1-1/2 tsp. vanilla
Food coloring optional
directions:
In a mixing bowl beat butter till fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar. beat well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup of milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining powdered sugar.
Beat in additional milk, if needed, to reach spreading consistency.
If desired, tint with food coloring.
notes:
For chocolate frosting...
beat 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder to butter.
Reduce powdered sugar to 4 cups.

name: Cafe Rio Rice
ingredients:
12 cups uncooked rice
1/4 cup butter or margarine
24 minced cloves garlic
1 tsp. freshly squeezed lime juice
1/2 cup chicken bouillon granules
34 cups water
1/2 cup sugar
1/4 cup freshly squeezed lime juice
1-1/2 cups freshly chopped cilantro
directions:
In sauce pan, combine rice, butter, garlic 1 tsp. lime, chicken broth and water.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and cook on low for 15-20 minutes, until rice is tender.
Remove from heat.
In a small bowl combine lime juice, sugar and cilantro.
Pour over hot cooked rice and mix in as you fluff the rice.

name: Candied Orange Peels
ingredients:
2 Large Navel oranges
1 cups Water
1 cup Granulated sugar, plus more for coating
directions:
Boil a pot of water. Thoroughly wash the oranges to get rid of any waxy residue. 
Slice off both ends, and then follow the curve of the oranges to slice off the peel. Try to keep most of the pith intact.
Slice off any remaining fruit flesh, and slice lengthwise into strips. Add the peels to the water and soften for at least 5 minutes. Drain and set aside on a rack.
In a saucepan, combine water and sugar. Stir until dissolved and then heat to boil. Once boiling, add the peels and reduce to a simmer. 
Allow the syrup to thicken, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove peels and spread evenly across a cooling rack. allow to dry for at least 2 hours. You can speed dry them in the oven at the lowest temperature until the peels feel slightly tacky.
Coat the peels in sugar, and allow to dry or serve right away.

name: Caramel Candy Brownies
ingredients:
Filling: 
14 oz. Caramels, unwrapped
2 Tbsp Milk
Base and Topping:
4 squares (1 oz. each) unsweetened chocolate
3/4 cup Butter
2 cups Granulated sugar
3 Eggs
1 Tbsp Milk
1 cup All-purpose flour
1 cup Chopped pecans, divided
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a microwave-safe bowl, on medium power, heat caramels and milk for 3 minutes. Remove from oven and stir until melted and smooth. (Alternatively, heat caramels and milk in a saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth and melted.) Keep warm while preparing brownie batter.
Base and topping: in a large sauce pan, over low heat, melt chocolate and butter, stirring constantly, until smooth. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. When mixture has cooled, stir in sugar. Add eggs and beat until just blended. Stir in milk. Blend in flour. Stir in nuts.
Spread half the batter evenly and prepared pan. Spoon filling over batter. Sprinkle 3/4 cups of the nuts over top. Drop remaining batter by spoonfuls over nuts, then sprinkle with remaining nuts. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into squares.
notes: 9-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Caramel Oatmeal Bars
ingredients:
Base:
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour
3/4 cup Packed brown sugar
1/2 cup quick-cooking rolled oats
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1 egg, beaten
1/2 cup chopped pecans
Topping:
1 1/4 cups Milk or sweetened condensed milk
25 Soft caramels, unwrapped
1/4 cup Butter or margarine
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Base: in a large bowl, mix together flour, brown sugar and oats. Using two knives, a pastry blender or your fingers, cut butter in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add egg and mix until blended. Stir in pecans. Set aside 1 1/2 cups and press remainder evenly into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned. Place pan on rack to cool slightly.
Topping: In a sauce pan, over low heat, melt caramels with milk, stirring constantly until smooth. Pour over baked base. Sprinkle reserved crumb mixture evenly over top. Bake 20 to 25 minutes longer, until bubbly and golden brown. Place pan on a rack to cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Caramel Peanut Cup Bars
ingredients:
Base:
1 Package yellow cake mix
1/2 cup Butter or margarine, softened
1 Egg
20 miniature Peanut butter cups chopped.
Topping:
2 1/2 cups Caramel sundae sauce
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/4 cup Peanut butter
1 cup Chopped salted peanuts
1 container of ready to serve chocolate frosting
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Base: in a large bowl, mix together cake mix, butter and egg, until smooth. Fold and peanut butter cups. Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Place pan on a wire rack to cool slightly.
Topping: in a sauce pan, over low heat, stir together caramel sauce, corn starch and peanut butter. Increase heat and bring to a boil; cook, stirring constantly, for two minutes, until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 cup of the peanuts and spread evenly over warm base.
Bake 6 to 8 minutes longer or until almost set. Place pan on a rack to cool completely. Spread frosting over top. Sprinkle with remaining peanuts. Chill at least one hour before cutting into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Caramels
ingredients:
2 cups sugar
2 cups light corn syrup
1 tsp. vanilla
1 pat margarine
1 (13 oz.) can evaporated milk
directions:
Combine sugar and syrup.
Bring to a boil and add butter.
Add milk, a little at a time.
Continue cooking slowly so boiling never ceases, stirring constantly.
Boil to firm ball stage, 242 degrees.
Add vanilla (and pour over nuts which have been scattered at the bottom of a well oiled cookie sheet.)
Let stand several hours.
Turn out onto wax paper and cut into squares.
Wrap in wax paper.
notes: 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

name: Cavatappi Beef Ragu with Parmesan & Parsley
ingredients:
3 oz Carrots
1/4 oz Parsley
6 oz Cavatappi pasta
10 oz Ground beef
1 Tbsp Italian seasoning
14 oz Marinara sauce
2 Tbsp Cream cheese
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and finely chop carrot. Pick parsley leaves from stems; roughly chop leaves.
Once water is boiling, add cavatappi to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Drain.
While cavatappi cooks, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add carrot; cook, stirring, until browned and tender, 6-8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Increase heat under pan with carrot to medium high and add a drizzle of oil. Push carrot to one side of pan. Add beef* to empty side. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned. Sprinkle with Italian Seasoning. Cook, stirring, until beef is cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Season generously with salt and pepper. Stir carrot and beef to combine.
Stir in marinara and 1/3 cup water (1/2 cup for 4 servings). Reduce to a simmer and cook until sauce has slightly thickened, 3-4 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Stir in cream cheese until thoroughly combined. Add drained cavatappi, 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4), and half the chopped parsley; stir until pasta is warmed through, 1-2 minutes. (For 4, if pan is too small, carefully transfer everything to pot used for pasta.) Season with salt and pepper.
 Divide pasta between bowls. Top with Parmesan and remaining chopped parsley. Serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 970

name: Challah Scarf
ingredients:
1/2 cup lukewarm water
1/4 cup Sugar
1 Tbsp Active dry yeast
1/4 Honey
100g Melted butter, slightly cooled
4 Egg yolks
3 eggs, at room temp
4 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
2 1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Combine the water and a pinch of the sugar in a bowl. Sprinkle the yeast over top and set aside until foamy (5-6 min). Add the remaining sugar, honey, butter, egg yolks and 2 of the whole eggs and using an electric mixer, beat to combine. Add half the flour and the salt and mix at a low speed until smooth. Add remaining flour and combine. Pour onto a floured surface and knead by hand until the dough is smooth and elastic, 8 minutes. Place the dough into an oiled bowl and cover the top with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm draft free place until doubled in size, 1.5 hours.
Remove the dough from the bowl and cut off a small amount for the fringe of the scarf, set aside. Using a scale, begin to cut 9 even pieces measuring each piece and adding/removing dough as needed. Once you have divided the dough evenly, roll each piece into a thin snake roughly 20 inches in length. Connect all nine strands at the top of your board by pinching then together. 
To braid, start with the most right strand and place over the 2 left adjacent strands. Then take the same strand under the next 2 left adjacent strands. Do the same with the left most strand. Repeat the process and a braid will soon appear.
Once finished, tuck all the strands together and decorate with remaining dough creating the fringe and seams. Cover loosely with a tea towel and let rise for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350F. Whisk remaining egg and brush the loaf. Bake for 35-40 minutes covering with foil after 30 minutes to prevent over browning. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.

name: Cheese and Potato Soup
ingredients:
2 Tbsp Vegetable oil
1/2 cup Chopped celery
1/2 cup Chopped carrot
1/2 cup Chopped onions
1/2 tsp Dried thyme
3 Tbsp All-purpose flour
2 cups Chicken broth
2 cups Milk
1 10-12 oz Russet potato, peeled, diced
1 cup Shredded sharp cheddar cheese
1/2 cup Chopped ham
Chopped fresh parsley
directions:
Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. 
Add celery, carrot, onion and thyme and saute until vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle flour over and stir 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth, then milk.
Add potato and bring soup to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer soup until potato is tender, and 20 minutes.
Add cheese 1/3 cup at a time, stirring until melted and smooth after each addition. Mix in ham
Season soup to taste with Tabasco, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

name: Cheese Ball
ingredients:
2 (8 oz.) cream cheese 
2 small pkg. chipped beef (lunch meat thin sliced)
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
2 Tbsp. chives or chopped green onions
1 Tbsp. milk
1 Tbsp. Accent
directions:
Chop up the beef into little squares. 
Mix all ingredients together except 1 package of chopped beef.
Shape into 2 balls and roll in remaining chipped beef.
Refrigerate until set.

name: Cheese Sauce
ingredients:
1 oz. Butter
1 oz. flour
2 Cups Milk
2 Cups Cheese
salt
pepper
directions:
Melt butter.
Whisk in flour and cook on medium for 2-3 minutes.
Whisk in milk and bring to a boil stirring constantly.
Once boiling, reduce temperature to a simmer and simmer fro 10 minutes stirring occasionally.
Remove sauce from heat and whisk in cheese and season with salt and pepper.

name: Cheesecake Swirl Brownies
ingredients:
Filling:
4 oz. Cream cheese, softened
2 Tbsp Granulated sugar
1 Egg
Base and Topping:
1 cup All-purpose flour
1/2 cup Unsweetened cocoa powder, sifted
3/4 cup Granulated sugar
1/2 tsp Baking powder
1/2 cup Mini chocolate chips
1/4 cup Chopped walnuts
1/4 cup Vegetable oil
1/4 cup Unsweetened applesauce
1/4 cup Milk
1 tsp Vanilla
1 Egg
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg until incorporated. Set aside.
Base and Topping:In a large bowl, mix together flour, cocoa, sugar and baking powder. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts.
In another small bowl, whisk together oil, applesauce, milk, vanilla and egg until well blended. Add to flour mixture and mix until combined. Reserve one cup of mixture for topping and spread remainder evenly and prepared pan. Spread cream cheese filling evenly over batter. Drop reserved batter, by spoonfuls, over filling.
Run a knife through the batter at 1-inch intervals across the width of the pan, to create a marbling effect. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into squares.
notes: 8-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Cheesy Rotini and Tuna
ingredients:
2 cup Uncooked Broccoli
2 cans of Tuna (drained and flaked)
3 cup Frozen Broccoli
1 cup velveeta cheese
1/2 cup Light sour cream
directions:
Cook pasta as directed on package.
Mix remaining ingredients in microwavable safe 2-qt bowl.
Microwave on high 3-4 minutes or until heated through, stirring after 2 minutes.
Drain pasta and mix with tuna mixture.
notes: Broccoli can be substituted with other vegetables.

name: Cheesy Turkey & Poblano Tostadas with Pico de Gallo & Smoky Crema
ingredients:
1 Red onion
1 Roma tomato
1/4 oz Cilantro
1 Lemon
1 Poblano pepper
10 oz Ground turkey
1 Tbsp Southwest spice blend
1 tsp Chili powder
1 Chicken stock concentrate
6 Flour tortillas
1/2 cup Mexican blend
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1 tsp Smoked paprika
1 tsp Hot sauce
directions:
Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve and peel onion; thinly slice one half. Finely chop remaining onion until you have 2 Tbsp. (For 4, thinly slice whole onion; finely chop a few slices until you have 3 Tbsp). Dice tomato. Roughly chop cilantro. Quarter lemon. Halve, core, and thinly slice poblano into strips.
In a small bowl, combine chopped onion, tomato, cilantro, juice from half the lemon, and a pinch of salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine paprika and sour cream. Add a pinch of salt and pepper to taste.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add turkey* and Southwest Spice; cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-5 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step). Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for turkey over medium-high heat. Add sliced onion and poblano. Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and tender, 5-7 minutes. Season with chili powder, salt, and pepper. Return turkey to pan; stir to combine. Stir in stock concentrate and 1/4 cup water (1/2 cup for 4 servings). Cook until mixture is thickened and saucy, 1-2 minutes. TIP: If mixture seems dry, add another splash of water.
Meanwhile, drizzle tortillas with 1 Tbsp oil (2 Tbsp for 4 servings); brush or rub to coat all over. Arrange on a baking sheet in a single layer. Gently prick each tortilla in a few places with a fork. (For 4, divide between 2 baking sheets; toast on top and middle racks, flipping tortillas and swapping baking sheet positions halfway through toasting.) Toast on top rack, carefully flipping tortillas halfway through, until lightly golden, 4-5 minutes per side. TIP: Watch carefully to avoid burning.
Divide tortillas between plates; evenly sprinkle with Mexican cheese. Top with turkey mixture, pico de gallo, and smoky crema. Drizzle with hot sauce to taste. Serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min. Calories: 880

name: Cherry Vanilla Ice Cream
ingredients:
400 ml Whipping cream
2 cups Sour cherries (from a jar), strained
4 Eggs
140g Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla extract
Dash cherry extract
directions:
Place the whipping cream and 1 cup of cherries in a small pot and set to medium heat. Once the cream begins to simmer, remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. strain to separate the cream and cherries. Whip the whipping cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Then place the cream in the fridge.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add the sugar, vanilla and cherry extract. Beat well with an electric mixer until the mixture forms a ribbon when the whisk is lifted and the ribbon remains on the surface of the mixture for a few seconds. Add half of the egg mixture to the cream, and whisk together. 
Once they are fully combined, add the remaining egg mixture and gently fold the mixture together and combine.  Add the soaked cherries and additional 1 cup of cherries and fold to combine. Make sure to be gentle and keep the mixture as airy as possible.
Pour the ice cream into a Tupperware container, and seal with the lid. Place this in the freezer for 7-8 hours to chill and set.

name: Cherry-Almond Oatmeal
ingredients:
4 cups Vanilla almond milk
1 cup Steel-cut oats
1 cup Dried cherries
1/3 cup Packed brown sugar
1/2 tsp. Salt
1/2 tsp. Ground cinnamon
Additional vanilla almond milk, optional
directions:
In a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker coated with cooking spray, combine first 6 ingredients. Lock lid; make sure vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high and set time for 12 minutes.
When finished cooking, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes; quick-release any remaining pressure according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve with additional almond milk if desired.

name: Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients:
6 boneless chicken breasts halves
1 onion, chopped
6 mushrooms, sliced or chopped
1 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 6-oz. cans tomato paste
1 clove garlic, minced
1 tsp. oregano
1/2 tsp. basil
1/2 tsp. celery seed
1 bay leaf
1/4 cup chicken broth
directions:
Cut chicken into serving size pieces.
Put chicken and onions into crockpot.
Mix the rest of the ingredients together and pour over chicken.
Cover and cook on low 7-9 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
Remove bay leaf.
Serve with noodles as a topping.

name: Chicken Divan
ingredients:
3 chicken breasts ( or 2 cans cooked chicken)
8 oz. frozen broccoli
1 can cream of chicken soup
1/2 cup whipping cream
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1 tsp. lemon juice 
1 cup grated cheddar cheese
2 cups minute rice
directions:
Mix chicken soup, mayonnaise, and lemon juice for sauce.
Layer broccoli and chicken in a 9 x 13" dish.
Pour sauce over broccoli and chicken.
Cover with grated cheddar cheese.
Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes
Serve over minute rice.
notes: Delicious and filling!

name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients:
1 Tbsp. cornstarch
2 tsp. chili powder
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. paprika
1 tsp. sugar
3/4  tsp. crushed chicken bouillon cube
1/2 tsp. onion powder
1/4 tsp. garlic powder
1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
1/4 tsp. cumin
1 pound of chicken strips
1 cup each, green, yellow, and red pepper strips 
1/2 cup onion strips 
Extra virgin olive oil
Flour tortillas 
tin foil
sour cream
directions:
Combine corn starch, chili powder, salt, paprika, sugar, chicken bouillon cube, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and cumin.
Add 1 cup of water and put in saucepan to heat. 
Add chicken strips and mix well. Cook until chicken is done and water evaporates to just a nice sauce. While cooking, add more water if needed. Set aside.
Place flour tortillas in tin foil and seal. put in preheated 350 degree oven  for about 10 minutes. Turn heat off but do not remove or unwrap tortillas until you are ready to serve them.
Coat bottom of frying pan with olive oil and add onions and peppers. Cook till tender to the bite.
Add onions and peppers to chicken mixture and heat thoroughly. When hot, take flour tortillas and put chicken and vegetables in the middle of the tortilla. Fold both sides over the middle and serve with sour cream on top.
notes: Make sure chicken is cooked well and not pink inside.

name: Chicken Nuggets
ingredients:
For the Chicken:
1 lb Boneless skinless chicken thighs
1 tsp Garlic powder
Salt and Pepper to taste
For the Dredge:
1/2 cup All-purpose flour
2 Large eggs, whisked
3/4 cup Plain panko
1/3 cup Plain fine bread crumbs
2 Tbsp Grated Parmesan
2 Tbsp Melted butter
Salt and Pepper to taste
Dipping sauce:
2 Tbsp Dijon mustard
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Honey
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Spread panko across a baking sheet and bake for a few minutes until golden. Set aside to cool.
In a food processor, add chicken ingredients and blend until the mixture becomes a pasta and set aside.
Prep the dredge station: flour in one dish, eggs in another dish, and panko, fine bread crumbs, Parmesan, salt, pepper, and butter combined in another dish. Scoop about 2 Tbsp of chicken and form into nuggets.
Heat the oven to 450 degrees. Coat each nugget in flour, then dip into eggs, and into the crumbs.
Place on a wire rack and bake or about 15-20 minutes or until crispy and cooked in the center.
Mix the sauce ingredients together and eat!

name: Chicken Roll-ups
ingredients:
1/2 onion diced
2 celery sticks chopped
1 small can (2/3 cup) Mushrooms
4 Tbsp. melted butter
1/2 tsp. pepper
8 oz. cream cheese, softened
2 cup cubed chicken
2-3 cans crescent rolls
6 Tbsp. melted butter

1 cup chicken broth
1 can cream of chicken soup
directions:
Saute the onion, celery and mushrooms in small amount of butter.
Add to 4 Tbsp. butter, pepper, cream cheese and chicken.
Roll the rolls thinner than normal and fill with 1/4 cup filling.
Fold and dip in the melted butter.
Roll in bread crumbs and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Make a gravy with chicken broth and cream of chicken soup to serve other rolls.

name: Chicken Salad Sandwiches
ingredients:
6-8 chicken breasts, cooked and chopped
2 cup chopped celery (4 large ribs)
1 bunch green onions, chopped
2 Tbsp. chopped dill weed
*(1/2 cup slivered almonds)
3 eggs, boiled and chopped
1 cup mayonnaise
directions:
Cook the chicken for 10-15 minutes.
Mix ingredients together and chill for several hours.
Fills 4 dozen dollar rolls.
notes: almonds are optional

name: Chicken Sausage Cavatappi Bolognese with Zucchini & Parmesan
ingredients:
1 Zucchini
1Yellow onion
1Tbsp Italian seasoning
6 oz Cavatappi pasta
9 oz Italian chicken sausage mix
1.5 oz Tomato pasta
1 Chicken stock concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim and halve zucchini lengthwise; cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick half-moons. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion.
Toss zucchini on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, half the Italian Seasoning (you'll use the rest later), and a pinch of salt and pepper. Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until browned and tender, 14-16 minutes. Tent with foil to keep warm.
Once water is boiling, add cavatappi to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1.5 cups pasta cooking water (2 cups for 4 servings), then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5-6 minutes. Add sausage* and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-4 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step).
Add tomato paste and remaining Italian Seasoning to pan. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in stock concentrate, 1 cup reserved pasta cooking water (1.5 cups for 4 servings), and a big pinch of salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer; cook until sauce has slightly thickened and sausage is cooked through, 2-3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium low.
Stir drained cavatappi, roasted zucchini, sour cream, and 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) into pan until thoroughly combined. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved cooking water a splash at a time until pasta is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide pasta between bowls. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 820

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients:
1 lb boneless skinless chicken (cut into strips)
2 cups of frozen stir-fry veggies
1 tsp. soy sauce
2 tsp. Asian seasoning
2 Tbsp. oil
directions:
In 1g. skillet stir-fry chicken in oil on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Add vegetables, soy sauce and seasoning; stir-fry for 5 minutes, until chicken is done.

name: Chicken with Mushrooms and Zucchini
ingredients:
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts
Cornstarch, for dusting
1 Tbsp vegetable or canola oil
1 Tbsp sesame oil
8 ounces white button mushrooms, stems removed and quartered
4 small zucchini, cut into 1-inch chunks
2 Tbsp soy sauce
1 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
2 garlic cloves, minced
1/2 tsp ground ginger or 1 tsp fresh ginger, finely minced
directions:
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Toss them into a ziploc bag along with 2-3 Tbsp cornstarch. Seal the bag and toss until the chicken is lightly coated. Heat the oil and sesame oil in a large, non-stick skillet until rippling and hot. Add the chicken and cook until the chicken is browned on all sides and cooked through, 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken to a plate.
Add the zucchini and mushrooms to the hot skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring often. Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger. Stir to coat the vegetables and continue to cook until the mushrooms and zucchini are tender, 2-3 minutes. Add the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine and heat through. Serve over hot, cooked rice.
notes: Hoisin Sauce: also, sometimes I add a touch of hoisin sauce to round out the flavors.

name: Chimichangas
ingredients:
1 lb. hamburger
1/3 cup chopped onion
1/3 cup chopped green pepper
1 16 oz. can re-fried beans
1/2 can El Pato Sauce (hot- optional)
1/2 cup shredded cheese
1 pkg. flour Tortillas
directions:
Brown hamburger, and drain fat.
Add next five ingredients and mix well.
Take off burner.
Heat oil in frying pan- 1/2 inch deep in frying pan- on medium- High.
Put 1/4 cup hamburger mixture on tortilla.
Fold and fry until light brown on both sides.
Top of with lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream.

name: Chocolate Banana Mini Pies
ingredients:
3 Ripe bananas, peeled
1 tsp Vanilla extract
1/4 cup Peanut butter
1/2 cup Dark semi-sweet chocolate, finely chopped
1/4 cup Dark semi-sweet chocolate, for drizzling on top
5 Mini graham cracker pie crusts
directions:
Place bananas, vanilla and peanut butter in a food processor and puree until they reach a creamy texture. Add 1/2 cup chopped chocolate and mix one more time.
Scoop mixture into individual pie crusts and freeze for at least 2 hours.
When ready to serve, place reserved 1/4 cup chocolate in a glass bowl and microwave until melted.
Plate each pie and drizzle melted chocolate on top of each one. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Banana Popsicles
ingredients:
2 Bananas
2 Tbsp Cocoa powder
2 Tbsp Vanilla yogurt, plus extra for filling
2 Tbsp Oatmeal
2 tsp Chia seeds
Berries
directions:
In a food processor blend the bananas, cocoa, yogurt, oatmeal and chia seeds until smooth and ice cream-like, in a separate small bowl add a handful of berries and crush with a fork.
To assemble, layer the banana mixture into Popsicle molds coming half way to the top. Tap on the counter to ensure this layer is level and doesn't have air bubbles.
Layer the berries in each mold and then finish with any remaining vanilla yogurt. Stick the Popsicle stick into the center of each mold and freeze for 2 hours.

name: Chocolate Crater Cupcakes
ingredients:
1 package (19.5 ounces) dark chocolate cake mix, Duncan Hines
1 1/3 cup chocolate milk mix, Nesquik
1/2 cup vegetable oil
3 eggs
4 ounces cream cheese 
1/4 cup butter
1 cup powdered sugar
5 Tbsp miniature semisweet chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
If you want, mix 1 cup of sweetened shredded coconut with 1 cup of chopped walnuts and spoon about 1 Tbsp of the mixture into the bottom of the tins.
In a large mixing bowl, beat cake mix, chocolate mix, oil, eggs with an electric mixer on low for 30 seconds.
Scrape the sides and beat for 2 minutes on medium.
spoon mixture into the tins half full.
In a medium mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and butter with an electronic mixer on low until well mixed.
Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth.
Spoon cream cheese mixture onto the batter.
Sprinkle cream cheese mixture in each cup with 1/2 tsp of the miniature chocolate chips.
Bake for 20-24 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centers of the cake part comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes.

name: Chocolate Frosting
ingredients:
1 stick butter or margarine
4 Tbsp. Cocoa
6 Tbsp. water
1/2 bag powdered sugar
1 tsp. vanilla extract
directions:
Melt butter, cocoa and water and bring t a boil.
Remove from heat and add powdered sugar.
Add vanilla extract.
Frost cake when the cake is cool.
notes: For Chocolate Sheet Cake

name: Chocolate Lava Cookies
ingredients:
2 cups All-purpose Flour
3/4 cup Cocoa powder
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking soda
1 cup Vegetable shortening
1/2 cup Sugar, plus 1/2 cup for dusting
1/2 cup Brown sugar
2 Large eggs
1 tsp Vanilla
1 (12-oz. jar) Hot Fudge sauce
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat.
In a medium bowl, combine lour, cocoa powder, salt and baking soda. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together shortening and sugars with a hand-held mixer. Add eggs one at a time, and stir in vanilla. Add dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Scoop approximately 1/4 cup of dough in your hand and flatten. Pour approximately 1/2 tsp of hot fudge sauce in the center and wrap dough around it to form a ball. Repeat steps until all dough is used.
Toss dough balls in sugar and bake for 6 to 8 minutes until set. Cool cookies on a rack and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Orange Cake
ingredients:
For the cake:
2 Oranges
6 Large eggs
1 1/2 cups Granulated sugar
2 cups Almond meal/flour
1/2 cup Cocoa
1 tsp Baking powder
1/2 tsp Baking soda
1/2 tsp Salt

For the glaze:
3/4 cup Semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 Tbsp Honey
3 Tbsp Unsalted butter
1 Tbsp Cointreau or Grand Marnier?
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place oranges in a pot, cover with water, bring to a boil and allow to simmer for 1-1 1/2 hours, until fork tender. Cool, cut open and remove pips/seeds if any.
Place oranges in a food processor and puree until pulpy. Add remaining ingredients, and blitz until completely incorporated. 
Grease a square pie pan with butter, and line with parchment paper. Pour batter into pan, and place in oven for 50-60 minutes, or until middle of cake is firm to the touch.
Allow to cool to room temperature before un-molding.
Place ingredients for glaze in a heat-proof bowl over a saucepan of barely simmering water. Stir until completely melted.
Pour over cake, and garnish with orange zest.

name: Chocolate Sheet Cake
ingredients:
2 cups flour
2 cups sugar
2 sticks butter or margarine
1 cup water
2 Tbsp. cocoa
2 eggs
1/4 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 cup buttermilk OR 1/2 cup milk and 1 tsp. vinegar
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. vanilla extract
directions:
Mix flour and sugar together in a bowl.
In a sauce pan, bring butter, water and cocoa to a boil.
Pour the mixture into the flour and sugar.
Add eggs, cinnamon, butter milk, baking soda, vanilla extract.
Beat until smooth and pour into ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 400 for 20 minutes.
pour on Chocolate Frosting. (next page for recipe.)
notes: bake in cookie sheet pan.

name: Chocolate Shell
ingredients:
1 cup Coconut oil
1 cup Cocoa powder
3 Tbsp Maple / Agave / Honey
Pinch of Sea Salt
directions: Combine and put on top of ice cream.
notes: Put on ice cream or dip inch sized banana ice cream balls into chocolate and refreeze.

name: Chocolate Truffle Pie Filling
ingredients:
Pie Crust
12 oz. bittersweet chocolate
1/2 cup unsalted butter
3 eggs
3/4 cup heavy cream
1/3 cup sugar
2 tsp. vanilla extract
1/2 tsp. salt
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook empty pie crust for 15 minutes.
Cut butter in slices and melt in a sauce pan with chocolate.
When smooth, remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix everything else.
When the chocolate has cooled, mix into the previous mixture and pour it into the the pie crust.
Bake pie for 30-35 minutes.

name: Chocolate-Dipped Chips
ingredients:
1 cup Ruffled potato chips
4 oz. Chopped chocolate
Ground chili flakes to taste
directions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate in 15 second intervals, while stirring in between. Di[ each chip halfway and place on a tray, lined with parchment or Silpat. While wet, sprinkle the chocolate with chili flakes. Allow to harden.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Chocolate-Drizzled Peanut Butter Bars
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour
1 tsp Baking powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1 cup Packed brown sugar
1/2 cup Granulated sugar
1/2 cup Butter or margarine, softened
1/4 cup Smooth Peanut butter
2 Eggs
1 tsp Vanilla
1/2 cup Chopped unsalted peanuts
24 Miniature peanut butter cups, cut into quarters
Chocolate Drizzle:
1/4 cup Semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 tsp Butter or margarine
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large bowl, beat sugars, butter and peanut butter until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Stir in vanilla. Blend in flour and sugar. Stir in peanuts. Spread evenly in prepared pan.
Sprinkle pieces of peanut butter cups over batter and press down slightly. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until tester inserted in the center of cake comes out clean. Allow to cool slightly.
Chocolate drizzle: in the top of a double boiler, over hot (not boiling) water, milk chocolate chips with butter, stirring until smooth. Drizzle over top of warm cake. Cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, lightly greased

name: Cilantro Jalapeno sauce
ingredients:
4 Jalapenos, halved
2 cups loosely packed Cilantro, stems removed
1/2 cup Sour cream
2 Cloves Garlic
Lime juice, 1 lime
Pinch of salt
1/2 cup Olive oil
1 Tbsp. Apple cider vinegar
directions:
Combine jalapenos, cilantro, sour cream, garlic, lime juice, and salt in a food processor.
While the motor is running, slowly pour in the olive oil and viengar in a steady stream. 
Once it's all combined, serve with chicken or fries.

name: Cinnamon Filling
ingredients:
6 Tbsp Melted butter
3/4 cup Brown sugar
1 Tbsp Ground cinnamon
directions:
In a bowl mix all the ingredients together.
Add filling to a piping bad and set aside.
Use this to create the cinnamon roll swirl in the pancakes.

name: Cinnamon French Toast Bites
ingredients:
4 Thick slices of slightly stale white bread (1" cubes)
2 Large eggs (or 3 small)
1/4 cup Milk
Pinch of Salt
1/4 cup White sugar
1/2 tsp Cinnamon powder
3 Tbsp Butter, separated
Maple Syrup
directions:
Cut the crust off the bread, then cut each piece into equal 1" cubes.
Whisk the eggs, milk and salt in a medium bowl.
Combine sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl.
Melt 1/2 Tbsp of butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Quickly toss half of the bread cubes into the egg mixture and use your hands to shake off the excess egg mixture.
Place the bread cubes in the frying pan and use a wooden spoon to "saute" them until browned on all sides -  about 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove the cubes from the frying pan straight into the sugar mixture. Toss to coat, then remove and place on a plate.
Serve immediately with maple syrup for dipping.

name: Cinnamon Muffins
ingredients:
1 1/2 cup flour 
1/2 cup sugar
2 tsp. baking powder
1/2 cup milk
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 cup shortening
1 egg
directions:
Mix all ingredients.
Grease muffin tins at the bottom only (or use cupcake papers.)
Place enough mixture in tin to cover bottom only.
Put a dab of your favorite jam in the middle.
Cover with mixture to fill tin.
May sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar mixture.
Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

name: Cinnamon Pretzels
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups Warm water
1 1/2 tsp Instant yeast
1/2 cup Bread flour
1 3/4 cups Plain Flour
1 tsp Salt
2 Tbsp Light brown sugar
2 cups Water
2 Tbsp Baking soda
1/4 cup Melted butter
3/4 cup Sugar
3 tsp Cinnamon
directions:
Mix the yeast with the warm water, and leave to sit for 5 minutes.
Add the two flours, brown sugar and salt to a bowl, and slowly pour in the yeast mixture and knead for 5 minutes until you have a soft dough.
Put the dough in a bowl and let rise for 30 minutes.
Once the dough is risen, knock the air out and split into 12 chunks. Roll the the chunks of dough into long ropes and twist together to make a pretzel shape. Lay them on a baking tray until complete.
Boil the water and baking soda together and dip each pretzel into the solution, dry with a towel then place them back on the baking sheet.
Bake at 400-450 degrees for 10 minutes.
Once cooked, melt the butter and mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a separate bowl.
Coat the cooked pretzel in butter and then dip them in the sugar mixture and serve.

name: Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
ingredients:
1 1/4 cup All-purpose flour
2 tsp Baking powder
1/2 tsp Kosher salt
1 cup Milk
1 Tbsp Vegetable oil
1 Egg
directions:
In a bowl, whisk flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat milk, oil, and egg together. 
Add wet ingredients into flour mixture. Whisk until batter is combined.
Heat large skillet on medium heat. Spray with nonstick spray. Scoop 1/4 cup batter onto skillet and cook for 2 minutes. Squeeze piping bag filling into a spiral patter on pancake. Let sit for 2 minutes; when bubbles begin to appear, flip with a thin spatula, and cook for another minute. Transfer to plate and drizzle cream cheese glaze on top.

name: Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients:
Dough
1 Tbsp Yeast
1/2 cup warm water
1/2 cup warm milk
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup butter
1 tsp salt
1 egg
3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour

Filling 
1/2 cup melted butter
3/4 cup sugar
2 Tbsp ground cinnamon
directions:
In a small bowl, dissolve yeast and a pinch of sugar in warm water and set aside.
In a large bowl mix milk, sugar, melted butter, salt and egg.
Add 2 cups of flour and mix until smooth.
Add yeast mixture ad remaining flour.
Mix on medium speed with dough hook for 2 minutes or until dough is easy to handle.
Roll out on a floured surface into a 15 x 9 rectangle. 
Spread melted butter all over dough.
Mix sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over buttered dough.
Roll beginning at the 15 inch side and cut into 12 to 15 pieces.
Bake until golden brown about 12-15 minutes.
notes: heat oven to 350 degrees

name: Citrus Vinaigrette
ingredients:
3/4 cup Orange juice (not from concentrate)
1/4 cup Fresh lime juice (2-3 limes)
1 cup Chopped fresh basil
1 cup Packed fresh cilantro leaves
1 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
1 heaping Tbsp Honey
1/2 cup Canola oil
directions: Combine the orange and lime juices, basil, cilantro, salt, pepper, honey, and oil in a blender and blend for 1 minute.

name: Clay
ingredients:
2 cups boiling water
1/2 cup salt
3 Tbsp. oil
1 Tbsp. alum
2 1/2 cup flour
directions:
Boil water.
Add to dry ingredients and knead.
To keep soft, store in zip-lock bags.

name: Confetti Calamari
ingredients:
1/2 lb Calamari
1 cup All-purpose flour, plus more if needed
1-2 Tbsp Paprika
Salt to Taste
Oil for deep-frying
Zest from 1 lemon
2-3 Tbsp mayonnaise
directions:
Heat fryer to 360 F. 
Blot and dry the calamari with paper towels.
Cut the tubes open by sliding your knife up the inside and cut outward. Unfold the flat piece the long way and cut into thin strips. For the tentacles cut off the stingers, the cut the tentacles in half the long way to make two symmetrical pieces.
To a large Ziploc bag, add approximately 1 cup flour, 1-2 Tbsp paprika, and salt. Add the calamari to the bag, and zip the bag 90% across. Blow air into the opening to make the bag puff out, and zip it shut. Now shake, shake, shake. Pour the calamari into the colander with a bowl underneath to remove the excess flour.
Drop the calamari into the fryer and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown.
Make lemon zest mayo by combining lemon zest and mayo in a small bowl.
Transfer calamari to a mixing bowl. Add salt and toss. Sever with lemon zest mayo.

name: Conga Bars
ingredients:
2-1/4 cup All purpose flour
2-1/2 tsp. Baking Powder
1/2 tsp. Salt
3/4 cup Unsalted butter
2 cup Light brown sugar
3 Eggs
1 tsp. Vanilla
1 Chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Lightly grease 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
With mixer on medium speed, beat butter, and brown sugar in a large bowl until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time.
On low speed better gradually beat in flour, salt and baking soda.
Add vanilla.
Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until wooden toothpick comes out of center clean.
notes: 1/4 c. Chopped nuts (optional)

name: Continental Chicken
ingredients:
6 boneless chicken breast halves
1 package pressed sliced beef
6 slices bacon
1 can of cream of mushroom soup
1/4 cup sour cream
1/4 cup flour
directions:
Arrange dried beef slices on botto of crock pot.
Wrap each piece of chicken with a slice of bacon.
Place on top of the beef.
Mix everything else and pour into crockpot.
Cover and cook for 7-9 on low or 3-4 hours on high.
serve with noodles or mashed potatos as a topping.

name: Cookies and Cream Cheesecake Donuts
ingredients:
100g crushed Oreos
Cream Cheese Filling:
250g Cream Cheese
200ml Sweetened condensed milk
White chocolate ganache:
200g White chocolate melts
100ml Thickened cream
directions:
To make white choc ganache simply add the chocolate and cream to a large microwave safe bowl and microwave for 20 seconds at a time, mixing each time until it becomes a smooth mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to cool.
While the donuts are cooling prepare the cheesecake filling by adding the cream cheese and sugar or sweetened condensed milk to a large mixing bowl. use a wooden spoon to combine them or a hand mixer until the mixture is smooth. Transfer to a zip lock bag or piping bag.
To finish off the donuts simply poke a hole in the top of the donut and insert the bag with cheesecake filling in the donut. Fill with filling. Once all the donuts are filled carefully dip them in the white choc ganache.
notes: Use with Doughnut Recipe

name: Cranberry Dijon Pork Tenderloin with Mashed Potatoes & Roasted Green Beans
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
6 oz Green beans
1 Lemon
1 Thumb Ginger
1/4 oz Rosemary
10 oz Pork tenderloin
4 Tbsp Sour cream
1 Cranberry Cranberry jam packet
1 Chicken stock
2 tsp Dijon mustard
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position (middle and top positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces. Zest and quarter lemon. Peel and mince or grate ginger until you have 1 tsp (2 tsp for 4). Pick rosemary leaves from stems; mince leaves until you have 1 tsp.
Place potatoes in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain and return potatoes to pot. Mash with sour cream and 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) until smooth and creamy, adding splashes of reserved potato cooking liquid as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
