While potatoes cook, pat pork* dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and sear, turning occasionally, until browned all over, 4-8 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step). Turn off heat; transfer pork to one side of a baking sheet. (For 4 servings, spread pork out across entire sheet.) Wipe out pan.
Trim green beans if necessary. Toss green beans in a large bowl with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Spread out on opposite side of sheet from pork. (For 4 servings, toss green beans on a second sheet; roast pork on middle rack and green beans on top rack.) Roast on middle rack until pork is cooked through and green beans are tender, 10-12 minutes. Transfer pork to a cutting board to rest. Carefully toss green beans with lemon zest.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add minced ginger and minced rosemary; cook until fragrant, 30 seconds. Stir in jam, stock concentrate, mustard, and 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4 servings). Simmer until slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4) until melted.
Slice pork crosswise. Divide pork, mashed potatoes, and green beans between plates. Drizzle pork with sauce. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 45 min. Calories: 600

name: Cream Cheese Chicken
ingredients:
1 envelope Italian dressing mix
1 stick butter or margarine (1/2 cup)
6 boneless, skinless, chicken breasts
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 8-ounce cream cheese
directions:
Turn crock pot on High. Place butter in bottom of crockpot.
When butter has melted, add one envelope Italian dressing dry mix. Stir into butter until well mixed.
Cut chicken breasts into 1" strips. Place in crock pot and stir to coat chicken in butter and dressing mix. 
Cover and cook on high for 2 hours. 
Remove chicken to plate to cool.
Add 1 can cream of chicken soup and cream cheese.
Stir to melt and mix well until smooth and creamy.
Remove sauce from crock pot and pour on chicken.
notes: Can be served on top of mashed potatoes, rice, or hot buttered noodles.

name: Cream Cheese Chocolate Chips Cookies
ingredients:
10 oz. Mini chocolate chips
2 1/4 cups All-purpose flour
1 1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 cup Butter, softened
8 oz. Cream cheese, softened
1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
1 Egg
1/2 cup Chopped nuts (optional)
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small saucepan, over very low heat, melt 1 cup chocolate chips.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour and baking soda.
In a large bowl, beat butter, cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg until well incorporated. Beat in melted chocolate until well combined. Add flour mixture and mix well. Fold in nuts and remaining chocolate chips.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake in oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are firm around the edges. Transfer to wire rack to let cool.

name: Cream Cheese Glaze
ingredients:
4 Tbsp Butter
2 oz Cream cheese
1 cup Powdered sugar
1 tsp Vanilla extract
directions:
In a bowl add butter and cream cheese. Microwave for 30 seconds. Add powdered sugar and vanilla extract and whisk until smooth.
Drizzle on top of completed pancakes.

name: Cream Puff Filling and Chocolate Sauce
ingredients:
1/3 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp. Cornstarch
1/8 tsp. Salt
2 cup Milk
2 Egg yolks, slightly beaten
2 Tbsp. Butter
2 tsp. Vanilla
directions:
In a saucepan, Mix sugar, corn starch and salt.
Gradually stir in milk.
Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and boils. 
Boil and stir for 1 minute.
Place eggs in a different bowl.
In a custard cup, place vanilla and butter.
After it boils for 1 minute, slowly pour half of the egg mixture into the pan.
Pour the rest of the egg mixture in and boil for 1 minute.
Take off heat and add butter and vanilla.

Frosting: Heat 1 square unsweetened chocolate and 1 tsp. Butter until melted. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of sifted confectioner's sugar and about 2 Tbsp. hot water. Beat until smooth.
notes:
1 square unsweetened chocolate
1 cup sugar
2 Tbsp. hot water

name: Cream Puffs
ingredients:
1 cup Water
1/2 cup Butter
1 cup flour
4 Eggs
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees
place parchment paper on cookie sheet
In saucepan, heat water and butter to a rolling boil.
Remove pan from burner
Slowly add flour and stir until completely combined (mixture will be lumpy)
Put pan bake on heat and stir quickly until mixture forms a ball and film appears at the bottom of the pan.
Take off and quickly beat in the eggs until the mixture is smooth and thick
Place mixture on pan and form 6 mounds.
Bake for 35 minutes and until puffed and golden brown and dry.
Add cream filling and Chocolate frosting
notes: Cream filling and Chocolate frosting are separate recipes

name: Creamy Blue Cheese Dip
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sour cream
1/2 cup Mayonnaise
5 oz. Danish blue cheese, finely crumbled
1/8 tsp. Cayenne pepper
2 Tbsp. Finely chopped green onions
directions:
In a food processor or blender, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, blue cheese and cayenne pepper. Process until smooth. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with the green onions.
Cover and refrigerate until serving time.
The dip can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.

name: Creamy Chive Chicken with Lemony Rice and a Dijon-Apple Salad
ingredients:
1 Lemon
1/4 ox Chives
1 Apple
1/2 cup Rice
2 tsp Dijon Mustard
10 oz Chicken
1 Chicken stock concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour cream
2 oz Mixed greens
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Halve and core apple; quarter one half lengthwise, then thinly slice crosswise into triangles (quarter and slice whole apple for 4 servings). Mince chives. Zest and quarter lemon (quarter both lemons for 4).
In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups water for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, in a medium bowl, combine 1 Tbsp olive oil (2 Tbsp for 4 servings), juice from half the lemon, half the mustard, 1/2 tsp sugar (1 tsp for 4), salt, and pepper. Stir in half the chives. Set aside.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 5-7 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat pan used for chicken over medium-high heat. Add stock concentrate, remaining mustard, 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4 servings), and a squeeze of lemon juice. Simmer until slightly thickened, 1-2 minutes. Turn off heat. Stir in sour cream and remaining chives. (TIP: If sauce seems too thick, add more water 1 tsp at a time until it reaches drizzling consistency.) Season with salt and pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper. Add mixed greens and apple to bowl with vinaigrette. Season with salt and pepper; toss to combine. Divide chicken, rice, and salad between plates. Drizzle chicken with sauce. Cut remaining lemon into wedges and serve on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 600

name: Creamy Lemon Spinach Ricotta Ravioli with Roasted Bell Pepper & Parmesan
ingredients:
1 clove Garlic
1 Bell Pepper
1 Roma Tomato
1 Lemon
9 oz Spinach ravioli or regular pasta
Veggie stock concentrate
2 Tbsp Cream cheese
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 400 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Halve bell pepper; remove stem and seeds. Cut tomato into six wedges. Peel and thinly slice garlic. Zest and quarter lemon.
Place bell pepper and tomato on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Arrange bell pepper cut sides down. Roast on middle rack until veggies are softened and lightly charred, 20-25 minutes. Let bell pepper cool slightly, then transfer to a cutting board and thinly slice into strips.
When veggies are almost done, gently add ravioli to pot of boiling water. Reduce to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente and floating to the top, 4-5 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water (1 cup for 4 servings), then drain.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, 2-3 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup reserved pasta cooking water (1/2 cup for 4 servings), stock concentrate, cream cheese, sour cream, half the Parmesan (save the rest for serving), and 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4) to pan with garlic. Whisk until combined and creamy, then stir in roasted tomato and sliced bell pepper. Add a squeeze of lemon juice to taste. Season generously with salt and pepper.
Add drained ravioli to pan with sauce; gently toss until thoroughly coated. TIP: If necessary, stir in more pasta cooking water a splash at a time until ravioli is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide between plates and top with remaining Parmesan and lemon zest to taste. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time40 min. Calories: 600

name: Creamy Rigatoni With Pork Sausage plus Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Broccoli, Lemon & Parmesan
ingredients:
8 oz Broccoli florets
1 Lemon
6 oz Rigatoni pasta
9 oz Italian pork sausage
4 Tbsp Cream cheese
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1 tsp Garlic powder
1 Chicken stock concentrate
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Cut broccoli florets into bite-size pieces if necessary. Quarter lemon.
Once water is boiling, add rigatoni to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 3/4 cup pasta cooking water (1 cup for 4 servings), then drain. TIP: If your water isn't boiling yet, get started on the next steps!
Place broccoli in a medium, microwave-safe bowl (use a large bowl for 4 servings) and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave until tender, 1-2 minutes. TIP: No microwave? No problem! In the last 2-4 minutes of cooking pasta, add broccoli to boiling water and cook with pasta until tender.
Remove sausage* from casing; discard casing. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. TIP: Drain any excess grease from pan if necessary.
Reduce heat to medium low. Stir Philadelphia cream cheese, sour cream, garlic powder, stock concentrate, 1/4 cup pasta cooking water (1/3 cup for 4 servings), 2 Tbsp butter (4 Tbsp for 4), and a big squeeze of lemon juice into pan with sausage. Season with salt and pepper. TIP: If you've got some on hand, add a pinch of chili flakes from your pantry for a spicy kick. Add rigatoni and broccoli. Cook, stirring, until pasta is coated in a creamy sauce. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved pasta cooking water a splash at a time.
Divide pasta between bowls. Top with a squeeze of lemon juice. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 980

name: Crepes
ingredients:
3/4 cup Flour
1 cup Milk
1 Beaten egg
1 Dash salt
Nonstick cooking spray
directions:
Combine flour, milk, egg and salt.
Spray 6-inch skillet with nonstick spray.
Preheat skillet.
Then remove from heat.
Pour 2 Tbsp. of batter in center of pan, lift and tilt skillet to spread batter.
Return to heat.
Brown on one side only- invert skillet over paper towel; remove crepe.
notes: can be filled with eggs, fruit, etc.

name: Crispy Jack Chicken with Roasted Carrots, Potatoes Wedges & Sriracha Mayo
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
12 oz Carrots
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
1 Tbsp Butter
1 Tbsp Ranch Spice
10 oz chicken cutlets
4 Tbsp Mayo
1 tsp Sriracha
directions:
Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch thick wedges. Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into 1/2 inch thick pieces.
Place 1 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Stir in panko, Monterey Jack, half the Ranch spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), salt, and pepper.
Toss potatoes on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, remaining ranch spice, salt, and pepper. Toss carrots on empty side with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 20-25 minutes.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Place on a new baking sheet. Spread tops of chicken with 1 tsp mayo each (you'll use the rest in the next step). Mound with panko mixture, pressing firmly to adhere (no need to coat the undersides).
Once veggies have roasted 5 minutes, add chicken to middle oven rack for 15-18 minutes.
In a second small bowl, combine remaining mayo with Sriracha to taste.
Divide chicken and potato wedges between plates. Serve with Sriracha mayo on the side for dipping.
notes: 810 Calories. Prep: 10 min and cook 35 min

name: Crispy Kickin' Cayenne Chicken Cutlets with Mashed Potatoes, Carrots and a Honey Drizzle
ingredients:
12 oz Carrots
2 sCallions
4 Tbsp Sour cream
1/4 oz Frank's Seasoning Blend
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup Monterey Jack cheese
10 oz Chicken cutlets
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
2 tsp Honey
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat over to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Trim and thinly slice scallions. Separating whites from greens.
In a small bowl, combine half the sour cream(you'll use the rest later), 1/2 tsp Frank's seasoning (1 tsp for 4), and a big pinch of salt. Stire in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Place 1 Tbsp butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted. 30-45 seconds. Stir in panko, monterey jack, remaining Frank's seasoning, and a big pinch of salt and pepper.
 Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Place in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil; cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain.
Heat a drizzle of oil and scallion whites in empty pot over low heat; cook until softened, 1 minute. Return potatoes to pot; mash with remaining sour cream and 1 Tbsp butter until smooth and creamy, adding splashes of reserved potato cooking liquid as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While potatoes cook, lightly oil a baking sheet. Toss carrots on one side of prepared sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Place on a plate. Mound tops of chicken with panko mixture, pressing firmly to adhere. Once carrots have roasted 5 minutes, remove sheet from over. Carefully place chicken, coated sides up, on empty side. Roast on top rack until chicken is golden brown and cooked through and carrots are browned and tender, 15-18 minutes.
Carefully transfer roasted carrots to a large bowl; add 1 Tbsp butter and toss until melted. Divide carrots, mashed potatoes and chicken with scallion greens and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 770

name: Crispy Potato Skins
ingredients:
4 large Russet Potatoes
1 Tbsp. Vegetable oil
1/2 tsp. Garlic powder
1 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Prick the potatoes with a fork in several places. Wrap in foil and bake until tender, about 50 minutes. Cool slightly before handling.
With a sharp knife, cut the potatoes into quarters. Scoop out the inside, leaving 1/4 inch shell. Reserve the filling for another use. Brush the skins with oil. Place cut side up on a baking sheet. Bake about 15 minutes, or until crisp.
Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with the garlic powder and Parmesan. Return to the oven for 2 minutes to melt the cheese.

name: Crockpot Balsamic Glazed Drumsticks
ingredients:
8 chicken drumsticks
3 Tbsp coconut oil (olive oil would work too)
1/2 cup Balsamic vinegar
3 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Honey
directions:
Put all ingredients into a ziploc bag.
Either freeze for a make ahead meal or let marinade overnight.
The next morning just dump it all in the crockpot and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

name: Darcy's Cheese Bread
ingredients:
4 cups flour
2 cups water
1 Tbsp. salt
1 Tbsp. yeast
2 cups grated cheddar cheese
directions:
Place warm water in mixer with yeast. stir to combine. Wait to add next ingredients until  you see bubbling.
Add salt and flour. 
Knead for 8 minutes.
Let rise in greased bowl for 1 hour or until doubled.
Turn out on flat surface. Roll into a rectangle. Divide into two equal parts. Spread the cheese on each section and roll tightly. Cover both loaves. 
Let rise for about 45 minutes.
Heat oven to 425
Spritz bread dough with water and slice openings in the top.
Bake for 30 minutes rotating once.
Place on cooling rack.

name: Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups
ingredients:
16 oz. Dark Chocolate
1/2 cup Creamy Peanut Butter
3 Tbsp Coconut oil
directions:
Melt the chocolate and half of the coconut oil on a double boiler.
Once smooth, turn off the heat and leave it on the pot.
Mix the peanut butter with the remaining coconut oil.
Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. 
Fill with enough chocolate to cover the bottom and put in the freezer for 5 minutes.
Once set add a scoop of the peanut butter and spread out with the back of a spoon.
Cover with more chocolate to cover the peanut butter completely.
Put in the freezer for 25-30 minutes.

name: Deep Dish Chocolate Chip Cookie
ingredients:
17 Tbsp Butter
1 cup Granulated sugar
1/2 cup Packed brown sugar
2 tsp Vanilla
2 Tbsp Real maple syrup
2 Eggs
2 3/4 cup Flour
1 tsp Baking soda
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips
1/2 cup milk chocolate chips
1/2 cup caramel pieces
3 Tbsp Heavy whipping cream
Coarse sea salt
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degree.
 Soften the 9 Tbsp butter in the microwave for 30 seconds or until partially melted. Soften the remaining 8 Tbsp for 10 seconds.
Mix the butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until creamed. Add the vanilla and maple syrup and mix again until smooth. Add the eggs; beat slowly until incorporated. 
Add the flour, baking soda, and salt (sometimes it helps to add the flour in batches). Mix until a smooth, dry dough forms. Stir in the chocolate chips and chocolate chunks. Melt the caramel pieces and heavy cream in the microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well until melted and smooth.
Press half of the dough mixture into a 9-inch or larger cast iron skillet lined with parchment paper. Pour the caramel over the dough and smooth with a spoon. Cover with another layer of cookie dough. Bake for 15-25 minutes (see notes). Remove from oven, sprinkle with sea salt, and allow to rest for at least one hour in order for the pieces to hold their shape when cut.
notes: I baked mine uncovered for 15 minutes, but you could also cover with foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes to get the cookie center baked even further. If you only bake for 15 minutes total, like I did, the cookie WILL be underbaked.

name: Dole Whip
ingredients:
4 cups Frozen chopped pineapple
1/2 cup Milk
1/2 cup Condensed milk
directions:
Place all ingredients in a blender, and blend until smooth. 
Serve in a cold glass, garnish with an umbrella or a cherry and enjoy!

name: Donuts
ingredients:
2 1/4 tsp Active dry yeast
1/2 cup Warm water, 110 degrees
1/4 cup Granulated sugar, divided
1/4 cup Full cream milk (room temp)
1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 cup Shortening (room temp)
1 Large egg
1 Egg yolk
1/2 tsp Vanilla extract
2 1/2 cups All-purpose flour (add more as needed)
3-4 cups veggie oil, for frying
directions:
In the bowl of an electric stand mixer, whisk together yeast, warm water and 1/2 tsp of the sugar. Cover it with cling wrap and a towel. Let it rest 5-10 minutes in a warm spot until it becomes frothy.
Add in milk, remaining granulated sugar (3 Tbsp + 2 1/2 tsp), salt, 1/4 cup Shortening, egg, egg yolk and vanilla.
Add half of the flour and set mixer with whisk attachment and blend until smooth. Switch mixer to hook attachment, slowly add remaining flour and knead on low speed until smooth and elastic about 4-5 minutes, adding additional flour as needed (about 2 Tbsp more. Should be slightly tacky and sticky). Transfer dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until double in size, about 1 1/2 hours.
Punch dough down and roll into an even layer onto a floured surface to slightly less than 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into doughnut shapes using a 3 inch cookie cutter. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30-40 minutes.
Preheat the oil in a large pot on medium high heat. Drop a small amount of dough into the oil and if it bubbles and fizzes around the sides the oil is hot enough. Gently and carefully drop donuts into the oil. Don't add more than three donuts at a time. Cook them on one side until they're a light brown then flip them over. Once they're golden on both sides carefully take them out and transfer them to a plate lined with kitchen paper towels to let the oil drain.
Poke hole in middle and fill with filling.
Best served the same day they're made.

name: Double Chocolate and Toffee Cookies
ingredients:
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup brown sugar
1/8 cup cocoa powder
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 tsp baking soda
3/4 cup flour
1/3 cup chocolate chips
1/3 cup toffee bits
1/3 cup white chips
1/4 cup softened butter
1 egg
directions:
preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Combine all dry ingredients.
Add butter and egg.
Roll into one inch balls and bake for 8-10 minutes.

name: Drop Biscuits
ingredients:
2 cups All-purpose flour, spooned and leveled
1/2 cup Cold unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
1 Tbsp Baking powder
1 tsp Salt
1 cup Whole milk
directions:
Heat oven to 400 F.
In a bowl, combine the flour, butter, baking powder, and salt; and cut using pastry cutter or fork until pea-size clumps form.
Add the milk and mix until moistened.
Drop large mounds of dough onto a baking sheet. Bake until golden, 10-15 minutes.

name: Easy Chicken and Broccoli
ingredients:
1 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into chunks
3 cup Frozen broccoli florets
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 Soup can of water
1-1/2 cup Uncooked instant white rice
1 cup Cheddar cheese
directions:
Spray frying pan with cooking spray.
Add chicken.
Cook and stir on medium- high heat for 2-3 minutes or until brown.
Add broccoli, soup, and water.
Bring to boil and stir.
Stir in rice and sprinkle with cheese.
Cover and reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.

name: Easy Chocolate Cookies
ingredients:
1 Devil's food cake mix
2 Eggs
1/2 cup Vegetable oil
6 oz. Chocolate chips
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
Mix all ingredients together
Bake on an ungreased pan for 10 minutes
notes:
12 per Pan
Ungreased Pan
Betty Crockers devil's food cake mix works the best

name: Easy Chocolate Suffle
ingredients:
3 oz Bittersweet chocolate, chopped
2 Tbsp Butter
1/2 tsp Vanilla
2 Egg yolks
2 Egg whites
2 Tbsp Sugar
Pinch of Salt
Pinch of Cream of tartar
Powdered sugar
directions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In a large bowl, melt chocolate and butter. Add vanilla and whisk in yolks one at a time until smooth. Set aside.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with sugar, salt and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. fold egg whites into chocolate.
Grease ramekins with butter and dust unsweetened cocoa and tap out excess. Spoon batter into ramekins.
Bake until puffed and set, approximately 20 minutes. Serve with powdered sugar.

name: Easy Elephant Ears
ingredients:
Granulated Sugar
1/2 Ib. Frozen puff pastry, defrosted
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 F.
Sprinkle a pastry board with a thick layer of sugar. Place puff pastry on top and roll into a neat oblong.
Fold one long side of puff pastry inward, like a jellyroll, but stopping at the center. Repeat on the other side, so the two rolls meet in the center. Cut into slice 1/4 inch thick and press each slice in sugar.
Place slices on cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 6 to 8 minutes. Turn over and bake for another 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Edible Peanut Butter Cup Cookie Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, softened
1/2 cup Creamy peanut butter
1/2 cup Light brown sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking powder
1/2 cup semi-sweet mini chocolate chips
1/2 cup Mini peanut butter cups, halved
1/2 cup Reese's Pieces
directions:
In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the peanut butter and sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in chocolate chips, peanut butter cups and Reese's Piece's. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or dipped in chocolate as a truffle.

name: Edible Rocky Road Cookie Dough
ingredients:
2 cups Semi-sweet chocolate chips, divided
1/2 cup Unsalted butter
1/2 cup Dark brown sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
3/4 cup All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 cup Unsweetened cocoa powder
1/4 tsp Kosher salt
1 tsp Baking powder
1 cup Miniature marshmellows
1 cup Sliced almonds
1/4 cup Salted caramel sauce
directions:
Melt 1 cup of the chocolate chips in a double-boiler until smooth. Remove from the heat, and let cool to room temperature.
Using a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the granulated sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the melted chocolate, followed by the dry ingredients, to the creamed butter using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in marshmallows, nuts, and salted caramel sauce until just combined.. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or chill and use to make ice cream sandwiches.

name: Edible Sugar Cookie Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Unsalted butter, softened
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 tsp Kosher salt
1 tsp Baking powder
1/4 cup rainbow sprinkles
directions:
In a large bowl using a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the granulated sugar and vanilla on medium speed until fluffy and light in color.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in rainbow sprinkles. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve a scoop of chilled cookie dough on a sugar cone and enjoy.

name: Edible Triple Chip Cookie Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, softened
1/2 cup Dark Brown sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking powder
1/4 cup Semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/4 cup White chocolate chips
1/4 cup Milk chocolate chips
directions:
In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the sugar on medium-high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in all three chocolate chips. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or form into small 1/2 inch balls for an ice cream topping.

name: Everyone's favorite no-bake cookies
ingredients:
2 cups granulated sugar
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa
1/2 cup butter
3 cups quick oats
1/2 cup peanut butter
1 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
place oats, peanut butter and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Set aside.
Combine sugar, milk, cocoa and butter in a large saucepan. 
Bring to a boil; boil 1 minute (no longer)
Remove from heat. Pour over oat mixture. 
Stir well.
Drop onto wax paper and let cool.
notes: boil the mixture 1 minute - no more, no less

name: Fancy Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
100g Pancetta
1 Tbsp Olive oil
250g Plain cottage cheese
250g Ricotta cheese
3 tsp Dijon mustard
1/2 tsp Cayenne
Generous grating of nutmeg
500g Extra-mature cheddar, grated
100g Parmesan, grated
1 Liter Full-fat milk
450g Dried macaroni
directions:
Preheat oven to 355 F. 
Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, add the olive oil and pancetta. Fry until browned and crispy, about 8 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the cottage cheese, ricotta, Dijon, cayenne, nutmeg and good seasoning. Tip into a large bowl and add the cheddar, Parmesan and milk, stirring to combine.
Mix through the dried macaroni then tip into a large ovenproof dish. Top with the crispy pancetta and a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil, baking another 30 minutes. Remove and allow to cool slightly.

name: Fast Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
1 1/2 Tbsp butter
1 shallot, minced
1 cup small elbow pasta
1 cup chicken stock
1/2 cup fontina cheese, grated 
1/2 cup cheddar cheese, grated
1 Tbsp cream
1 Tbsp minced chives
directions:
Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 Tbsp butter and the shallots. Saute until fragrant. Add elbow pasta and 1/2 cup of chicken stock. When the stock is evaporated, check the doneness of the pasta. If it needs to cook longer, ad the other 1/2 cup of chicken stock.
Once the pasta is fully cooked, add the shredded cheddar and fontina.
Once the cheese is melted and incorporated, add 1/2 Tbsp butter and the cream to finish. Top with chives.

name: Figgy Balsamic Steak with Roasted Carrots & Thyme Brussels Sprouts
ingredients:
8 oz Brussel sprouts
1/4 oz Thyme
1 Shallot
10 oz Pork tenderloins
12 oz Carrots
1 Chicken stock concentrate
5 tsp Balsamic vinegar
1 Fig jam packet
directions:
Adjust racks to top and middle positions and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim and halve Brussels sprouts lengthwise. Strip thyme leaves from stems; chop leaves until you have 2 tsp (4 tsp for 4 servings). Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Halve, peel, and finely chop onion.
Toss Brussels sprouts on one side of a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, half the chopped thyme, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss carrots on empty side with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until tender and crisped, 20-25 minutes.
While veggies roast, pat pork* dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add pork and sear, turning occasionally, until browned all over, 4-8 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step). Transfer to a second baking sheet.Or swap in steak for pork; cook to desired doneness, 5-7 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board to rest for at least 5 minutes.
Roast pork on middle rack until cooked through, 10-12 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest a few minutes, then thinly slice crosswise.
Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of olive oil in pan used for pork over medium heat. Add onion and remaining chopped thyme. Cook, stirring, until softened, 1-2 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate, vinegar, jam, and 1/4 cup water (1/2 cup for 4 servings). Simmer until thick and saucy, 2-3 minutes. Remove pan from heat and stir in 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4) until melted. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide Brussels sprouts, carrots, and pork between plates. Drizzle pan sauce over pork and serve.
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 480
switch out regular brussel sprouts for the Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Vinegar & Honey recipe

name: Firecracker Meatballs with Roasted Green Beans & Sesame Rice
ingredients:
2 Scallions
1 Thumb Ginger
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Sour cream
2 tsp Honey
6 ml Ponzu
1 tsp Sriracha
1/2 cup Jasmine rice
10 oz Ground beef
1/4 cup Panko breadcrumbs
6 oz Green beans
directions:
Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens; mince whites. Peel and mince ginger.
In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, honey, 2 tsp soy sauce (4 tsp for 4 servings; you'll use the rest later), and sriracha to taste. Set aside.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add half the sesame seeds (save the rest for serving); cook, stirring, until golden brown, 1-2 minutes. Add rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups for 4 servings), and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, in a second large bowl, combine beef, panko, ginger, scallion whites, remaining soy sauce, salt (we used 1/2 tsp; 1 tsp for 4 servings), and pepper. Form into 10-12 (20-24 for 4) 1.5-inch meatballs.
Place meatballs on one side of a lightly oiled baking sheet. On empty side, toss green beans with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until meatballs are cooked through and green beans are browned and tender, 14-16 minutes. (For 4 servings, divide between 2 sheets; roast meatballs on middle rack and green beans on top rack.)
Fluff rice with a fork; season with salt and pepper. Divide between bowls or plates. Carefully add meatballs to bowl with sauce; toss to coat. Top rice with meatballs and drizzle with any remaining sauce. Serve green beans to the side. Garnish with scallion greens, remaining sesame seeds, and chili flakes to taste.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min. Calories: 770

name: Florentine Potatoes
ingredients:
1 lb fingerling potatoes
6 cloves Garlic, crushed in their skins
10 sage leaves, torn into pieces
Extra virgin olive oil
Kosher salt
Red pepper flakes
directions:
Set oven to 400F. Cut the fingerlings into equal but misshapen 1-inch pieces. Soak them in water for at least an hour.
Add the potatoes, crushed garlic, sage, olive oil, salt and red pepper flakes to a large bowl and toss to coat.
Transfer all of that to a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes then mix potatoes around. Return to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.

name: Forgotten cookies
ingredients:
2 Egg whites
1/8 tsp Cream of tartar
1/3 cup Sugar
1 cup Krispy rice cereal
1/2 cup Chocolate Chips
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper
Separate the 2 eggs (discard the yolks)
Put egg whites into medium bowl and add tartar
use electric mixer, beat egg whites and tartar until foamy stage
Add sugar and beat until stiff peak stage
Fold in Krispy rice cereal and Chocolate Chips
Using a spoon, drop one spoonful per cookie on to cookie tray
Put cookie tray into oven and immediately turn off the oven
"Forget" until the oven has cooled and cookies have hardened.

name: French Toast
ingredients:
8 eggs
2 tsp. vanilla
2 Tbsp. cinnamon
1 cup milk
directions:
Mix all ingredients into bowl.
Dip bread into bowl covering both sides of the bread with the mix.
Put on to griddle.
Flip over when one side is cooked.
Cook at 250 to 200 degrees.

name: Fried Chicken
ingredients:
Bread Crumbs
Onion powder
Garlic salt
Flour
Chicken Breast
3 eggs
1/2 cup water
salt
pure veggie oil
pepper
directions:
Mix flour, onion powder and garlic salt in bowl.
In another bowl, mix eggs and water.
Cut chicken pieces and put in a bowl.
Dip chicken first in flour, then eggs, then bread crumbs.
Put dipped chicken into the oil which is in a frying pan.
Flip over when one side is done.
Cook chicken and make sure there is no pink in the middle.
notes: Put in how ever much you feel you need to make flavorful

name: Fried Mozzarella Sticks
ingredients:
1/2 Ib. Mozzarella cheese
2 Eggs
1/2 tsp. Salt
1/4 tsp. Pepper
2 cups Finely dried bread crumbs
1 tsp. Chopped fresh parsley
1 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
directions:
Cut the mozzarella cheese into 1/4 inch sticks.
In a small bowl, beat together the eggs, salt and pepper. Combine the bread crumbs, parsley and Parmesan cheese in a shallow bowl. Dip the cheese sticks into the egg mixture, then roll them in the bread crumbs. Press the crumbs firmly onto the cheese sticks. Place them on a platter until you're ready to fry them.
Heat 1/2 inch vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the cheese sticks for 3 minutes on both sides, or until they're golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
The mozzarella sticks can be reheated in a 350F oven for 7 minutes.

name: Fried Scones
ingredients:
2 cups flour
3/4 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1 and 1/2 tsp. sugar
1 and 1/2 Tbsp. shortening
3 tsp. yeast to 1/2 cup water
7-8 cups milk, scalded
directions:
Knead 20 times. 
Raise for ten minutes.
Roll 1/2 inch thick, cut and deep fry.
notes: If using Saf instant yeast, add to flour mixture and add water to milk after scalded.

name: Frozen Berry Pops
ingredients:
1 cup Vanilla Yogurt (Greek Style Yogurt works well)
1 cup Fresh Mixed Berries
(Strawberries, Blueberries, Blackberries, or Raspberries)
1 tsp. Fresh Lemon Juice
3-5 Tbsp. Honey or Agave to taste
directions:
Puree the berries.
Add vanilla yogurt, lemon juice and honey until smooth.
Divide mixture into freezer-pop molds stopping about 1 inch from the top.
Freeze until firm, about 6 hours.
Dip molds briefly in hot water to make it easier to take them out of their containers.

name: Frozen Chocolate Covered Bananas
ingredients:
2 medium bananas
1/2 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips
1 Tbsp Coconut oil
Peanut Butter
directions:
melt the chocolate and oil together until warm and liquidy.
chop bananas into 1/2 inch slices.
Dip and submerge bananas carefully and set out on wax paper and freeze.
If using peanut butter, cut banana slices in half and put peanut butter in between.
Then cover in chocolate.

name: Fruit Jello Slices
ingredients:
4 limes, oranges, or lemons
1 box of fruit jello

(If making watermelon slices, Use mini chocolate chips)
directions:
Cut fruit in half.
Clean out with spoon until there is only the rind left.
Make Box of jello.
Lay rinds in the muffin tin and pour jello into rinds.
Chill until firm.

(If making watermelon slices, Push mini chocolate chips in with skewer.)
notes:
Spoon
Skewer
Muffin tin

name: Fusilli Alla Caprese
ingredients:
1 Ib. Fusilli pasta
3 Tbsp. Olive Oil
2 Cloves garlic, minced
2 Cup Cherry tomatoes, quartered
1 tsp. Salt
1/4 tsp. Pepper
1/2 Cup Fresh Basil, torn
8 oz. Fresh Mozzarella cheese, cubed
directions:
Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water. Drain pasta.
In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, salt and pepper. As the tomatoes cook and soften, mash them gently with the back of a fork. Continue to cook until the tomatoes make a chunky sauce, about 4 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce to the cooked pasta, and add the basil and mozzarella. Stir to combine. 
Add the reserve pasta water, 1/4 cup at a time until the pasta is moist. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Alfredo Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp Olive oil
2 Garlic cloves, grated
2 cups Heavy cream
Black pepper
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
1/2 cup Mozzarella
3 cups cooked Macaroni
1/3 cup Bread crumbs
directions:
In a skillet, melt the butter with olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, cream, pepper and bring mixture to a simmer stirring often. Add the Parmesan cheese and simmer sauce for 10-15 minutes or until sauce has thickened and is smooth.
Add in the cooked and drained macaroni as well as the mozzarella. Stir to evenly coat. top with bread crumbs and place in the oven on broil until the top has become crisp. Enjoy!

name: Garlic Edamame
ingredients:
1 cup Frozen whole edamame
1 tsp Garlic powder
Salt to taste
directions: Cook edamame in lightly salted boiling water until tender. Strain and season with garlic powder and more salt, if desired.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: German Chocolate Cake Cookies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Butter, softened
2 Eggs
1 Package chocolate cake mix
2 Tbsp All-purpose flour
18 Maraschino cherries, halved
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a large bowl, cream butter until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Mix in cake mix and flour.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 2 inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Press a cherry half into the top of each cookie. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Giant Cinnamon Roll
ingredients:
Dough:
2 1/4 Cups all-purpose flour, plus 1/2 cup if needed
3 Tbsp Sugar
1 tsp Salt
1 package Instant Yeast
1/2 cup Water
1/4 cup Milk
3 Tbsp Butter
1 Large egg, room temp.
For Filling:
1/2 cup Butter, melted
3/4 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Ground cinnamon
For Icing:
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
2 cups Powdered sugar
1 tsp Vanilla extract
1 Tbsp Milk
directions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add 2 1/4 cups flour, sugar, salt and instant yeast. Mix until evenly distributed.
Melt the butter and combine with the water and milk. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix. Add the egg. Knead the dough on medium  until it starts pulling from the sides of the bowl, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the additional flour if dough is too wet.
Remove the dough from the bowl and place in a lightly greased bowl. Cover tightly and let rest for 30 minutes in a warm place.
While the dough is resting, gather the ingredients for the filling. Mix together the cinnamon and sugar and melt the butter.
On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough into a 12x15 rectangle. Using a pastry brush, brush the dough with butter and sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar.
Using a pizza cutter, cut the dough into six, 2-inch-wide strips. Roll one of the strips to create a cinnamon roll. use the other strips to keep spiraling the main roll until you form a giant roll.
Spray a 9-inch cake pan with nonstick spray. carefully transfer the giant roll into the cake pan. Loosely cover and let rise for another 30 to 60 minutes in a warm place.
After it's doubled in size, bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned. While the roll is baking, whisk together the ingredients for the icing.
Once the roll has come out of the oven, allow it to cool until warm and spread with the icing. Serve warm.
notes:
Active Time: 2 hours
Total Time: 3 hours

name: Glaze
ingredients:
4 Tbsp butter
2 cups powdered sugar
1 tsp vanilla extract
3 to 6 Tbsp hot water
directions:
Cream together butter and powdered sugar.
Add vanilla and hot water to desired consistency.

name: Grandma's Beef Stew
ingredients:
2 pounds stew meat
5 carrots, sliced
1 onion, chopped
3 stalks celery, sliced
1 quart stewed tomatoes
1/2 cup quick cooking tapioca
1 whole clove
2 bay leaves
1 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
directions:
Put all ingredients in a crockpot.
Stir.
Cover and cook for 10-12 hours on low or 5-6 hours on high.

name: Green Bean Casserole
ingredients:
2 cans cut green beans ( oz.)
2 cans cream of mushroom soup
1/2 cup slivered almonds
2 cups grated cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
directions:
Drain the green beans.
Mix everything except cheese together.
Put in 9 x 13 pan.
Cover the top in cheese.
Bake 30 min. at 375 degrees.

name: Griddled Onion Cheeseburgers with Special Sauce & Garlic Potato Wedges
ingredients:
12oz Potatoes
1 Yellow onion
2 Potato buns
1 Roma tomato
1 tsp Garlic powder
5 tsp White wine vinegar
2 Tbsp Ketchup
2 Tbsp Sour cream
2 tsp Dijon mustard
10 oz Ground beef
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and finely dice onion. Halve buns. Thinly slice tomato into rounds.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, 3/4 tsp garlic powder (1.5 tsp for 4 servings), salt, and pepper. (You'll use the rest of the garlic powder in the next step.) Roast on top rack until browned and crisp, 20-25 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine vinegar, 1 Tbsp onion (2 Tbsp for 4 servings), 1 tsp sugar (2 tsp for 4), and a pinch of salt. In a separate small bowl, combine ketchup, sour cream, mustard, remaining garlic powder, and 1 tsp sugar (2 tsp for 4).
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add remaining onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and softened, 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a plate.
While onion cooks, form beef* into two patties (four patties for 4 servings), each slightly wider than a burger bun. Season generously with salt and pepper. Once onion is done, heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook to desired doneness, 3-5 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with cheddar; cover pan to melt cheese.
While cheese melts, toast buns until golden brown. Stir pickled onion (draining first) into bowl with special sauce. Fill toasted buns with patties, griddled onion, tomato, and special sauce. Divide burgers between plates; serve with potato wedges and any remaining sauce on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 970

name: Grilled Hasselback Baguette
ingredients:
1 Stick unsalted butter
3 Cloves garlic, grated
2 small French baguettes (10-12 in.)
12 oz Block whole milk mozzarella
4-5 Campari tomatoes on the vine
4-5 Slices prosciutto
directions:
Preheat oven or grill to 350 F.
Begin by melting the butter in a small sauce pot. Grate in 3 cloves of garlic and cook until fragrant and butter has fully melted. Remove from heat.
Cut the break on a slight bias about 3/4 of the way down, making sure the bottom of the bread stays connected. Do this with both loaves and set aside.
Next, slice the mozzarella block in half, and then slice into thin pieces, about 1/4 inch thick. Set aside.
Slice the tomatoes the same as the cheese, about 1/4 inch thick rounds.
To assemble, alternate a slice of cheese with a slice of tomato in the sliced baguettes. Add a little piece of prosciutto in with every cheese slice.
Place each baguette on a piece of aluminum foil. Roll up the sides around the bread, so it acts like a boat to catch everything. Sprinkle both baguettes with salt and pepper and finish by drizzling the garlic butter evenly over.
Place on the grill or in the oven and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese has melted, the bread has toasted and prosciutto has gotten a little crispy. Serve immediately.

name: Guiltless Alfredo Sauce
ingredients:
2 cups Low-fat milk
1/3 cup (3 oz.) Low fat cream cheese
2 Tbsp. Flour
1 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Butter
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Cup Grated Parmesan cheese
Pasta, to serve with
directions:
In a blender, blend the milk and cream cheese, flour, and salt until smooth and set aside. 
In large bowl saucepan, melt butter on medium-high heat and add the garlic.
Saute for about 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add milk mixture. Stir constantly for 3-4 minutes or until it just starts to simmer. 
Keep cooking and stirring a few more minutes until thickened.
Once thickened, remove from heat and whisk cheese in.
Cover and let stand 10 minutes before serving over pasta.
notes: 10 minutes before serving (it will get thicker)

name: Hash Brown Casserole
ingredients:
1 frozen bag of hash browns
1 large bag of shredded cheddar cheese.
1 pint sour cream
1 medium onion chopped
2 Tbsp. margarine or butter
1 can of cream of chicken soup
directions:
Placed chopped onion in microwave container with butter and sautรฉ about a minute.
In largest mixing bowl, add hash browns, cheese onions, soup and sour cream.
(If the hash browns are frozen in clumps, unclump them.)
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Mix everything well and place in large 13x9 inch baking pan. You can butter or Pam pan.
Bake at 350 until bubbly and cheese is melted and slightly crispy on sides.

name: Hawaiian Haystack
ingredients:
1 can of Cream Chicken soup
1/2 Chicken Broth
1 cup Cooked cut-up chicken
2 cup cooked rice
1 can chow mein noodles
2 medium tomatoes- chopped
1/2 cup chopped celery
1/4 cup chopped green onions
1 can pineapple chunks- drained
1 cup grated cheese
1/4 cup coconut
directions:
Combine soup and broth in saucepan to make gravy.
Add chicken and simmer for 8-10 minutes.
On plate layer ingredients: Rice, Gravy, Cheese, other toppings, Salt, and Pepper.
notes: Toppings are optional

name: Heat and Sweet Beignets
ingredients:
2 1/4 tsp Active dry yeast
1 1/2 cup Warm water
1/2 White sugar
1 tsp Salt
2 Eggs
1 1/2 cup Evaporated milk
7 cups Flour
1/4 cup Butter flavored shortening
Oil for frying
Powdered sugar
Cayenne pepper
directions:
In a large bowl add the yeast and the warm water and allow it to bloom, once there are active bubbles add the sugar, salt, eggs, and milk and blend well.
Add 4 cups and blend until smooth, finally add the rest of the flour and the shortening, cover and chill of 12 hours.
Roll out dough, cut and fry, serve hot with a light sprinkle of cayenne pepper and a ton of powdered sugar.

name: Herb and Goat Cheese Baked Egg Boats
ingredients:
1 long Baguette, sourdough
3 Large eggs
2 Tbsp Heavy cream
salt and pepper to taste
2 Tbsp finely minced chives
1 Tbsp chopped flat leaf parsley
1 1/2 Chopped basil
1 small lemon, zested
2 oz. Soft goat cheese
1/2 cup arugula
Extra virgin olive oil
directions:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Cut out long oval section from the top 1/4 section of the baguette. Scoop out the inside bread and discard. 
Place on sheet tray making sure it sits flat.
In a bowl combine the eggs, cream and a pinch of salt and pepper. Whisk together. Next add in the chives, parsley, and basil. Stir to combine. Add lemon vest.
Stuff the arugula into the hollowed out bread. Next pour in the egg mixture. Then crumble over the goat cheese, pressing it down into the mixture. Lastly drizzle with a little olive oil.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and eggs are set.  
Slice and Serve

name: Homemade Fries
ingredients:
2 Russet potatoes
2 tsp Sea salt
1 tsp Black pepper
2 Tbsp Olive oil
directions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch matchsticks. Place on a baking pan lined with parchment paper and toss with salt, pepper and olive oil. 
Spread out potatoes evenly and bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown and fully cooked.

name: Homemade Play-Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Water
1 cup Flour
1 cup Salt
1 Tbsp. Oil
1 Tbsp. Cream of Tartar
A Few Drops of Food Coloring
directions:
Put all the ingredients into a saucepan on medium heat.
Stir constantly.
When in begins to come together into a ball, its done.
notes:
Clay recipe in book 1.
Burgerville recipe.
In need of a great milkshake??
Go to Burgerville for a chocolate monkey milkshake.

name: Homemade Tortillas
ingredients:
2 cups All-purpose flour
1/2 tsp Salt
3/4 cup Water
3 Tbsp Olive oil
directions:
In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. stir in water and oil. 
Turn onto a floured surface; knead 10-12 times, adding a little flour or water if needed to achieve a smooth dough. Let rest for 10 minutes.
Divide dough into eight portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 7-inch. Circle.
In a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook tortillas over medium heat for 1 minute on each side or until lightly browned. Keep warm.

name: Honey Barbequed Ribs
ingredients:
3 pounds country styled pork ribs
1/2 tsp. garlic salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 cup ketchup
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup honey
1/4 cup spicy brown mustard
2 Tbsp. Worcestershire
1-1/2 tsp. liquid smoke
directions:
Put the ribs in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours.
Drain.
Reduce heat from high to low.
Mix the remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Pour over ribs in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 3 hours.

name: Honey Butter Garlic Chicken
ingredients:
1 pound boneless skinless chicken thighs cut into small pieces
2 Tbsp cornstarch
1 Tbsp olive oil
1 Tbsp Challenge Unsalted Butter
1 tsp chili powder
3/4 tsp salt more or less to taste
1/2 tsp black pepper
1/2 Tbsp minced garlic
1 tsp red pepper flakes optional
2 to 4 Tbsp honey to taste
2 Tbsp cilantro finely chopped
1/2 Tbsp rice vinegar
2 Tbsp Challenge Unsalted Butter
chopped cilantro or green onions for garnish
directions:
In a bowl, add the chicken that has been cut into small pieces along with the cornstarch. Mix so that each piece of chicken is coated evenly in the cornstarch.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and Challenge Unsalted Butter.
Toss in the chicken and sprinkle salt and pepper on top. Cook until the chicken has some browned bits and no pink in sight, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic, red pepper flakes, honey, cilantro, rice vinegar, and more unsalted butter.
Saute until the chicken is golden brown and coated in the thick sauce, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Take off the heat and garnish with more cilantro. Serve on top of rice, steamed veggies, or in lettuce wraps!
notes: If you are not a fan of dark meat, skip the chicken thighs and use breast or go for shrimp. Of course just cook for shorter times for both breast and shrimp as they dry out faster.

name: Honey Strawberry Ice Cream
ingredients:
Ice Cream:
2/3 cup Heavy cream
2 cups Half and half
1/3 cup Honey
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Vanilla extract
10 Strawberries, diced
Topping:
Whole strawberries
Balsamic vinegar
directions:
Combine all ice cream ingredients except strawerries in a bowl. Refrigerate for an hour before pouring the mixture into the ice cream maker.
Place the whole strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Drizzle balsamic vinegar over top and put them under the broiler for 1 minute.
When the ice cream starts to form, add the diced strawberries to the mixture.
Serve the ice cream with the warm strawberries over top.

name: Honeydew Sorbet
ingredients:
4 1/2 cups Fresh honeydew (about 1 honeydew), cubed
1 Tbsp Freshly squeezed lemon juice 
1/4 cup Honey
1/4 cup Water
directions:
Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the cubed honeydew onto the baking sheet, leaving space in between the cubes to allow for even freezing.
Place the tray into the freezer and freeze the honeydew overnight or until fully frozen (4-6 hours).
Place the frozen honeydew into the bowl of a food processor, along with the lemon juice, honey, and water, and pulse until the honeydew becomes crumbly. You may need to add more water until the mixture becomes more fluid, but not slushy. You're looking for a soft sorbet texture at this point.
Taste and add any additional honey mixture as needed at a time.
notes: Lasts for up to 2 weeks

name: Hummus
ingredients:
19 oz. Can chickpeas, drained
3 Cloves garlic, minced
2 Tbsp. Fresh lemon juice
2 Tbsp. Sesame seeds, toasted
1 tsp. Pesto
2 Tbsp. Olive oil
2 Tbsp. Chopped fresh parsley
1/4 tsp. Black pepper
directions:
In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, garlic, lemon juice, sesame seeds and pesto.
Pulse several times until the mixture is coarsely chopped. Add the olive oil, parsley and pepper.
Puree until smooth and creamy. Move into a serving bowl and top with fresh cilantro is desired.

name: Hummus with Fried Chickpeas
ingredients:
1 1/2 - 2 cups Dry chickpeas, soaked overnight with baking soda
(Reserve 1/2 cup soaking water and chickpeas for frying later)
1 Garlic clove, grated
1 tsp Cumin
1 cup Ice water
Kosher salt
Lemon Olive Oil:
1/2 cup Extra virgin olive oil
2 Lemons, juiced
2 Garlic cloves
To Garnish:
Paprika
Fresh parsley
Fried chickpeas
directions:
Add chickpeas, 1/2 cup water from soaking chickpeas, tahini, garlic, cumin, water, and salt to a food processor and blend until smooth. Taste frequently to season. Add more tahini or lemon as needed.
Add 1/2 inch oil to high-sided skillet. Add 1/2 cup chickpeas and fry until golden brown. Remove to a plate lined with paper towels and season with cumin.
Add lemon olive oil ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
Add hummus to a shallow, wide bowl and use a spoon to make a swirl in the hummus. Top with lemon oil and fried chickpeas. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with pita chips.

name: In and Out Monster Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Ketchup
1/2 cup Mayo
1 Pickle, minced
1 Tbsp Lemon juice
1 tsp Paprika
1 tsp Cayenne
1 Tbsp Parsley
Salt and Pepper to taste
directions: In a medium bowl combine all sauce ingredients, mix well, and set aside.

name: Italian Chicken & Pepper Sandos with Potato Wedges & Tangy Garlic Sauce
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
1 Yellow onion
1 Long green pepper
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Garlic powder
2 Demi-Baguettes
10 oz Chicken cutlets
1 Tbsp Italian seasoning
1 Chicken Stock
1/2 cup Mozzarella cheese
directions:
Adjust racks to top and middle positions and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Halve, core, and thinly slice green pepper into strips.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until golden brown and crispy, 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, and half the garlic powder (you'll use the rest later). Season with salt and pepper.
Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and green pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate.
While veggies cook, in a second small microwave-safe bowl, combine 2 Tbsp butter (4 Tbsp for 4 servings) and remaining garlic powder; microwave until butter is just softened, 10-15 seconds. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper; set aside. Slice baguettes lengthwise, stopping before you get all the way through; spread garlic butter onto cut sides. Place cut sides up on a second baking sheet. Toast on middle rack until golden, 2-3 minutes.
While garlic buns toast, pat chicken* dry with paper towels; season generously with salt and pepper. Heat a large drizzle of oil in pan used for veggies over medium-high heat. Add chicken and Italian Seasoning; cook, stirring, until chicken is browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate and 2 Tbsp water (4 Tbsp for 4 servings). Season with salt and pepper. Return cooked veggies to pan; stir to combine. Turn off heat.
Spread bottom halves of toasted garlic buns with half the garlic sauce. Top with chicken and veggie mixture, then sprinkle with mozzarella. Return to middle rack until cheese melts, 2-3 minutes. Divide sandos and potatoes between plates. Serve with remaining garlic sauce on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1110

name: Italian Chicken over Lemony Spaghetti with Zucchini & Chili Flakes
ingredients:
1 Zucchini
1 clove Garlic
1 Lemon
6 oz Spaghetti
10 oz Chicken cutlets
1 Tbsp Italian seasoning
1 tsp Chili flakes
1 Chicken stock concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim and quarter zucchini lengthwise; cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Peel and mince garlic. Zest and quarter lemon.
Once water is boiling, add spaghetti to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain. (Keep empty pot handy for step 5.)
While pasta cooks, heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add zucchini; cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and softened, 4-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Meanwhile, pat chicken* dry with paper towels and season all over with Italian Seasoning, salt, and pepper. Once zucchini is done, heat a large drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a cutting board to rest. Once cool enough to handle, slice chicken crosswise.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in pot used for spaghetti over medium-high heat. Add garlic, half the lemon zest, and a pinch of chili flakes. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 20-30 seconds. Stir in 1/2 cup reserved pasta cooking water (3/4 cup for 4 servings), stock concentrate, and juice from two lemon wedges (four wedges for 4). Simmer until thickened, 1-2 minutes. Turn off heat.
Add drained spaghetti, zucchini, sour cream, and 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) to pot with sauce; toss to coat. Add half the Parmesan and season with salt and pepper. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved pasta cooking water a splash at a time until spaghetti is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide pasta between bowls. Top with chicken, remaining Parmesan, remaining lemon zest, and a pinch of chili flakes if desired. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 760

name: Jello Popcorn
ingredients:
1 cup corn syrup
1 cup sugar
1 (3 oz.) Package Jello
6 qt. popped corn
directions:
Melt syrup, sugar and jello in sauce pan.
Pour over popped popcorn.

name: Julene's Cinnamon Rolls/Scones
ingredients:
1 cup scalded milk
3 Tbsp. sugar
1 tsp. salt
3 cups flour
1 egg
1/2 cup shortening
1 Tbsp. yeast
1/3 cup warm water
directions:
Dissolve yeast in warm water; set aside.
Add sugar, shortening, and salt to scalded milk.
Add flour, egg, and dissolved yeast to milk mixture and mix well. You may need to add additional flour to make soft dough. You do not want stiff dough! Knead well. Let dough rise for 20 min.
Punch down, and let dough rise for 15 minutes more.
Roll dough into rectangle and add filling.

Filling: 2 Tbsp. melted butter. Spread across dough.
2 tsp. ground cinnamon + 1/2 cup sugar. Sprinkle generously across dough.
Roll dough and seal the edge.
Slice with piece of thread and place on buttered pan. Let rise for 20 minutes.
Bake rolls at 400 degrees for 5 minutes.Then bake at 375 degrees for 5-10 minutes until they are golden brown. Let cool slightly.

Frosting: Combine 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/4 tsp. vanilla, 2 Tbsp. softened butter, and enough milk to make a drizzle. You can add a little almond extract too, if you like. Drizzle over warm rolls.
notes: To make scones: Make dough, let rise for 30 minutes, and fry in the "Fry Daddy."

name: Lazy Day Lasagne
ingredients:
6 oz. lasagna noodles
1/4 tsp. dried oregano, crushed
1 (15 1/2 oz.) jar spaghetti sauce with meat
1 cup cream style cottage cheese
1 (6 oz.)  sliced mozzarella cheese
directions:
Cook noodles in boiling water following package directions.
Drain.
Add oregano to spaghetti sauce.
In greased 10x16x1 1/2 baking dish make layers in this order: noodles, cottage cheese, Mozzarella cheese, spaghetti sauce.
Repeat.
Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Lemon Bars
ingredients:
3 cups all-purpose flour, divided 2 1/2 cups for crust and 1/2 cup for filling
2/3 cups powdered sugar, for the shortbread, plus more for dusting
1/2 tsp salt
12 Tbsp unsalted butter melted
3 Tbsp lemon zest zest of three lemons
3 cups sugar
8 eggs large, room temperature
1 cup lemon juice fresh
directions:
Heat oven to 350F and line a 9x13 baking dish with parchment paper.
Whisk together 2 1/2 cups of flour with the powdered sugar and salt, then pour in the melted butter and mix until combined. You can also do this using a stand mixer with a paddle attachment. If you'd like a dash of vanilla can be added in with the butter at this step.
Sprinkle the dough into your lined pan and press down into a flat layer. Bake at 350F for about 20 minutes or until a light golden color.
While the crust is baking add the sugar to a food processor and add the zest of three lemons. Pulse until the zest is fully incorporated and sugar is a light yellow color. If you don't have a processor just mince the zest and mix with the sugar in a bag or bowl.
Add the sugar and remaining half cup of flour to a large bowl and mix well. You can sift together however and zesty sugar bits will need to get dumped out of the sifter as they might clog things up and not go through.
Pour in the lemon juice and add the eggs then mix very well until completely combined.
Pour the filling onto the warm crust then transfer to oven and bake for about 25 minutes, turning halfway through the bake. Remove from oven and allow to cool for an hour before chilling in the refrigerator for two hours.
Dust with powdered sugar and cut into bars using a clean, sharp, damp knife. Clean and re-wet the knife after each cut.
notes: 9x13 pan. Prep time 20 min, Cook time 55 min, and Chill time 3 hours.

name: Lemon Curd Cake
ingredients:
225g Butter
225g Caster sugar
4 large free range eggs
3 tsp vanilla extract
210g self-raising flour
1 tsp baking powder
Zest and juice of 1 lemon
About 3 Tbsp of milk to loosen batter

300g butter, softened
1/2 tsp vanilla extract
520g icing sugar, sifted

300g caster sugar
50g cornstarch
120ml lemon juice (2-3 lemons)
4 large egg yolks
a pinch of salt
zest of two lemons
60g butter
directions:
For the Lemon curd, place the sugar, corn starch and flour 450ml water in a large saucepan and stir until you have a smooth mixture. Stir in the lemon juice, egg yolks and salt. Place over a medium heat and keep stirring while the mixture boils, for about 10-12 minutes. Stir in the lemon zest and butter has melted, then remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease and line two 21cm tins. 
Cream butter, sugar, and lemon zest together until fluffy and pale. Then beat in the eggs one by one before adding the vanilla extract and lemon juice.
Using a spatula, fold in the flour until you have a smooth mixture. Use a little bit of the milk if you need to loosen the mixture. Should be a little loose.
Divide the mixture into two springform tins, Bake for about 20 minutes, until nice and golden brown. Take then out and let them cool for a few minutes.
While the bases are cooling prepare the buttercream filling by beating the butter and vanilla extract together in a bowl until light and fluffy then add the icing sugar, a little at a time, until it is all incorporated and the mixture is smooth.
assembly: Spread lemon curd on one of the bases before topping with buttercream, then add the second base and sprinkle with icing sugar.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
ingredients:
3 eggs
1-1/2 cups sugar
3 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
3 Tbsp. cornstarch
2 Tbsp. margarine or butter
1-2 tsp. finely shredded lemon peel
1/3 cup lemon juice
1-1/2 cup water
directions:
poke holes in the pie crust and bake at 375 for 25 minutes.
Separate egg yolks from the whites and set aside.
Mix sugar, flour, cornstarch and a dash of salt.
Gradually stir in water and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly.
Reduce heat and cook for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat. 
Beat the egg yolks.
Gradually stir about 1 cup of the hot filling into the yolks.
Pour egg yolk mixture back into the rest of the hot filling.
Bring to a gentle boil then cook for 2 more minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and lemon peel.
Gently stir in lemon juice and keep the filling warm.
Pour warm filling into the crust and spread meringue over it and press into the crust's edges to seal.
Bake at 350 for 15 minutes and cool on a wire rack for 1 hour ad chill for 3-6 hours.

name: Lemon Poppy Seed Scones
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
4 tsp Baking powder
3/4 tsp Salt
1/3 cup Sugar
4 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp Shortening
3/4 cup Cream
1 Egg
1 Lemon, zested
1 Tbsp Poppy seeds
directions:
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, lemon zest, poppy seeds, salt and sugar. Mix Well
Cut in butter and shortening.
In a separate bowl, combine cream with beaten egg then add to dry ingredients. 
Turn dough out onto a floured surface. Roll dough out and cut into biscuit size rounds.
Brush the top with egg wash and sprinkle some sugar on the top.
 Bake for 15 minutes or until brown.
notes: Rather than using lemon zest and poppy seeds, experiment with other flavor combinations.

name: Lemon Red Potatoes
ingredients:
1 1/2 lbs. Medium red potatoes
1/4 cup Water
1/4 cup Butter, melted
3 Tbsp. Minced fresh parsley
1 Tbsp. Lemon juice
1 Tbsp. Minced chives
Salt and Pepper to taste
directions:
Either poke potatoes with a fork or cut a strip of peel around the middle of each potato. Place potatoes and water in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high and set time for 12 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturer's directions. rain any cooking liquid; return potatoes to pressure cooker.
In a small bowl, combine butter, parsley, lemon juice and chives. Pour over the potatoes; toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

name: Lemon Thyme Shortbread Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup Unsalted butter, softened
3/4 cup icing sugar
1/2 tsp Vanilla
1/4 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Lemon Zest, finely grated
1 tsp Fresh thyme leaves
2 cups All-purpose flour
directions:
Using an electric mixer or stand mixer, beat together butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt until light and fluffy. Stir in the lemon zest and thyme. Mix in flour just until combined.
Divide in half and shape into discs. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap, refrigerate until firm but not hard, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 300F.
Roll out each disc, one at a time, on a floured board to a 1/4 inch. Cut out the cookies using a 2 inch cutter and place on a baking sheet covered with parchment. Repeat with second disc.
Bake until golden, about 20 minutes. Let cool on pans for 10 minutes. Remove them and let them cool completely.

name: Lemon Tomato Penne
ingredients:
Olive Oil
1/2 Yellow onion, thinly sliced
Salt
1 Tbsp. red pepper flakes, more to taste
1/2 pound Penne pasta
1/2 (14 oz.) can Crushed whole tomatoes
1.5 oz. Parmigiano Reggiano, grated
Zest of 1 Lemon
Parsley to garnish
directions:
Bring a medium-sized pot of salted water to a boil.
Ina saute pan on high heat, add 2 Tbsp of olive oil and the sliced onion. stir and add a pinch of salt. Once onions begin to turn brown, add a ladle-full of water from the pasta pot.
Continue to cook down the onions and add water until they are soft and medium brown in color, about 25 minutes.
Once onions are caramelized, add a pinch of red pepper flakes and the tomatoes to the saute pan, lower the heat to medium and simmer. If the sauce looks too thick, add water from the pasta pot to thin out.
Add pasta to the boiling water, and cook 2 minutes less than box instructions.
Once the pasta is cooked, add it to the sauce. Turn the heat to high, add a ladle of pasta water and stir well for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, add the cheese, another ladle-full of water, and stir to combine. Stir in Lemon zest and more water if needed to thin out.
Transfer to a plate and garnish with more cheese, parsley and a splash of olive oil.
notes:
Active Time: 15 min
Total Time: 25 min

name: Lime Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
2 Tbsp. Sugar
1/2 cup Cold water
1 Tbsp. Fish sauce
1 Tbsp. Fresh lime juice
1 Cilantro leaf (optional)
directions:
Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat. Stir in the fish sauce and lime juice. Pour into a small bowl. Garnish with a cilantro leaf if desired. 
Store for up to 5 days.
notes: Tasty with shrimp or steamed rice

name: Linguini
ingredients:
1 onion-chopped
1 clove garlic-crushed
1 Tbsp. tomato paste
28 ounces Italian-style tomatoes- drained
1 cup half-and-half cream
1/2 cup parmesan cheese
1 package fresh Linguini or about 8 servings dry linguini-cooked
directions:
Sautรฉ onion and garlic. Stir in tomato paste. 
Add the Italian-style tomatoes, and simmer for about 20 minutes.
In separate pan, warm half-and-half cream, ***BUT NOT TO A BOIL!!!
Pour half-and-half cream over hot cooked linguini.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over linguini and cream; mix together to make sure that cheese sticks to the pasta.
Pour simmering tomato mixture over all. Mix together and serve.

name: Lollipops
ingredients:
1 cup sugar
1/3 cup white corn starch
1/2 cup water
1/2 tsp. flavoring
Food Coloring
directions:
Grease inside of molds with shortening.
Place mold on greased flat surface like a flat baking sheet.
Place clips over tabs of molds and insert sucker stick.
Combine sugar, water, and corn syrup.
Cook on medium high heat in sauce pan.
Remove from heat and let cool to 275 degrees.
Add flavoring and food coloring.
Pour into molds.
Allow candy to cool then remove molds from lollipops.
Set lollipops on second flat surface to complete cooling.
notes: Specific flavoring from store

name: Mac and Cheese Donuts
ingredients:
6 to 8 ritz crackers
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese, shredded
8 oz macaroni noodles
1 large egg, beaten
1/4 cup whole milk
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
directions:
Preheat oven to 350F. Mix cracker crumbs, one Tbsp of melted butter, and 1/2 cup of shredded cheese. Set aside. 
Cook macaroni in salted water according to package instructions, until al dente. Drain and return to the pot. Add the remaining melted butter and beaten egg. Stir to coat and cooked macaroni. Then mix in the milk, flour, and the remaining shredded cheese.
Spoon the mixture equally into a greased donut pan. Sprinkle the tops with the cracker crumb and cheese mixture.
Bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and firm.

name: Mac and Cheese Pasotto
ingredients:
1 1/2 Tbsp. Butter
1 Shallot, minced
1 Slice bacon, sliced into 1-inch squares
1 cup Small elbow pasta
1 cup Chicken stock
1 cup Yellow cheddar cheese, grated
1 Tbsp. Cream
1 Tbsp. Chives, minced
directions:
Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1 Tbsp butter and the shallots. Saute until fragrant. Add elbow pasta and the chicken stock; cover.
Toss or stir every 2 minutes for 8 minutes. Remove top and allow stock to reduce.
When the stock is evaporated, check the doneness of the pasta. If it needs to cook longer, add some warm water or more stock.
Once the pasta is fully cooked, add the shredded cheddar and fontina.
Once the cheese is melted and incorporated, add 1/2 Tbsp butter and the cream to finish. Top with chives.

name: Marbled Cream Cheese Squares
ingredients:
Filling:
8 oz. Cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup Granulated sugar
1 Egg
2 Tbsp All-purpose flour
base:
3/4 cup Butter
4 Squares (1 oz. each) unsweetened chocolate
1 1/2 cups Granulated sugar
3 Eggs
1 Tbsp Milk
1 cup All-purpose flour
1 cup Chopped nuts
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a medium bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg until incorporated. Blend in flour. Set aside.
Base: in a sauce pan, over low heat, melt butter and chocolate, stirring until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.
When mixture has cooled, stir in sugar. Beat in eggs until blended. Stir in milk. Blend in flour. Stir in nuts.
Spread half the batter evenly in prepared pan. Spread filling evenly over base. Spread remaining batter evenly over filling. Run a knife through the layers to create a marbling effect. Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely and pan, then cut into squares.
notes: 9-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Meatballs with Bulgogi Sauce plus Roasted Green Beans, Ginger Rice & Sriracha Crema
ingredients:
6 oz Green beans
1 Thumb Ginger
2 Scallions
3/4 cup Rice
10 oz Ground Beef
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
4 oz Bulgogi Sauce
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1 tsp Sriracha
1 Tbsp Sesame Seeds
directions:
Adjust racks to middle and top positions and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Peel and mince or grate ginger. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens; mince whites. Trim green beans if necessary.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add half the ginger; cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in rice, 1.25 cups water (2.25 cups for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
Form & Bake Meatballs
While rice cooks, in a large bowl, combine beef*, scallion whites, panko, remaining ginger, and 1 Tbsp bulgogi sauce (2 Tbsp for 4 servings). (You'll use the rest of the bulgogi sauce later.) Season with salt (we used 3/4 tsp; 1.5 tsp for 4) and pepper. Form into 1.5-inch meatballs; place on a baking sheet. Bake meatballs on middle rack until browned and cooked through, 14-16 minutes.
Toss green beans on a second baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and tender, 12-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine sour cream with Sriracha to taste. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Once meatballs are done, carefully transfer to a second large bowl; add remaining bulgogi sauce and toss to coat.
Fluff rice with a fork; taste and season with salt if desired. Divide rice between plates and top with green beans, meatballs, and any bulgogi sauce from bowl. Drizzle with Sriracha crema. Garnish with scallion greens and as many sesame seeds as you like. Serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 870

name: Melon Rainbow Pops
ingredients:
Simple Syrup:
1/3 cup Water
1/3 cup Sugar
Pops:
1 1/2 cup Watermelon, cubed
2 Tbsp Lime juice
1 1/4 cup Honeydew, cubed
2 Tbsp Lemon juice
1 1/2 cup Cantaloupe, cubed
2 Tbsp Grapefruit juice
directions:
Stir sugar into boiling water and whisk until dissolved. Remove and chill until cold.
Had watermelon, lime juice and 1 to 2 Tbsp simple syrup to the blender and blend until smooth. Fill six popsicle molds or paper cups 1/3 of the way full. Pop into the freezer for 40 minutes.
Rinse out blender and add honeydew, 1 to 2 Tbsp simple syrup, and lemon juice. Blend until smooth. Add to container to chill.
Rinse out blender once more and blend cantaloupe, grapefruit juice, and 1 to 2 Tbsp simple syrup. Remove to a container to chill.
After the watermelon a semi - firm, add honeydew to the mold. Place in freezer for 40 more minutes, then top with the cantaloupe. Place in freezer until completely firm, another four hours.

name: Middle Eastern Chickpea Bowls with Savory Pistachio Rice & Garlicky White Sauce
ingredients:
1 Yellow onion
1 clove Garlic
13.4 oz Chickpeas
1/4 oz Cilantro
1 Lemon
1 Tbsp Shawarma spice blend
4 oz Grape tomatoes
1/2 cup Basmati Rice
1 Veggie stock concentrate
4 Tbsp Sour cream
1 tsp Hot sauce
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Halve, peel, and cut onion into 1/2-inch thick wedges; mince a few wedges until you have 2 Tbsp. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Roughly chop pistachios. Drain and rinse chickpeas; pat very dry with paper towels. Roughly chop cilantro.
