Zest and quarter lemon. 4 SERVINGS: Adjust racks to top and middle positions. Mince a few onion wedges until you have 4 Tbsp.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add minced onion, half the garlic, half the pistachios (save the rest for serving), half the Shawarma Spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, 1 minute. Stir in rice, 3/4 cup water, stock concentrate, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat. 4 SERVINGS: Use 2 Tbsp butter, a medium pot, and 1.5 cups water.
Meanwhile, toss onion wedges, tomatoes, and chickpeas on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, remaining Shawarma Spice, pepper, and a few pinches of salt. Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until veggies are tender and lightly charred and chickpeas are crispy, 18-20 minutes. 4 SERVINGS: Divide everything between 2 baking sheets; roast on top and middle racks, tossing veggies and swapping rack positions halfway through roasting. TIP: It's natural for chickpeas to pop a bit.
While veggies and chickpeas roast, in a small bowl, combine sour cream and remaining garlic to taste. Season with salt. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter and half the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper. Once veggies and chickpeas are done, remove from oven and toss with lemon zest.
Divide rice between shallow bowls. Top with veggies and chickpeas. Drizzle with garlicky white sauce and hot sauce to taste. Sprinkle with remaining pistachios and cilantro. Top with lemon juice to taste; serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min. Calories: 660

name: Mike's chocolate Peanut Butter Milkshake
ingredients:
1 cup Vannilla ice cream
1/3 cup milk
1/4 cup Hershey Syrup
1/8 cup Jif Creamy Peanut Butter
1/2 cup ice (2-4 ice cubes)
directions:
Put all of the ingredients into the blender.
Blend on max until thoroughly mixed and smooth.

name: Milk Chocolate Peanut Butter Creme Brulee
ingredients:
3 cups Heavy cream
1/2 cup Whole milk
1/2 cup Peanuts, toasted
1/2 cup Granulated sugar
3 1/2 oz. Milk chocolate, finely chopped
1/4 cup Smooth peanut butter, such as jif
7 Large egg yolks
1/4 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Raw sugar
directions:
Bring the heavy cream and milk to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat, remove from the stove, and stir in the peanuts. Let sit, covered, for at least 1 hour. Strain the mixture, wipe out the pan and return the mixer to the pan.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the mixture back on the stove, add 1/4 cup of the granulated sugar, and bring to a simmer, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from the heat and whisk in the chocolate and peanut butter. Whisk together the yolks, the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and the salt in a large bowl until pale color. 
Slowly whisk in the hot chocolate mixture and continue whisking until combined. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl.
Place four 8-ounce ramekins inside a large baking dish and using a ladle, divide the mixture evenly among the ramekins. Pour hot water into the dish until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake until the custard will continue to cook as it cools. Let cool to room temperature, then cover each ramekin with plastic wrap and refrigerator until cold, at least 4 hours and up to 24 hours.
Preheat the broiler until very hot.
Sprinkle an even coat of the turbinado or raw sugar over each custard, place the ramekins on a baking sheet, and broil until the sugar is melted and dark golden brown, about 2 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

name: Minestrone
ingredients:
3 cups water
1 pound beef stew meat
1 onion, chopped
2 carrots diced
2 stalks celery, sliced
1 pint stewed tomatoes
2 tsp. salt
1 10-ounce package frozen mixed vegetables
1/2 cup shredded cabbage
1 Tbsp. dried basil
1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 cup vermicelli
1 16-ounce can garbanzo beans
1 tsp. oregano 
1 zucchini, sliced
directions:
Place all ingredients except zucchini in crock pot
cover and cook on low 10 to 16 hours or on high 4 to 6 hours.
Add zucchini during last hour of cooking. 
Remove from crock pot and let cool until serving.

name: Mini Chocolate Fudge Cream pies
ingredients:
1 cup (2 sticks) Unsalted butter, softened
1/2 cup Granulated sugar
2 cups All-purpose flour
1/2 tsp salt
8 (1 oz.) Semi-sweet chocolate squares
1/4 cup Milk
1 tsp Vanilla
1 (16 oz) Frozen whipped topping
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 24-cup mini muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until well combined. Add the flour and salt and mix until a ball of dough forms.
Divide dough into 24 (2 tsp sized) balls and press each one into the bottom and up the sides of each greased muffin cup. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and press the crust back into the pan with the tip of your finger or the back of a small spoon. Return to the oven for 6-8 minutes longer or until the crusts are just starting to turn brown. Remove from the oven and let cool.
Ina large microwavable bowl, melt the chocolate adn milk on medium power in 30-second intervals until completely melted. Let cool for about 10 minutes. Stir in the vanilla and then fold in 1-1/2 cups of the thawed whipping topping.
Scoop a few tsp of the fudge filling into each pie crust until full.
Serve with whipped topping and chocolate shavings on top or store covered with plastic wrap in the refridgerator. (let sit for 15 minutes after removing from the fridge.)

name: Mini Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients:
Unbaked biscuit
flour
1/2 tsp. butter
1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. sugar
1-1/2 tsp. water
2 Tbsp. powdered sugar
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees.
On floured baking sheet, roll out biscuit until thin as a pancake.
Spread butter on top.
Mix cinnamon and sugar in a bowl.
Sprinkle the mixture onto the roll. Roll it into long snake shape.
Pinch the edges and cut dough into tiny slices.
Bake rolls for 8 minutes.
Mix water and powdered sugar in bowl until smooth.
Dip the tops of baked cinnamon rolls into the frosting.
notes:
Rolling Pin
Small bowls
Kitchen Scissors
Baking sheet

name: Mini Croissants
ingredients:
Single cresent roll triangle, unbaked
Chocolate chips
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees.
Roll triangle out to be as thin as a tortilla.
Cut dough into smaller triangles.
Roll triangles from the wide edge to the thin edge and pinch the ends so croissant looks like a cresent moon.
Place on baking sheet.
Cook for 8 minutes.
Melt chocolate chips in microwave for a few seconds and use toothpick to drip chocolate onto croissant.
notes:
Rolling pin
Pizza cutter
baking sheet

name: Mint Chip Truffles
ingredients:
1/2 cup Hazelnuts
1/2 Walnuts
3/4 cups Coconuts flakes
1/4 cup Medjool dates, pitted
1/2 canned coconut milk, chilled overnight
1/4 cup Cocoa powder, plus more for coating
1/2 cup dark chocolate chips
1/2 tsp Mint extract
Pinch of Sea salt
directions:
In a food processor and blend nuts and coconut flakes. Set aside.
Add dates to food processor and blend until they form a single ball.
Place nut and coconut mixture back into the food processor, and blend to combine. Add remaining ingredients and blend until combined.
Transfer "dough" to the freezer for 15 minutes to harden.
Remove from the freezer and roll in 1-inch balls. Place balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze for 30 to 45 minutes.
Once frozen, roll in coca powder or melted dark chocolate.

name: Mint Chocolate Meringues
ingredients:
2 egg whites
1 tsp Peppermint extract
2 drops green food coloring
1/2 cup sugar
1 tsp corn flour
2 Tbsp finely chopped dark chocolate
directions:
Preheat the oven to 235 degrees and line 2 baking trays with parchment paper.
Put the egg whites in a dry medium sized bowl and whisk until soft peaks form. Gradually add in the sugar one Tbsp at a time until fully incorporated. 
Add in the peppermint extract and food coloring. Continue whisking until the sugar has dissolved and the meringue is thick and glossy.
Whisk in the corn flour and chocolate.
Drop heaped Tbsp onto prepared trays and reduce oven temperature to 200. 
Bake for 1 hour and ten minutes or until they are crisp and hollow.
Turn off the oven and leave the meringues to cool with the door ajar.

name: Mint Swirl Brownies
ingredients:
3 oz. cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup butter, softened
3/4 cup sugar
2 eggs
2/3 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1/4 tsp. salt
1 oz. unsweetened chocolate, melted and cooled
1/2 tsp. peppermint extract
several drops green food coloring

Chocolate glaze:
1 oz. square unsweetened chocolate
1 Tbsp. butter
1 cup sifted powdered sugar
1/2 tsp. vanilla
Boiling water (about 2 Tbsp.)
directions:
Cream together cream cheese, butter and sugar; beat in eggs.
Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into creamed mixture.
Spoon half of the batter from Tbsp checkerboard fashion into greased 9x9 baking pan.
To remaining batter, stir in extract and food coloring.
Spoon green batter into open spaces in baking pan.
Swirl with spatula to marble; do not over mix.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Cool; pour Chocolate Glaze over top.

To make Chocolate Glaze, melt chocolate and butter over low heat; stir constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until crumbly.
Blend in enough boiling water until of pouring consistency.
notes: 1/3 cup chopped nuts (optional)

name: Minty Thins
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Crisco shortening +
1 tsp Crisco shortening
1 cup semisweet nestle chocolate chips
18 chocolate wafer cookies Nabisco Famous
Green sparkling sugar, India Tree
directions:
In a medium microwave safe bowl, combine shortening and mint extract. Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Add Chocolate chips.
Microwave on medium for 1 1/2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds. Stir chocolate mixture until smooth.
Dip bottom of each cookie into the chocolate mixture and spread sooth with a knife.
Place cookies, chocolate side up on a wire rack. Let stand for about an hour or until chocolate hardens.
Repeat with other side of each wafer cookie so the whole cookie is covered with chocolate. 
Let stand until chocolate hardens, sprinkling with sparkling sugar before it hardens.
notes: Freeze well for 1 month.

name: Mom's Pancake Recipe
ingredients:
1 cup flour
1 Tbsp. sugar
2 tsp. baking powder
1/2 tsp. salt
1 cup milk
1 egg
2 Tbsp. oil
directions:
Mix all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
Mix egg, milk, and oil together in a separate bowl.
Add milk, egg, and oil mixture to dry ingredients.
Mix well.

name: Monkey Bread
ingredients:
1/2 cup sugar
2 cans Pillsbury grands
tsp cinnamon
1 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup butter
directions:
pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
lightly grease bundt cake pan or cupcake tray
Separate dough into 16 biscuits
cut each biscuit in to 4 pieces
Put cinnamon and sugar into  a large bag and shake
Put in 1/2 of the biscuits (32) and shake until coated in cinnamon/sugar mixture
Put in pan
Melt butter and add brown sugar and pour over first half of dough
repeat 6-9 for second half
Bake for 28-35 minutes.
notes:
optional ingredients:
1/2 cup of walnuts
Pour butterscotch pudding on top

name: Monterey Jack Un-Fried Chicken, Potato Wedges & Sriracha Mayo
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
1 Tbsp Butter
1 Tbsp Ranch Spice
10 oz chicken cutlets
4 Tbsp Mayo
1 tsp Sriracha
directions:
Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch thick wedges.
Place 1 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Stir in panko, Monterey Jack, half the Ranch spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), salt, and pepper.
Toss potatoes on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, remaining ranch spice, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Place on a plate. Spread tops of chicken with 1 tsp mayo each (you'll use the rest in the next step). Mound with panko mixture, pressing firmly to adhere (no need to coat the undersides).
Once potatoes have roasted 5 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Carefully place chicken, coated sides up, on empty side.
Roast until potatoes are golden brown and tender and chicken is cooked through, 15-18 minutes more.
In a second small bowl, combine remaining mayo with Sriracha to taste.
Divide chicken and potato wedges between plates. Serve with Sriracha mayo on the side for dipping.
notes: With green beans, this recipe is 770 calories. Prep 10 min Cook 35 min

name: Moo Shu Pork Bowls with Cabbage, Scallions & Buttery Rice
ingredients:
2 Scallions
1 Lime
10 oz Ground Pork
4 oz Shredded Red Cabbage
2 Tbsp Hoisin sauce
1 oz Sweet Thai Chili sauce
2 Tbsp Sweet Soy Glaze
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
1 Tbsp Sesame seeds
directions:
Wash and dry produce. In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Quarter lime.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork* and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. TIP: If there's excess grease in your pan, carefully pour it out.
Stir scallion whites and cabbage into pan with pork; cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, 2-3 minutes. Stir in hoisin, chili sauce, 2ยฝ Tbsp sweet soy glaze (5 Tbsp for 4 servings), and ยฝ tsp sugar (1 tsp for 4) until thoroughly combined. Turn off heat. Taste and season with juice from half the lime (whole lime for 4), salt, and pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork and stir in 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Divide rice between bowls and top with moo shu pork. Sprinkle with scallion greens and as many sesame seeds as you like. Serve with any remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 760

name: Muddie Buddies
ingredients:
4 1/2 cups Chex cereal
1/2 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/4 cup smooth peanut butter
2 Tbsp unsalted butter
1 cup confectioner's sugar
directions:
Combine the chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter and microwave for 30 seconds on high heat. Pour on top of the Chex cereal, stirring until the cereal is well coated. Pour this mixture into a large ziploc bag and add the powdered sugar. Shake until well coated.
Transfer onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper and let cool.

name: Mushroom Stroganoff
ingredients:
2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
1/2 yellow onion, diced
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1 lb (454 g) baby portobello mushrooms , sliced
1 1/2 cups (355 ml) chicken broth
2 tsp (10 ml) soy sauce
1 tsp dried thyme
1/2 cup (60 g) sour cream
2 Tbsp (16 g) flour
1 lb (454 g) farfalle pasta, cooked
Salt and black pepper, to taste
Fresh parsley, chopped
directions:
Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until fragrant and the onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Then add the mushrooms and cook until they release their juices and become soft, about 7 minutes.
Stir in the vegetable broth, soy sauce or tamari and thyme, and stir to combine. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the liquid has reduced by a third, about 10 minutes. Mix in the Vegan Sour Cream and flour. Continue to simmer until the sauce thickens, another 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
Cook the pasta according to package directions, until al dente. Drain, rinse and return the noodles to the pot. Pour the mushroom sauce over the pasta and stir to coat. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Divide the pasta between 4 bowls and garnish with freshly chopped parsley. Serve immediately.
notes: stirred in 2 Tbsp of lemon juice to the sauce after removing from the heat. It adds a subtle zing. Try with 1 Tbsp first and taste, add more if desired.

name: Nachos Supreme
ingredients:
1 lb. Ground Beef
1 Package taco seasoning
1 Tomato Soup
1-1/2 c. Water
1-1/2 c. Uncooked Rice
Shredded Cheese
Shredded Lettuce
Salsa
Tortilla Chips
directions:
Cook beef and taco seasoning in skillet until browned.
Drain off grease.
Add soup, water and rice.
Heat to boil.
Cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes or until done.

name: Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
2-1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. salt
1 cup softened butter
3/4 cup granulated sugar
3/4 cup brown sugar
1 tsp. vanilla extract
2 eggs
2 cups chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 375.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium sized bowl.
Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla extract in large bowl (or bosch/kitchen aid).
Add eggs one at a time to the mixture, beating well after each egg.
Gradually beat flour mixture into the large bowl.
Stir in chocolate chips *and chopped nuts.
notes: *1 cup chopped nuts optional

name: No-Bake Oreo Strawberry Cheesecake
ingredients:
2 tsp Powdered gelatin
3 1/2 Tbsp Hot water
9 Oreos + 4, cut in half, for decoration
2 Tbsp butter, melted
7 Whole strawberries, cut in half
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese, softened at room temperature
1/2 cup Heavy cream
1/2 cup Yogurt
1/2 cup Strawberry jam
1 Tbsp Lemon juice
5 Whole strawberries, cut into cubes
directions:
Sprinkle gelatin into hot water and set aside for 10 minutes.
Combine 9 Oreos and melted butter inside a Ziploc bag and crush until crumbly.
Pour crumbs into a cheesecake pan lined with parchment paper and flatten down firmly with a spoon.
Arrange strawberry halves around the sides, with the insides of the strawberries facing outwards.
In a blender, combine cream cheese, heavy cream, yogurt, jam, lemon juice and gelatin mixture into the pan. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Once chilled and firm, transfer to a serving plate and decorate with more Oreos.

name: Oatmeal Cookies
ingredients:
1/4 Ib. butter
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 egg
1/4 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1/2 baking soda
1 cup flour
3/4 cup oatmeal
1/4 tsp. salt
1/4 cup chopped walnuts
directions:
Mix all ingredients.
When dough is formed into balls dip tops in granulated sugar before placing on cookie sheet.

name: Old Bay Buttered-Up Chicken with Garlic Mashed Potatoes & Roasted Veggies
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter
6 oz Carrots
2 Scallions
6 oz Green Beans
1 Tbsp Old Bay seasoning
1 tsp Hot sauce
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Place 2 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; bring to room temperature. Dice potatoes into 1/2 inch pieces. Peel Garlic. Trim, peel, and halve carrots lengthwise; slice into green-bean-size pieces. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating white from greens.
Trim green beans if necessary. Toss carrots and green beans on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until veggies are tender, 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, to bowl with softened butter, add 1/2 tsp Old Bay Seasoning and hot sauce to taste; mix to combine.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season with 1 tsp Old Bay Seasoning. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add scallion whites; cook, stirring, until softened, 1 minute. Stir in stock concentrate and 1/4 cup water. Simmer until thickened, 1-2 minutes. Turn off heat and stir in 1 Tbsp plain butter until melted.
Divide chicken veggies between plates. Top chicken with pan sauce, then dollop with Old Bay butter. Garnish with scallion greens and serve.
notes: 680 Calories with mashed potatoes. Prep 10 min and cook 40 min

name: Olive Garden Alfredo Sauce
ingredients:
8 oz fettuccine
1 Tbsp Unsalted butter
3 cloves garlic, pressed
1/2 cup Heavy cream
1/2 cup Whole milk, or more, to taste
1/3 cup freshly grated Parmesan
1 large egg yolk, beaten
Salt and pepper to taste
2 Tbsp fresh parsley
directions:
Combine butter, garlic, heavy cream, and milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer; remove from heat and stir in Parmesan and egg yolk, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
Temper the eggs until they are warmer, then slowly add the egg mixture to the remaining cream mixture.
If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed.
Stir into pasta (drained well) or add to the fabulous meal of your choosing.
notes:
I don't know where the fettuccine fits into the recipe.
Add to noodles, grilled chicken, or seafood.

name: Olive Garden Salad - Dressing
ingredients:
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/3 cup white vinegar
1 tsp. vegetable oil
2 Tbsp. corn syrup
4 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
1/4 tsp. Garlic salt
1/2 tsp. Italian seasoning
1/2 tsp. dry parsley flakes
1 Tbsp lemon juice
directions:
Mix all ingredients in a blender until well mixed.
If it's too tart, add a bit of sugar.

name: Olive Garden Salad - Salad
ingredients:
1 Head romaine lettuce
red onion, sliced
sweet banana peppers (from a jar)
Black olives
Tomatoes, sliced
Croutons 
Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
directions: Assemble ingredients as desired and top with dressing right before serving.

name: One-Pan Cajun Pork Sausage Skillet with Dirty Rice & Parsley Crema
ingredients:
9 oz Italian pork sausage
1/2 cup Jasmine rice
1 Yellow onion
1/4 cup Monterey jack cheese
1 Bell pepper
1/5 oz Tomato paste
2 Chicken stock concentrates
1 Tbsp Cajun spice blend
2 tsp Hot sauce
4 Tbsp Sour cream
1 Roma tomato
1/4 oz Parsley
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Core, deseed, and dice bell pepper into 1/2-inch pieces. Halve, peel, and dice half the onion (whole onion for 4 servings) into 1/2-inch pieces. Dice tomato into 1/2-inch pieces. Remove sausage* from casing; discard casing.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a medium, preferably nonstick, pan over medium- high heat (use a large pan for 4 servings). Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-4 minutes (it'll finish cooking later). Using a slotted spoon, transfer sausage to a paper-towel-lined plate, keeping as much oil in pan as possible.
Heat another drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and diced onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until veggies are lightly browned, 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add rice, diced tomato, tomato paste, Cajun Spice, 1/2 tsp salt (1 tsp for 4 servings), and a pinch of pepper to pan with veggies. Cook, stirring frequently, 30 seconds. Add stock concentrate and 1.5 cups water (3 cups for 4) to pan and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, until liquid is reduced by half, 3-4 minutes. Return sausage to pan. Cover pan and reduce heat to low; cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. TIP: Add a splash of water if pan seems dry.
While rice cooks, pick parsley leaves from stems; finely chop leaves. In a small bowl, combine sour cream with half the chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Stir remaining chopped parsley into rice skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with Monterey Jack and parsley crema. Divide between plates and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 760

name: One-Pan Cheesy Beef Tortilla Melts with Green Bell Pepper & Spicy Cream Sauce
ingredients:
1 Green bell pepper
4 Tbsp Sour cream
4 Tbsp Cream cheese
2 tsp Hot sauce
10 oz Ground beef
1 Beef stock concentrate
 2 Flour tortillas
1/2 cup Cheddar cheese
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve, core, and thinly slice bell pepper into strips. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine sour cream, cream cheese, 1 tsp water (2 tsp for 4 servings), and hot sauce to taste. (Start with half the hot sauce, then taste and add more from there if you like things spicy.) Microwave until softened, 30 seconds. Stir to combine.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened, 2-3 minutes.
Add beef* to pan with bell pepper. Season with a big pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until beef is browned and cooked through and bell pepper is tender, 3-4 minutes. Carefully drain any excess grease in pan. Stir in stock concentrate until combined. Turn off heat.
Place tortillas on a clean work surface. Spread one half of each tortilla with half the cream sauce (save the rest for serving). Using a slotted spoon, top cream sauce with beef filling, then sprinkle with cheddar. Fold tortillas in half to create tortilla melts.
Wipe out pan used for filling. Melt 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) in same pan over medium heat. Add tortilla melts (work in batches for 4); cook until tortillas are golden brown and cheese melts, 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined cutting board.
Cut tortilla melts into wedges. Divide between plates and serve with remaining cream sauce on top or on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 870

name: One Pan Pasta
ingredients:
200g Spaghetti
200g Cherry tomatoes
1 small onion
3 cloves garlic, finely sliced
Small handful of basil, roughly chopped
2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil
Pecorino cheese, shaved
sea salt and pepper
directions:
Arrange the tomatoes, basil, onion, and garlic across the base of a large frying pan and pour over the olive oil and 600ml of water or chicken stock.
Place the pan over a medium high heat and bring the contents of the pan to a boil. Using a tongs, stir the pasta regularly and cook for about 10 minutes until it's cooked and the liquid has nearly evaporated creating a sauce.
Add an extra splash of water if the sauce becomes too thick.
Remove the pan from heat and stir in the pecorino cheese and a little more basil. Season to serve.

name: One-Pan Pork Carnitas Tacos with Pickled Onion & Monterey Jack Cheese
ingredients:
1 Yellow onion
1 Poblano pepper
1 Roma tomato
1/4 oz Cilantro
5 tsp White Wine Vinegar
10 oz Ground pork
1 Tbsp Southwest spice blend
1 Chicken stock concentrate
1.5 oz Tomato paste
2 Tbsp Sour cream
1 tsp Chipotle powder
6 Four tortillas
1/4 cup Monterey jack cheese
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve and peel onion; thinly slice one half and finely chop remaining. Core, deseed, and dice poblano into 1/2-inch pieces. Dice tomato. Roughly chop cilantro.
In a medium bowl, combine sliced onion, vinegar, 2 tsp sugar, 1 Tbsp water, and salt (we used 1/2 tsp). Stir until sugar and salt are mostly dissolved. Set aside to pickle, stirring occasionally, until ready to serve.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork* and season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano and chopped onion; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 3-4 minutes. Return pork to pan along with Southwest Spice, stock concentrate, half the tomato paste (all for 4 servings), and 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4). Cook, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan, until mixture is thickened and saucy, 1-2 minutes more.
While filling cooks, in a small bowl, combine sour cream, a bit of onion pickling liquid to taste (start with 1/4 tsp and add more if desired), and a pinch of chipotle powder (add more to taste if you like things spicy). Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Wrap tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds.
Divide tortillas between plates; fill with pork filling, tomato, Monterey Jack, cilantro, pickled onion (draining first), and crema. TIP: Alternatively, put everything in individual serving bowls and let everyone assemble their own tacos!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 860

name: One-Pan Santa Fe Pork Tacos with Monterey Jack & Cilantro Lemon Slaw
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
1/4 ounce Cilantro
1 Lemon
10 ounce Ground Pork
1 Tbsp Southwest
Spice Blend
4 ounce Shredded Red Cabbage
2 Tbsp Mayonnaise
1-2
Tbsp Tex-Mex Paste
6 Flour Tortillas
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Cooking Oil
1 tsp Sugar
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve, peel, and finely dice onion. Finely chop cilantro. Quarter lemon.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt; cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened and lightly browned, 2-3 minutes. Add pork* and Southwest Spice. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. TIP: If there's excess grease in your pan, carefully pour it out.
While pork cooks, in a large bowl, combine cabbage, mayonnaise, half the cilantro, juice from half the lemon (whole lemon for 4 servings), 1 tsp sugar (2 tsp for 4), and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Stir Tex-Mex paste into pan with pork mixture until fully coated. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Remove pan from heat. Wrap tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds. Divide tortillas between plates and fill with pork filling, Monterey Jack, slaw, sour cream, and remaining cilantro. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep 5 min and Total cook time 20 min. Calories: 920

name: Saucy Beef & Charred Poblano Tacos with Mango Salsa & Smoky Red Pepper Crema
ingredients:
4 oz Mango
1 Roma tomato
1 Yellow onion
1 Lemon
1 Poblano pepper
10 oz Ground beef
1 Tbsp Blackening spice
1 Beef stock concentrate
6 Flour tortillas
4 Tbsp Sour cream
2 tsp Smoked paprika
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Drain mango. Finely dice tomato. Halve and peel onion; thinly slice one half. Mince a few slices until you have 1 Tbsp. (For 4 servings, thinly slice whole onion; mince a few slices until you have 2 Tbsp.) Zest and quarter lime (for 4, zest 1 lime and quarter both). Halve, core, and thinly slice poblano into strips.
In a small bowl, combine mango, tomato, minced onion, lime zest, and juice from half the lime. Season with salt.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano, sliced onion, and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly charred, 5-7 minutes. (TIP: Add a splash of water if veggies begin to brown too quickly.) Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat another drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add beef*, Blackening Spice, and a big pinch of salt. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces and stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate and 2 Tbsp water (3 Tbsp for 4 servings); bring to a simmer. Return veggies to pan, stirring, until thoroughly combined. (TIP: Add a splash or two of water, if necessary, until mixture is saucy.) Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, wrap tortillas in damp paper towels. Microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds.
Divide tortillas between plates and fill with beef and veggie filling. Top with mango salsa and smoky red pepper crema. Serve with remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 830

name: One-Pot Baked Ziti
ingredients:
1 Red onion, diced
1 Package dry ziti
1 Jar tomato puree (about 2 cups)
1 1/2 cups Water, or just enough to cover the pasta
4 Heaping Tbsp Fresh ricotta
1 Small bunch fresh basil
1 cup Shredded mozzarella
Salt, to taste
directions:
Heat a pan with olive oil over medium-high heat and quickly saute the onion until fragrant. Add the ziti, tomato puree and water. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook according to pasta box directions, then remove the cover.
Turn oven broil setting to high.
Dollop the ricotta into the pan and stir through the pasta to combine. Tear basil leaves into the pot and stir to gently wilt in the pasta.
Fold half of the shredded mozzarella into the pasta to incorporate, then sprinkle the other half over top for a cheesy layer. Taste; the cheese might have enough salt in it depending on the brand. If not, add salt to taste.
Place the uncovered casserole in the over on the second highest rack. Broil for 5 minutes or until the top cheese layer is golden.

name: One-Pot Longhorn Pork & Bean Chili with Jalapeno & Smoky Red Pepper Crema
ingredients:
2 Scallions
1 Jalapeno
1 Roma tomato
10 oz Ground pork
2 Tbsp Southwest spice blend
2 Chicken stock concentrate
13.76 oz Crushed tomatoes
1 Tex-mex paste
13.4 oz Black beans
2 Tbsp Smoky red pepper crema
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Thinly slice half the jalapeno into rounds; mince remaining. (TIP: Remove ribs and seeds for less heat.) Dice tomato.
Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add scallion whites and as much minced jalapeno as desired. Season with salt. Cook, stirring, until softened, 5-7 minutes.
Add pork* and Southwest Spice to pot with aromatics; season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until pork is browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes.
Stir diced tomato, Tex-Mex paste, and half the crushed tomatoes (all for 4 servings) into pot; cook until slightly darkened in color, 1-2 minutes. Add beans and their liquid, stock concentrates, 1/4 cup water (1/2 cup for 4 servings), salt, and pepper; stir to combine. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened, 8-10 minutes. Turn off heat. (TIP: If chili is too thick, add another splash of water.) Taste and season with salt and pepper. Divide chili between bowls. Top with smoky red pepper crema, scallion greens, and as much sliced jalapeno as you like. Serve.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 720

name: Onion Rings
ingredients:
1 egg
1/4 cup Vegetable oil
1 cup Milk
1 cup Flour
1/2 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking powder
2 Large sweet onions, sliced
1/2 cup Flour (For coating the onions)
oil For frying
directions:
Mix egg, oil, and milk on low speed of mixer for 1 minute.
Add dry ingredients and mix until smooth
Coat onions in flour.
Dip in batter.
When one side is golden, turn to the other side.
Fry in hot oil 350-375 F until desired shade of brown.
notes: If 375 is cooking the batter but the onion is still raw, lower the temperature of the oil to cook them slower. This will allow more time for the onion to soften up.

name: Orange Julius
ingredients:
6 oz. Frozen Orange Juice
1 cup milk
1 cup water
1/2 cup sugar
1 tsp. vanilla
3/4 tray of ice cubes
directions: Blend everything together in bender until desired consistency.

name: Orange Rolls
ingredients:
3 eggs
1 cup milk
3 Tbsp. butter
1 cake yeast
1/4 cup water with 1 tsp. sugar
4-5 cups flour
1/2 cup sugar
1 tsp. salt

1/2 cup soft butter
1 large orange, grated
1/2 cup sugar
directions:
Beat eggs in a large bread bowl.
Scald milk, add butter, sugar and salt, and cool to lukewarm.
Add yeast mixture.
Add 1 cup of flour and mix well with a whip.
Let rise 1-2 hours then add remaining flour.
Mix well with a spoon. Don't knead.
Cover and let rise 2 hours.

Mix the last three ingredients.
Roll out dough as for cinnamon rolls.
Spread with the above mixture.
Cut into 2 dozen rolls and let rise for 1 hour.
Bake at  355 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

name: Oreo Cheesecake Tart
ingredients:
Crust:
2 cups Oreos, crushed
1/2 cup Unsalted melted butter
Cheesecake:
8 oz. Cream cheese (room temperature)
3 Tbsp Peanut butter
1/2 cup Cream (35% fat content)
1 tsp Vanilla
1 cup Powdered sugar
Ganache:
1 1/3 cup Dark chocolate
3/4 cup Cream (35% fat content)
Topping:
3/4 cup Chopped Reeses peanut butter cups
directions:
Crust: Add whole Oreos to a food processor and blend until you reach a fine crumb. Add melted butter and mix until well combined. It should look like wet soil.
Add to a tart tin either rectangle (36 x 13 x cm) or round 12 inches. Use the back of a Tbsp to evenly distribute crust around pressing down firmly on the side and bottom. Chill for 1 hour.
Cheesecake: Add all ingredients to a large mixing bowl and use a hand mixer or a wooden spoon and mix until well combined.
Ganache: Add chocolate and cream to a microwave safe bowl and microwave for 20 seconds at a time mixing each time until it becomes smooth.
Add cheesecake to the tart tin and use a Tbsp to spread evenly. Pour on ganache (set aside a little to drizzle on top) and spread evenly. Sprinkle the chopped Reeses peanut butter cups, drizzle more ganache on top.
Serve chilled.

name: Oreo Pie
ingredients:
3 packs Oreo
1 stick Butter (1/2 cup)
1 cup Double cream
1 cup Icing sugar
4 oz. Cream cheese
1/2 cup Milk chocolate, melted
directions:
Blitz the oreos in the food processor.
Add in the melted butter and stir.
Pressed into a greased pie tin and push down evenly with a spatula or the back of a spoon until the bottom and sides are completely covered.
Leave in the fridge to set while you make the filling.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the double cream, icing sugar and the cream cheese. Break up the remaining cookies and place half in the mix. Remove the pie shell from its tin at this point and place on a plate or board.
Pour in the filling and keep in the fridge until serving for at least an hour.
Just before serving drizzle over the melted chocolate and the rest of the broken cookies if there are some left.

name: Pancakes
ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 1/2 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp salt
1 egg, slightly beaten
1 1/2 cups milk
2 Tbsp melted butter
directions:
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. 
In a separate bowl, combine egg and milk; add to flour mixture, stirring only until smooth.
Blend in melted butter.
Cook.

name: Parmesan Zucchini Fries
ingredients:
1 1/2 pounds zucchini, trimmed
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
2 tsp. kosher salt, divided
3/4 tsp. ground black pepper, divided
3 large eggs
1 1/2 cups panko or plain bread crumbs
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 Tbsp. chopped dill (optional)
directions:
Preheat oven to 425ยฐ. Arrange an oven rack in the lower third of the oven and a second one in the center. Line 2 rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper. Cut zucchini into thick French-fry-size sticks, about 3 inches long. 
Arrange 3 shallow, wide bowls or pie plates in a row. In the first bowl, stir together flour, 1 tsp. salt, and 1/2 tsp. pepper. In the second bowl, whisk together eggs, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper. In the third bowl, combine panko, Parmesan, dill (if using), and 1/2 tsp. salt. 
Working in batches, first dip zucchini in flour, shaking off excess. Transfer to egg mixture and toss until coated. Let excess egg run off, then coat zucchini in panko mixture. 
Arrange zucchini, without crowding, in a single layer on the prepared pans. Bake 15 minutes and then rotate the pans. Continue to bake until panko coating is golden and crisp, 7 to 12 minutes more.

name: Parmesan Zucchini Sticks
ingredients:
4 Zucchini, quartered lengthwise
1/2 cup Grated Parmesan
1/2 tsp Dried thyme
1/2 tsp Dried Oregano
1/2 tsp Dried basil
1/4 tsp Garlic powder
salt and pepper to taste
2 Tbsp. olive oil
2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a cooling rack with nonstick spray and place on a baking sheet; set aside.
In a small bowl, combine Parmesan, thyme, oregano, basil, garlic powder, salt and pepper, to taste.
Place zucchini onto prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with Parmesan mixture. Place into oven and bake until tender, about 15 minutes. Then broil for 2-3 minutes, or until crisp and golden brown.
Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.

name: Pasta with Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
ingredients:
12 oz. penne pasta
1 (8.5 oz.) jar sun-dried tomatoes packed in olive oil
2 garlic cloves
Salt and freshly ground pepper
1 cup Fresh basil
1/2 cup Freshly grated Parmesan cheese
directions:
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, blend the sun-dried tomatoes and the oil, garlic, salt and pepper to taste, and basil in a food processor and blend until tomatoes are finely chopped.
Transfer the tomato mixture to a large bowl. Stir in the Parmesan.
Add the pasta to the pesto and toss to coat, adding enough reserved cooking liquid to moisten.
Season the pasta, to taste, with salt and pepper.

name: Peach Cobbler
ingredients:
4 cups sliced peaches
1/3 cup sugar
2 Tbsp. corn starch

1-1/2 cup flour
2 tsp. baking powder
1/3 cup sugar
1/2 tsp. salt
4 Tbsp. shortening
1 egg beaten
2/3 cup milk approximately
directions:
Mix peach ingredients and bring to a boil.
To make biscuit dough, cut shortening into dry ingredients.
Mix egg and milk together and add to rest of mixture, stirring just enough to combine.
Arrange dough by spoonfuls.
Bake for 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Peanut Brittle
ingredients:
1 cup white corn starch
2 cup sugar
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup raw peanuts
2 Tbsp. butter
2 tsp. vanilla
2 tsp. baking soda
1/2 tsp. salt
directions:
Combine syrup, sugar and water in a saucepan.
Slowly bring to 230 degrees or until syrup spins a thread.
Add peanuts and continue to cook to 300 degrees.
Remove from heat, add remaining ingredients.
Stir until blended.
Pour into well buttered jiffy roll pan or large platter.
Then, if desired, put on counter top and pull when cool and break into pieces.

name: Peanut Butter and Honey Oatmeal Drops
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour
1 tsp Baking soda
1 tsp Salt
1 1/2 cups Quick cooking rolled oats
1 1/2 cups Crunchy peanut butter
2 cups Liquid honey
3 Eggs
1 Tbsp Water
2 tsp Vanilla
2 cups Craisins or Raisins
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt and oats.
In a large bowl, mix together peanut butter, honey, eggs, water, vanilla until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix well. Fold in Craisins. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes until firm.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 2-inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until tops spring back when lightly touched. Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Peanut Butter Chip Scones
ingredients:
2 cups All-purpose flour
1/2 cup Sugar
2 tsp Baking powder
1/2 tsp Baking soda
1/2 tsp Salt
6 Tbsp Cold butter, cubed
1/2 cup Peanut butter
1/3 cup Heavy cream
1 Egg, beaten
1/4 cup Semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/4 cup Peanut butter chocolate chips
1 Tbsp Milk
1 Tbsp Coarse sugar for dusting
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Cut the cold butter into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter, two forks, or crumble the butter in with your fingers.
Mix in the peanut butter, heavy cream, beaten egg, and both chocolate chips until completely combines and chocolate chips are evenly dispersed. (Do NOT over mix even with extra chunks of butter.)
Form dough into mounds and place on baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches between the scones. Don't compact them too much or they will lose their fluffiness.
Brush milk over the raw scones and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for about 12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Peanut Butter Cookie Brownie Bars
ingredients:
Non stick cooking spray
1 package (19.9 ounces) dark chocolate brownie mix, Duncan Hines
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1/4 cup milk
2 eggs
1 package (16 ounces) refrigerated filled peanut butter cookie dough, nestle ultimates
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
Spray 9" square baking pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, stir together brownie mix, oil, milk, and eggs until well mixed. Pour half the batter into prepared baking pan.
Break apart cookie dough pieces and randomly drop the pieces into the batter.
Pour the rest of the remaining batter over the cookie dough and spread it smoothly.
(Sprinkle on the nuts).
Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
notes: sprinkle 1 package (2.25 ounces) of nuts on top is desired

name: Peanut Butter Cup Ice Cream
ingredients:
2 Cup heavy Whipping Cream
14 oz. Sweetened Condensed Milk
1/2 Cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
1/2 Cup Peanut Butter 
40 Reese's Miniatures
directions:
Place Reese's in freezer long enough for them to harden.
Add cocoa powder to sweetened condensed milk and stir until dissolved.
Heat Peanut Butter in microwave for 20 seconds to melt, then stir and set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, whisk heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Fold in condensed milk mixture until blended.
Unwrap and cut peanut butter cups in quarters.
Fold 2/3 of the candy into the mixture.
Spread a third of this mixture into a loaf pan and drizzle with melted peanut butter.
Repeat this for two more layers.
Take a knife and run through pan to swirl mixture.
Top with the remaining candy pieces.
Cover with foil and freeze for 6 hours or until firm.

name: Peanut Butter Cup Pizza
ingredients:
1 Pizza crust
-2-1/2 cups flour
-1 Tbsp. sugar 
-1 Tbsp. yeast
-1/2 tsp. salt
-1 cup warm water
-2 Tbsp. oil
Enough Chocolate Chips to cover a pizza crust
Reese's Peanut Butter Cups
Some form of Peanut Butter Drizzle
directions:
Make Pizza Crust - Mix 2 cups of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add water and oil; mix well.
Add remaining flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
While the crust is still warm, spread chocolate chips across the crust.
Cut up reese's Peanut Butter cups and sprinkle across.
Drizzle peanut Butter drizzle stuff on top of everything.
notes: Makes one pizza crust

name: Peanut Butter Frosting
ingredients:
1/3 cup Creamy Peanut Butter
4-1/2 cups powdered sugar
1/4 cup milk
1-1/2 tsp. vanilla
directions:
In a mixing bowl beat peanut butter till fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar. beat well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup of milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining powdered sugar.
Beat in additional milk, if needed, to reach spreading consistency.
notes: add additional milk to thin consistency.

name: Peanut Butter Lava Cake
ingredients:
Peanut Butter Sauce:
1 cup Heavy cream
1 cup Smooth peanut butter
1/3 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Corn syrup
Lava Cake:
8 oz. Dark chocolate, chopped
8 Tbsp Unsalted butter, divided
2 Eggs
2 Egg yolks
2/3 cup Sugar
1/4 cup Flour, sifted
1 Tbsp Dark cocoa powder sifted
8 Tbsp Smooth Peanut butter
directions:
Peanut Butter Sauce: In a small saucepan, combine all peanut butter sauce ingredients and cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Set aside to cool.
Lava Cake: Preheat oven to 425 F. With one Tbsp of butter, grease for 1 cup ramekins or cake molds well.
In a medium heatproof bowl set over a pot of simmering water, melt chocolate and remaining butter, stirring occasionally. 
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, yolks and sugar until combined, then add the flour and cocoa powder. Add the chocolate mixture and mix until well combined.
Spoon an eighth of the chocolate mixture into each mold, then make a well in the batter and spoon 2 Tbsp of peanut butter into the center of each.
Cover with the remaining chocolate mixture, and place all 4 molds on a sturdy baking sheet. Bake for about 13 minutes, or until sides are set but the center of the cakes retain a bit of a jiggle.
Turn out cakes as quickly as possible, top with peanut butter sauce, dust with cocoa powder and serve immediately. It is important to serve lava cakes before they cool so the center will remain liquid.

name: Pecan-Crusted Chicken with Honey Mustard Sauce & Lemony Apple Sauce
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter
1/2 oz Pecans
1/4 cup Panko breadcrumbs
1 Tbsp Fry seasoning
2 tsp Honey
2 tsp Dijon mustard
2 Tbsp Mayo
10 oz Chicken cutlets
1 Apple
1 Lemon
2 oz Mixed greens
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Finely chop pecans (or crush in a bag with a rolling pin).
Place 1 Tbsp Butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Let cool slightly, then stir in chopped pecans, panko, half the fry seasoning (you'll use the rest later), a drizzle of olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, combine honey, mustard, and mayo.
Season chicken with remaining fry seasoning, salt, and pepper. Place on a lightly oiled baking sheet (or parchment paper). Evenly spread tops of chicken with a thin layer of honey mustard sauce (save the rest for serving). Mound with pecan mixture, pressing firmly to adhere (no need to coat the undersides of the chicken). Roast on middle rack until crust is golden brown and chicken is cooked through, 15-20 minutes.
Meanwhile, halve, core, and thinly slice apple. Quarter lemon. In a large bowl, toss mixed greens and apple with a large drizzle of olive oil and as much lemon juice as you like. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide chicken and salad between plates. Drizzle chicken with remaining honey mustard sauce. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: 610 calories. Prep 5 min and cook 30 min

name: Peppermint Hot Chocolate Molten Cake
ingredients:
1/2 cup Unsalted butter
6 oz Bittersweet chocolate, melted
2 Large eggs
2 Large egg yolks
1/4 cup sugar
Pinch of Fine sea salt
2 Tbsp All-purpose flour
1 tsp Peppermint extract
Peppermint Ganache:
8 oz Bittersweet or semisweet chocolate
1/2 cup Heavy cream
1 tsp Cayenne pepper
4 drops Peppermint extract
directions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Butter and lightly flour four 6-oz ramekins. Tap out excess flour over sink.
Place a nonreactive bowl over a pot of simmering water. 
Add butter and chocolate to bowl and melt together, stirring occasionally.
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and egg yolks, sugar and salt until pale and thickened.
Whisk chocolate and butter mixture until completely smooth. Using a rubber spatula, quickly fold the chocolate mixture into egg mixture along with the flour until smooth. Add peppermint extract and mix.
Evenly pour batter into prepared ramekins. Transfer ramekins to a rimmed sheet tray and bake in oven until tops are almost set but center is jiggly, about 12 minutes.
In the meantime, prepare ganache. Place chocolate in a nonreactive bowl. Heat heavy cream in a saucepan over medium heat just until cream reaches a boil.
Pour hot cream over chocolate and let stand for 1 minute. Stir chocolate with cayenne until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add peppermint extract and stir. Set aside.
Remove cakes from oven and allow to cool in ramekins for 1 minute. Place dessert plate on top of each ramekin and flip cakes.
Let ramekins stand for 10 seconds before removing. Drizzle ganache over the tops of the cakes and allow to drip.

name: Pfefferneusse (Pepper Nuts)
ingredients:
1 cup molasses
1 cup white karo syrup
1/2 cup shortening
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/2 lemon juiced (use real lemon)
1 lemon rind grated
1 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 tsp. cloves
1/2 tsp. allspice
5 cup flour
1/2 tsp. baking soda
directions:
Warm molasses, karo syrup, shortening, and brown sugar in  pot and stir until dissolved.
Add lemon juice, rind, and spices.
Add flour mixed with baking soda.
Stir then refrigerate until chilled.
Make rolls about the size of a penny.
Cut several rolls at a time if you like, 1/3 inch thick.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes.
Let cool a few seconds before removing from cookie sheet.

name: Pie Crust
ingredients:
3 cups flour
2 tsp. sugar
1 tsp. salt

1-1/4 cups shortening

1 Tbsp. vinegar
1 egg
5 Tbsp.
directions:
Mix first 3 ingredients together.
Cut in the shortening.
In a small bowl, mix the last 3 ingredients.
Then mix all ingredients together.
Don't stir for too long or the crust won't be moist.
Divide into 4 balls.
roll ball of dough out on a floured piece of wax paper.
flip wax paper over into the pie pan.

name: Pineapple Coconut Smoothies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sweetened coconut milk
1/2 cup Frozen pineapple
1 Banana
1/4 - 1/2 cup Vanilla Greek yogurt
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Put coconut milk, pineapple, and banana into a blender and blend for about 15 seconds. 
Add the yogurt and honey,
Blend until smooth.
Serve as a smoothie or turn the mixture into Popsicles.

name: Pita Chips
ingredients:
1 Tbsp. Sesame seeds
6 Small Pita Breads
1 Egg white, slightly beaten
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Toast the sesame seeds for 1 minutes over low heat in a  small frying pan. Remove from heat.
Brush the pita with the egg white. Sprinkle with the toasted sesame seeds. Cut each pita into 6 wedges. Arrange the wedges in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake until lightly brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a rack and let cool.
The chips can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for 2 weeks.

name: Pork Chili 'n' Cheese Stuffed Poblanos with Black Beans, Fresh Salsa & Smoky Red Pepper Lime Crema
ingredients:
2 Poblano pepper
1 Roma tomato
1 Yellow onion
1 Lime
13.4 oz Black beans
2 Tbsp Smoky Red pepper crema
10 oz Ground Pork
1 Tbsp Southwest spice blend
1.5 oz Tomato paste
1 Chick stock concentrate
1/2 cup White cheddar cheese
1 tsp Hot sauce
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve poblanos lengthwise; remove stems and seeds. Dice tomato. Halve, peel, and finely chop onion. Zest and quarter lime. Drain and rinse beans.
Place poblano halves on a baking sheet and rub all over with a drizzle of oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and softened, 15-18 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine tomato, 2 Tbsp onion (4 Tbsp for 4 servings), half the lime zest, and a squeeze of lime juice to taste. Season with salt and pepper. In a separate small bowl, combine smoky red pepper crema, remaining lime zest, and a squeeze of lime juice to taste. Season with salt and pepper. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add remaining onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 4-5 minutes. Add pork* and Southwest Spice; season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes.
Add tomato paste, stock concentrate, half the beans (use the rest as you like), and 1/4 cup water to pan with pork filling. (For 4 servings, use all the beans and 1/3 cup water.) Stir until mixture is saucy and thoroughly combined, 1-2 minutes. Season generously with salt and pepper. Once poblano halves are done roasting, remove sheet from oven. Stuff with up to half the filling (save the rest for serving). Evenly sprinkle with cheddar. Return to oven until cheese melts, 3-4 minutes.
Divide remaining filling between plates; top with stuffed poblanos, salsa, and crema. Drizzle with hot sauce if desired. Serve with any remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 800

name: Pork Meatloaf Parm over Spaghetti Marinara
ingredients:
1/4 cup Panko
1/2 cup Mozzarella cheese
10 oz Ground pork
1 Tbsp Tuscan heat spice
14 oz Marinara sauce
6 oz Spaghetti
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. In a small bowl, combine panko, mozzarella, and a large drizzle of olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine pork*, half the panko mixture, half the Tuscan Heat Spice (you'll use the rest later), and 1 Tbsp water (2 Tbsp for 4 servings); season generously with salt (we used 1/2 tsp; 1 tsp for 4) and pepper. Form pork mixture into two 1-inch-tall loaves (four loaves for 4); flatten tops. Place on a lightly oiled baking sheet.
Evenly spread tops of meatloaves with 1 Tbsp marinara sauce each (you'll use the rest later). Mound with remaining panko mixture, pressing gently to adhere. Bake meatloaves on top rack until pork is cooked through and crust is browned and crispy, 22-28 minutes.
Once water is boiling, add spaghetti to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1/4 cup pasta cooking water (1/3 cup for 4 servings), then drain.
Heat pot used for pasta over medium- high heat. Add remaining marinara sauce, remaining Tuscan Heat Spice, 1 tsp sugar (2 tsp for 4 servings), and reserved pasta cooking water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook until slightly thickened, 3-5 minutes.
Stir drained spaghetti, half the Parmesan, and 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) into pot with sauce. Season generously with salt and pepper. Divide pasta between plates and top with meatloaves. (TIP: If you prefer, serve meatloaves on the side instead.) Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1070

name: Potato Wedges with Parmesan
ingredients:
3 Large russet potatoes, cut into wedges
4 Tbsp Olive oil
3 tsp Sea salt
3 tsp Garlic powder
2 tsp Italian seasoning
3/4 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Place potato wedges in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil, then sprinkle with salt, garlic powder, Italian seasoning and Parmesan cheese. Use hands to mix well, making sure all wedges are well coated.
On a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, spread out potato wedges in a single layer. Bake for 25-35 minutes, until potatoes are golden.

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffins
ingredients:
4 Eggs 
2 cups Sugar
1 can (15 oz) Solid-packed pumpkin puree
1 1/2 cups Canola oil
3 cups All-purpose flour
2 tsp Baking soda
1 tsp Baking powder
1 Tbsp Pumpkin pie spice
1 tsp Salt
2 cups (12 oz) Semisweet chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 400ยฐ. Place paper liners in a regular sized muffin pan.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs, sugar, pumpkin and oil until smooth. Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice and salt; Add flour mixture slowly to pumpkin mixture and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths to almost all the way full.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Do not over bake. It makes all the difference between a good and a great muffin. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

name: Pumpkin Pie
ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2 tsp. ground ginger
1/4 tsp. ground cloves
2 large eggs
1 can Libby's 100% pumpkin
1 can evaporated milk
directions:
Mix sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger and cloves in a small bowl.
Beat eggs in a large bowl.
Stir in pumpkin and sugar spice mixture.
Gradually stir in the evaporated milk.
Pour into the pie crust.
Bake in preheated oven at 425 for 15 minutes.
reduce temperature to 350.
Bake for 40-50 minutes or until knife comes out clean.
Cool on wire rack for 2 hours.

name: Pumpkin-Oat Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/2 cups quick oats
1 tsp baking soda
3/4 tsp salt
1 3/4 tsp ground cinnamon
1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
1.4 tsp ground ginger
1 cup unsalted butter, softened
1 1/3 cups packed light brown sugar
2/3 cup granulated sugar
1 large egg
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 1/4 cups canned pumpkin puree
1 3/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a mixing bowl whisk together flour baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger for 30 seconds, set aside.
In an electric mixing bowl, whip together butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until creamy.
Blend in egg then blend in vanilla extract and pumpkin puree. 
With mixer set on low, slowly add in dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Mix in chocolate chips and let batter rest for 5-10 minutes.
Scoop dough onto a cookie pan and bake for 12-14 minutes.

name: Queso Fundido
ingredients:
1 Tbsp unsalted butter
1 Tbsp all-purpose flour
1 cup whole milk
12 ounces monterey jack cheese, grated (about 3 cups)
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
8 ounces goat cheese, sliced into 8 rounds
2 Tbsp chopped fresh cilantro
directions:
Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; add the flour and cook, whisking, 1 minute. Whisk in the milk and cook, whisking, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the monterey jack. Add 1/4 tsp salt, and pepper to taste. Turn on the broiler.
Scrape the cheese mixture into an 8-inch cast-iron pan and arrange the goat cheese rounds on top. Broil until golden brown in spots. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and sprinkle with the cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips.
notes: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/bobby-flay/queso-fundido-with-roasted-poblano-vinaigrette-recipe.html?oc=linkback

name: Raspberry Cheesecake Dessert Parfait
ingredients:
Cheesecake mousse:
1/2 cup White granulated sugar
4 Large eggs
1 tsp Vanilla extract
1 cup Heavy cream
1/3 cup All-purpose flour
1 cup White chocolate chips
16 oz Cream cheese
2 cups Fresh or frozen (thawed) Raspberries
1 tsp Raspberry extract
2 cups Whipping cream
1/4 cup granulated sugar
16 oz package raspberry Jell-o
1 cup Fresh raspberries
Mint leaves for garnish
directions:
Begin by preparing custard base for the cheesecake: Whisk together 1/2 cup sugar with 4 egg yolks and vanilla extract in a small bowl. 
In a small saucepan, whisk together 1 cup cream with the flour. Cook the cream mixture over low heat for a few minutes until hot; Stir constantly and whisk vigorously to remove clumps. Slowly pour cream into the egg yolks, whisking constantly. Cook custard over low/medium heat for 7-10 minutes until thickened.
Remove from heat and add white chocolate; whisk until completely melted. Cover custard and set aside to cool to room temperature.
meanwhile, prepare crust. Place pretzels and graham crackers in a food processor and crush into small crumbs. combine crumbs with 1/3 cup melted butter; set aside. 
Once custard has cooled, prepare cheesecake mousse. Whisk cream cheese in a mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Add the two cups raspberries and the raspberry extract. Mix until raspberries are completely crushed. Add the cooled custard and blend until well combined; scrape down sides of bowl often. Remove mixture from mixer bowl into a separate bowl.
Into clean mixer bowl, add the remaining two cups heavy cream and 1/4 cups sugar. Whisk on high speed until stiff peaks form. Fold 1 cup whipped cream into cream cheese mixture, then gradually begin folding cream cheese into the whipped cream.Fold very gently so the whipped cream stays light and airy.
To assemble dessert, spoon several Tbsp of graham cracker crumbs into plastic or glass cups. Transfer mousse into a pastry bag and pipe into cups, filling about 3/4 of the cup. Place cups into the refrigerator for about 1 hour to set.
Prepare the Jell-o according the package instructions replacing the cold water with ice water to cool down the mixture faster. Add fresh raspberries on top of the mousse, then carefully pour over the Jell-o. Fill the cups to the brim. Place in refrigerator to set completely (4-6 hours). Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

name: Raspberry Cheesecake Dessert Parfait - Crust
ingredients:
Crust:
12 Graham crackers
1 1/2 cups Salted pretzels
1/3 cup Melted butter
notes: This is the Cheesecake crust for the Cheesecake Mousse

name: Raspberry Chocolate Chip Crackles
ingredients:
1/4 cup Butter (no substitutes)
10 oz. Raspberry chocolate chips
2 cups All-purpose flour
2 tsp Baking powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1 1/2 cups Granulated sugar
4 Eggs
1/2 cup Finely chopped walnuts
Confectioner's sugar, sifted
directions:
Preheat oven to 300 F.
In the top of a double broiler, over hot water, melt butter with 1 cup raspberry chocolate chips, stirring until smooth. Remove from hot water and set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat sugar with melted butter mixture. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until incorporated. Beat in flour mixture until well blended. Fold in walnuts and remaining raspberry chips. Wrap dough tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Shape dough into 1 inch balls about 2 inches apart on prepared cookie sheets. Bake in oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until cracked on the surface but set in the middle.

name: Raspberry Jam
ingredients:
800g Fresh raspberries
260g Sugar
1-2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
directions:
Place the raspberries and sugar in a pot set to medium heat. Stir until the sugar has melted.
Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil. Scoop the scum off the surface. Reduce until your desired consistency is reached.
Add the lemon juice and mix well. Pour the jam into a sterilized jar and screw the lid on top. Flip over and place in the fridge to chill.

name: Raspberry Mustard Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Raspberry jam
1/4 cup honey
2 Tbsp. Dijon Mustard
1/2 tsp Cayenne pepper
1 Tbsp. Fresh lemon juice
1/4 tsp Pepper
directions: Combine all ingredients. Cover and chill until serving time.
notes: Eat with roast turkey or grilled chicken.

name: Reeses Peanut Butter Candy
ingredients:
2-1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs
1 Ib. powdered sugar, sifted
2 cubes butter, melted
1-1/2 cup peanut butter
6 oz. chocolate chips
directions:
Combine everything except for the chocolate chips.
Press into a small baking pan 9x9.
Melt the chocolate chips and spread on top.

name: Risotto with Shrimp and Asparagus
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Unsalted butter
1 Small onion, finely diced
6 garlic cloves, minced
1 2/3 cups Arborio rice, uncooked
1 cup White wine
4 cups Reduced-sodium chicken broth
1/2 cup Shredded Parmesan cheese, divided
2 Tbsp Olive oil
3 Garlic cloves, minced
2 lbs. Uncooked shrimp (26-30 per lb.), peeled and deveined
1 Tbsp Unsalted butter
1/2 cup Italian salad dressing
1 lb. Fresh asparagus, trimmed
Salt and Pepper to taste
directions:
Select saute setting on a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker and adjust for high heat; warm butter until melted. Add onion; cook 4-5 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Add rice; cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup wine; cook and stir until absorbed. Add remaining wine, broth, and 1/4 cup cheese. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high. Set the time for 8 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturer's directions; stir.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Add shrimp; cook and stir until the shrimp begin to turn pink, about 5 minutes. Add butter and dressing; stir until butter melts. Reduce heat. Add asparagus; cook until tender, 3-5 minutes. Serve over risotto. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
notes: Cook time: 30 minutes

name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Vinegar and Honey
ingredients:
1 1/2 pounds Brussels sprouts, halved, stems and ragged outer leaves removed*
3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil
3/4 tsp kosher salt
1/2 tsp freshly ground black pepper
1 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
1 tsp honey
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 and set an oven rack in the middle position. Line a baking sheet with heavy-duty aluminum foil.
Cut Brussel sprouts in half. If you have some brussels sprouts that are very large, cut them into quarters. They should all be cut about the same size to ensure even cooking.
Directly on the prepared baking sheet, toss the Brussels sprouts with 2 Tbsp of the oil, the salt, and the pepper. Roast, stirring once halfway through, until tender and golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Drizzle the remaining Tbsp of oil, the balsamic vinegar and the honey over the roasted Brussels sprouts. Toss to coat evenly. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary, then serve.
notes: Cook time 30 min. Calories: 116

name: Roasted Chickpeas
ingredients:
1 1/2 cup Canned Chickpeas, strained and pat dried
2 tsp Old Bay seasoning
1 Tbsp Grated Parmesan
Olive Oil
directions: Preheat oven to 375 F. Toss everything together and spread on a baking sheet. Baked for 30 minutes, tossing the chickpeas every 10 minutes to prevent burning.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Roasted Garlic Spread
ingredients:
4 whole heads garlic
2 Tbsp. Olive oil
1/2 tsp. Fresh thyme or 1/4 tsp. dried
Salt and pepper to taste
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
Remove the papery outside layer of the garlic. Trim 1/4 inch off the tops of the garlic heads. Place them in an ovenproof dish and brush with the oil. Sprinkle with thyme, salt and pepper. Cover the dish with foil and bake 1 1/2 hours, or until very tender.
Serve warm or at room temperature. To remove the garlic, gently squeeze if from the husks.

name: Roasted Strawberries (Ice Cream)
ingredients:
Roasted Strawberries:
3 cups Fresh strawberries, hulled and halved
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 tsp kosher salt
Roasted Strawberry Coconut Ice Cream:
2 cups Full fat coconut milk
1/2 cup Roasted strawberries, plus some for topping
1/4 cup Honey
1 tsp Vanilla extract
Pinch of Salt
Chopped pistachios for serving
directions:
Roasted Strawberries: Preheat oven to 375F. Place strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Toss with sugar and salt. Roast for 20-25 minutes.
Roasted Strawberry Coconut Ice Cream: In a bowl, combine coconut milk, roasted strawberries, honey, vanilla, and salt. Transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze until set. Serve with more roasted strawberries and chopped pistachios.

name: Rosemary and Onion Focaccia
ingredients:
Pizza dough
6 Tbsp. Olive oil
1/2 tsp. Salt
3 Large onions, sliced thinly
1 tsp. Sugar
1/2 tsp. Salt
1 Tbsp. Chopped Rosemary
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
directions:
Follow Pizza dough recipe instructions. Roll or press the dough to fit an oiled baking sheet. Cover with a small towel and let rise. 
When the dough has risen, dimple the top with your fingers. Brush with 3 Tbsp. of olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Set aside.
Heat the remaining 3 Tbsp. of olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over low heat. Add the onions, sugar, salt, and rosemary. Cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are tender and lightly brown. Cool to room temperature.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Spread the onions evenly over the dough. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. 
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the bottom is crisp. Cut into 2-inch wedges and serve.

name: S'more Dip
ingredients:
Chocolate chips
Peanut Butter Chips
Large Marshmallows
Graham Crackers
directions:
Pour as many chocolate chips of both kinds into the bottom of the pan.
Line and cover the top of the chocolate with the large marshmallows.
put in oven long enough to melt the chocolate and slightly brown the marshmallows.
Dip graham crackers into the melt mixture and eat.
notes: experiment with temperatures

name: Salt Dough
ingredients:
2 cup Flour
1 cup Salt
1 Tbsp. oil
Water
Food Coloring (optional)
directions:
Combine salt and flour.
Add oil and enough water to give it a clay like consistency.
mix food coloring into water before adding it to the mixture if you wish to color it.
Add more water a little at a time until the mixture is pliable but not sticky.
Knead slightly.
Keep in air tight container.
notes:
Less oily and more salty than clay in book one.
Primary book recipe.

name: Salted Caramel
ingredients:
1cup Granulated sugar
2 Tbsp Water
6 Tbsp Unsalted butter
1/2 cup Heavy cream
1 to 1/2 tsp sea salt
directions:
In a medium saucepan, heat sugar and water on medium high heat. 
Cook until sugar turns into amber hue. DO NOT USE YOUR SPOON TO STIR. it'll cause the caramel to crystalize.
Quickly add the butter and swirl into the pan until it's combined.
Then add the cream and sea salt and stir to combine.
Let cool completely.
notes: Add into the middle layer of the brownies. then spread the rest on top.

name: Salted Caramel and Chocolate Ice Cream
ingredients:
Caramel:
3/4 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Water
1 cup Cream, room temperature
1/2 tsp Sea Salt Flakes
Ice Cream:
1 1/2 cups Milk
3/4 cup Heavy Cream
6 Egg yolks
2 Tbsp Sugar
Chocolate Ganache Swirl:
6 oz Dark chocolate chips
1/3 cup Heavy cream
1/2 tsp. Cayenne pepper
directions:
Heat sugar and water in large saute pan. When it begins to melt and turn amber, swirl the pan to incorporate all the sugar and cook until fully melted and amber. Pour the room temperature cream and salt flakes into the sugar mixture and transfer to a bowl to cool.
While it's cooling, heat the milk and heavy cream to a slight simmer.
While that's heating, beat the egg yolks and sugar until pale yellow. Temper the egg yolks by slowly pouring the heated milk and cream into the yolks. Return the mixture to the original pot and cook slowly while stirring until it coats the back of the wooden spoon. Pour this mixture into the caramel and stir to fully incorporate. Chill for 2-4 hours.
Once the custard is cool, add it to an ice cream maker and churn until thick.
When the mixture is almost done, make the ganache. Heat the chocolate chips over a double boiler until melted, then stir in cream and cayenne. Cool at room temperature, then pour into the ice cream maker. Continue to churn for about 40 seconds.
Put ice cream in a container and freeze for at least two hours.

name: Salted Caramel Brownies
ingredients:
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
1 1/4 cup sugar
1 stick unsalted butter
2 eggs, cold
1/8 tsp baking soda
1 Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 tsp vanilla extract
1/2 cup chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment or foil, set aside.
In a medium saucepan, melt butter and sugar on medium high heat.
Once melted, remove and stir in vanilla extract and cocoa powder. Set aside and let cool for 5 minutes.
To the cooled butter mixture, whisk in egg one at a time, mix until incorporated. 
In a large bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, cornstarch and salt.
Incorporate the butter mixture to the flour mixture and mix until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips, and pour brownie batter over prepared pan. 
Next, take salted caramel and drizzle over brownies. Using the back of a spoon, swirl the caramel around.
Bake brownies for 22-25 minutes, or until brownies are set.

name: Salted Caramel Meringues
ingredients:
4 egg whites 
220 g caster sugar
1 tsp vanilla
Sea salt flakes
Salted caramel sauce
Caramel chew candy
directions:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
Line a flat baking tray with baking paper.
Whip the egg whites on high speed with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Gradually, and very slowly, add the sugar 1 Tbsp at a time, while whipping it together on a medium high speed.
Once all the sugar is in, add the vanilla extract and continue whipping for 5-6 minutes or until you reach stiff peaks. If you can turn the bowl upside down and no meringue fall out, you know it's done.
Dab a little meringue on the corners of the baking tray and stick the baking paper to it. This prevents it from flying around the oven.
Scoop the meringue onto the tray to form little mounds,
Bake the meringues for 90 minutes. Do not open the oven door at any point or they will crack. Once they're finished, turn off the heat and leave them in the oven to cool completely.
Drizzle salted caramel sauce over the meringue mounds, sprinkle on some sea salt flakes and add caramel chews.
notes: Stores for 3 days (not refridgerated)

name: Saucy Pork Burrito Bowls with Charred Poblano, Smoky Crema, Salsa Fresca & Cilantro Lime Rice
ingredients:
1/2 cup Jasmine rice
1 Roma tomato
1 Yellow onion
1 Lemon
1 Poblano pepper
1/4 oz Cilantro
10 oz Ground pork
2 Tbsp Smoky red pepper crema
1 Tex-mex paste
directions:
In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, wash and dry all produce. Finely dice tomato. Halve, peel, and cut half the onion (whole onion for 4 servings) into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Mince one wedge until you have 1 Tbsp (2 Tbsp for 4). Zest and quarter lime. Core, deseed, and dice poblano into 1/2-inch pieces. Mince cilantro.
In a small bowl, combine tomato, minced onion, and a big squeeze of lime juice; season with salt. Add smoky red pepper crema to a separate small bowl. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a medium pan (use a large pan for 4 servings) over medium-high heat. Add poblano and onion wedges. Season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly charred, 7-9 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add pork* and a big pinch of salt. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 4-6 minutes. Stir in Tex-Mex paste and 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4 servings) until combined. Bring to a simmer and cook until mixture is saucy and pork is cooked through, 1-2 minutes more. Turn off heat.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lime zest and half the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper. TIP: Stir in 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) for extra richness. Divide rice between bowls and top with veggies, saucy pork, any remaining sauce from pan, salsa, crema, and remaining cilantro. Serve with remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 650

name: Scalloped Hasselback Potatoes
ingredients:
2 whole golden potatoes
2 Tbsp butter
1 piece about 2 inches long parmigiano-reggiano cheese, sliced thinly
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/4 tsp kosher salt
2 tsp olive oil
1/4 cup heavy cream
1/4 cup cheddar cheese, blend
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Scrub potatoes.
You need 2 wooden spoons with handles of the same width. Place a spoon on each side of the potato and start slicing the potato into thin slices. The spoons will stop the knife from cutting all the way through the potato.
Slice the butter into thin pieces. Alternate the butter and the parmesan, stuffing them in between the slices of the potato. Season the potato with garlic powder and kosher salt. Drizzle the potato with olive oil.
Bake at 400ยบF for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle heavy cream over the potatoes. Top with cheddar cheese.
Place back in the oven for 10-12 more minutes. Remove and serve!

name: Scones
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
1/4 cup Sugar
3 tsp Baking powder
3 Tbsp Shortening
3 Tbsp Butter
2/3 cup Milk
Dash of salt
directions:
Mix dry ingredients.
Cut in shortening and butter.
Add milk and mix.
Turn out on lightly floured board.
Knead 20 or so times.
Divide dough into thirds. Pat each into a circle about 4-5 inches across. Cut each into quarters or thirds.
Let rise on cookie sheet for a few minutes.
Bake at 425F for about 7-10 minutes or until golden brown.
notes:
Serve with honey.
Add different fillings like grated lemon and poppy seeds, grated orange and cranberries, dark chocolate and cranberries, etc.

name: Sheet Pan Dijon Onion Crunch Chicken with Green Beans & Garlic Bread
ingredients:
10 oz Chicken cutlets
1.5 oz Honey dijon mustard
1/4 cup Monterey jack cheese
1 package of Crispy fried onions
6 oz Green beans
1 tsp Garlic powder
1 Ciabatta Roll
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place 2 Tbsp butter (3 Tbsp for 4) in a small bowl and bring to room temperature. Pat chicken* dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper; place on one side of a baking sheet (spread out across entire sheet for 4).
