Brush tops of chicken with 1/2 Tbsp honey Dijon dressing (save the rest for serving). Sprinkle with Monterey Jack. Crush crispy onions in their package, then sprinkle over cheese, pressing to adhere. Roast on middle rack for 5 minutes (you'll add more to the sheet then).
Meanwhile, wash and dry produce. Trim green beans if needed. Once chicken has roasted 5 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Carefully toss green beans on empty side with a drizzle of oil; season with salt and pepper. (For 4 servings, leave chicken roasting; add green beans to a second baking sheet and roast on top rack.) Return to middle rack and bake until green beans are tender and chicken is browned and cooked through, 12-15 minutes more.
Meanwhile, combine softened butter with garlic powder to taste. Season with salt and pepper. Halve and toast ciabatta. Spread cut sides with garlic butter. Cut each half on a diagonal.
Toss green beans with 1 Tbsp plain butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Divide chicken, green beans, and garlic bread between plates. Serve with remaining dressing on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 730

name: Sesame Honey Chicken Drumettes
ingredients:
1/2 cup Honey
2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1 Tbsp. Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp. Rice vinegar
1 tsp. Hot chili flakes
24 Chicken drumettes
1 tsp. Salt
1/2 tsp. Pepper
1 Tbsp. Sesame seeds, toasted
directions:
Preheat the oven to 375.
Combine the honey, mustard, soy sauce, rice vinegar and chili flakes in a small bowl. Set aside.
Rinse the drumettes under cold water and pat dry. Place them in a roasting pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake, uncovered, for 40 minutes, turning after 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and discard the fat and liquid.
Pour the honey mustard sauce over the drumettes and toss well. Return to the oven. Bake until the chicken is crispy and golden in color, about 30 to 40 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.
notes: Toast the sesame seeds in a dry frying pan over low heat for 2-3 minutes.

name: Sesame Soy Chicken Bowls with Chili Mayo, Cilantro, and Crispy Onions
ingredients:
3/4 cup Jasmine rice
1 Lemon
1/4 oz Cilantro
2 Tbsp Mayo
1 oz Sweet thai chili sauce
10 oz Chicken breast strips
4 oz Shredded carrots
4 Tbsp Sweet soy glaze
1.5 oz Sesame dressing
1 Crispy fried onions
directions:
In a small pot, combine rice, 1.25 cups water (2.25 cups for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, wash and dry produce. Zest and quarter lemon. Roughly chop cilantro. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise with Chili sauce to taste.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large  pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook stirring, until browned all over, 3-4 minutes. Stir in carrots, sweet soy glaze, and 3 Tbsp sesame dressing (6 Tbsp for 4 servings). Cook until carrots are softened, chicken is cooked through, and sauce has thickened, 2-4 minutes more. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lemon zest and 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings). Season with salt and pepper. Divide rice between bowls and top with chicken mixture and any remaining sauce from pan. Drizzle with Chili mayo. Sprinkle with crispy fried onions and cilantro. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 950

name: Shrimp Cocktail Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sweet chili sauce
2 Tbsp. Ketchup
1 tsp. Prepared horseradish
1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 tsp. Fresh lemon juice
directions:
Combine all the ingredients and mix well. Cover and chill for 30 minutes before serving.
The sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 2 weeks.

name: Shroom 'n' Swiss Pork Burgers with Potato Wedges & a Creamy Honey Dijon Dipper
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
4 oz Button mushrooms
2 Potato buns
1 Tbsp Mushroom Stock Concentrate
10 oz Ground Pork
2 Slices Swiss cheese
4 Tbsp Sour cream
1.5 oz Honey Dijon Dressing
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Trim and thinly slice mushrooms. Halve buns.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil and a big pinch of salt and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and crisp, 20-25 minutes.
Meanwhile, melt 1 Tbsp butter (2 Tbsp for 4 servings) in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and softened, 3-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in half the stock concentrate (you'll use the rest in the next step) and 1 Tbsp water (2 Tbsp for 4). Cook, stirring, until mushrooms are coated, 30 seconds. Turn off heat; transfer to a small bowl. Wipe out pan.
In a large bowl, combine pork* and remaining stock concentrate. Season with salt (we used 1/2 tsp; 1 tsp for 4 servings) and pepper. Form mixture into two patties (four patties for 4), each slightly wider than a burger bun. Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in pan used for mushrooms over medium- high heat. Add patties and cook until browned and cooked through, 4-7 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with Swiss cheese. Cover pan until cheese melts.
While patties cook, toast buns until golden. In a second small bowl, combine sour cream and honey Dijon dressing. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread bottom buns with as much sauce as you like. Top with patties, mushrooms, and top buns. Divide burgers and potato wedges between plates. Serve with any remaining sauce on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep 10 min and cook time 35 min. Calories: 1050

name: Sizzling Sesame Shrimp Noodles
ingredients:
1 cup Uncooked pasta
5 Tbsp. Asian Sesame Dressing
1 lb. Shrimp (uncooked)
3 Cloves garlic, minced
1 Tbsp. Sesame seed
4 cup Frozen Asian-style stir-fry veggies, thawed
2 Tbsp. Soy sauce
directions:
Cook pasta as directed on package.
Heat 2 Tbsp. of dressing in 1g. skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, garlic and sesame seed.
(If using Chinese Spice-add now)
Stir fry for 3 minutes.
Add veggies, soy sauce, and remaining dressing.
Stir-fry 3 minutes or until veggies are heated through.
Drain pasta and toss with shrimp.
notes:
Dressing can be substituted with 2 Tbsp. olive/veggie oil and 1-2 tsp. of Chinese spice.

Shrimp can be substituted with bite size chicken strips.

name: Skillet Cinna-Buns
ingredients:
Cinnamon rolls:
2 1/2 cups Flour
1 cup Milk (tepid)
1/3 cup Unsalted butter, cubed
1/3 heaping cup Sugar
Pinch of Salt
1/2 Tbsp. Instant yeast
2 Eggs
Inside mixture:
1/3 cup Unsalted butter, soft
1/2 Tbsp. Cinnamon
1/2 cup Light brown sugar
Icing:
3 Tbsp. Cream cheese
2 Tbsp. Unsalted butter, soft
1/3 cup Icing sugar
1 tsp Vanilla extract
directions:
Add the yeast into the milk, stir together and leave to sit for a few minutes. Whisk in the eggs to combine.
In a stand mixer, add all of the dry ingredients and butter and with a dough hook attached, slowly pour in the wet ingredients and knead for 5 minutes until soft.
Place the dough in an oiled bowl and allow it to rise for an hour or doubled in volume.
Once ready, knock the dough back and using a rolling pin, roll it into a large rectangle.
Spread the soft butter on top of the dough. Mix together the sugar and cinnamon and spread this evenly over the top.
From the short side of the rectangle, roll the dough into a tight log. Cut into 1 inch discs and arrange the rounds into a buttered skillet pan.
Allow to rise for 20 minutes, then bake at 395 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown on top.
While cooking, mix the cream cheese butter, icing sugar and vanilla together.
Spread the mixture on top of the cinna-buns as soon as they re baked and serve.

name: Skinny Mac and Cheese Soup with Broccoli
ingredients:
4 oz dry elbow macaroni
1 1/2 cups onion, chopped
1 large carrot, chopped
1 celery stalk, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 Tbsp light butter
2 Tbsp flour
1 cup fat free milk
pinch nutmeg
1/2 tsp dry mustard
salt and fresh pepper to taste
2 1/2 cups fat free low sodium chicken broth (or vegetable broth)
2 cups (about 10 oz) broccoli florets, chopped into small pieces
1-1/2 cups 2% shredded sharp cheddar
2 Tbsp parmesan cheese
directions:
Boil pasta in salted water according to package directions for al dente. Drain and set aside.
Chop onion, carrot, celery, garlic by hand or mini food processor.
In a large soup pot or dutch oven, melt light butter.  Add chopped vegetables and sautรฉ on low heat until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add flour and fresh pepper to the pot and stir until smooth. Slowly add chicken broth, milk, nutmeg and dry mustard powder; whisking constantly.  Set heat to medium-high until it comes to a boil. Cover and cook on low about 10-15 minutes.
Add broccoli florets, Parmesan cheese, and stir well. Adjust salt and pepper to taste. Cook uncovered until broccoli is cooked, about 5 minutes or more to your liking. 
Add cheddar, mixing well until cheese melts and immediately remove from heat. Add cooked elbows and mix well, adjust salt and pepper if needed. Eat right away so the pasta doesn't absorb all the broth.
notes: Any noodle works

name: Snickerdoodle Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup Butter
1 1/2 cups Sugar
2 Large eggs
2 3/4 cups Flour
2 tsp Cream of tartar
1 tsp Baking soda
1/4 tsp Salt
3 Tbsp Sugar
3 tsp Cinnamon
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Mix butter, 1 1/2 cups sugar and eggs thoroughly in a large bowl. 
Combine flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl.
Blend dry ingredients into butter or margarine.
Chill dough, and chill an ungreased cookie sheet for about 10-15 minutes in the fridge.
Meanwhile, mix 3 Tbsp sugar, and 3 tsp cinnamon in a small bowl.
Scoop 1 inch globs of dough into the sugar and cinnamon mixture.
Coat by gently rolling balls of dough in the sugar mixture.
Place on chilled ungreased cookie sheet, and bake 10 minutes.
Remove from pan immediately.

name: Sophie's Chopped Salad
ingredients:
Dressing:
1/4 cup Balsamic vinegar
1 Tbsp Dijon mustard
1 tsp Salt
1 1/4 tsp Fresh ground black pepper
1/2 cup Canola oil
Salad:
3 cups Finely chopped romaine lettuce
2 Beefsteak tomatoes, seeded & finely diced
1/2 cup Canned chick-peas, rinsed and drained
1/2 cup Nicoise olive, pitted and coarsely chopped
3/4 cup White cheddar cheese, cubed
3/4 cup Monterey jack cheese, cubed
Chopped fresh chives (to garnish) (optional)
directions:
In a blender, or with a wire whisk, blend balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly blend in oil and blend until emulsified.
Toss lettuce, tomatoes, beans, chickpeas, olives and cheeses together in large bowl and dress lightly with vinaigrette. Garnish with tortilla chips and chives.
notes: http://www.food.com/recipe/sophies-chopped-salad-432126

name: Southwestern Fries
ingredients:
2 Tbsp. Ancho chile powder
1 Tbsp. Salt
5 Large Potatoes, peeled
4 cups Vegetable oil
1/4 cup Fresh chopped Cilantro
directions:
Combine the ancho powder and salt in a small bowl.
Cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices, then cut each slice into 1/4-inch-thick fries. Place the fries in a  large bowl of cold water.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan to 325 degrees F as measured on a deep-frying thermometer. Drain the fries in batches on paper towels. Fry each batch for 3 to 4 minutes, until pale blond color. Remove to a sheet pan lined with paper towels.
Raise the heat of the oil to 375 degrees F. Working in batches, fry the potatoes again, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to a sheet pan lined with paper towels and season with the chile mixture and cilantro.

name: Spun Sugar Decorations
ingredients: 1 cup Super-fine sugar
directions:
Prepare a baking sheet with a silicon mat or wax paper.
Melt the sugar in a pan, stirring until it has completely melted into caramel.
Allow to cool slightly, then begin to pull your sugar decorations.
For a sugar disc, drizzle the caramel in a circular motion over the baking sheet, and allow to cool completely.
For the spiral, make sure the caramel is slightly cooler and holding its shape. Twirl the sugar around a steel knife-sharpening blade to create tight spiral effect.

name: Steamed Dumplings
ingredients:
1 Tbsp. vegetable oil
1 Small onion, finely chopped
2 Cloves garlic, minced
1 Tbsp. Chopped ginger
1 cup Finely chopped mushrooms
1/4 cup Grated carrot
2 Tbsp. Soy sauce
1 tsp. Sesame oil
2 Tbsp. Chopped fresh cilantro
1/8 tsp. Pepper
36 Dumpling wrappers
Lettuce leaves
1/4 cup Spicy Dipping Sauce
directions:
Heat the oil to medium-high in a large, non-stick frying pan. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and cook about 5 minutes, or until soft and fragrant.
Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Transfer to a large bowl and add the carrot, soy sauce, sesame oil, cilantro and pepper. Toss gently.
Lay out as many dumpling wrappers as you have room for on your work surface. Lightly brush the edges of each wrapper with warm water. Place a heaping spoonful of filling in the edges firmly to seal. Place the finished dumplings on a baking sheet and cover with waxed paper.
Repeat with the remaining wrappers. The dumplings can be frozen on the baking sheet, transferred to an airtight container and kept in the freezer for 2 months.
To cook the dumplings, line a bamboo steamer or colander with lettuce. Arrange in a single layer over the lettuce and cover with the lid. Place over a pot of simmering water and steam for 12 minutes. Serve immediately with dipping sauce.
notes: Use Bamboo steamer or line a metal colander with lettuce leaves, cover it with a lid and place directly over a pot of simmering water.

name: Stovetop Potpourri
ingredients:
Scent 1:
1 Small orange, sliced
1/3 cup Fresh cranberries
1 tsp Cloves
3 Cinnamon sticks
Scent 2:
1 apple, sliced into wedges
3 Whole star anise
1 Cinnamon stick
3 Slices ginger
Scent 3:
1/2 Lemon, sliced
1 Tbsp Vanilla extract
2 Sprigs fresh rosemary
1 tsp Cardamom pods
directions:
Fill a pot with water and the ingredients.
Allow to come to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Be sure not to let the water evaporate completely. You can refill the pot with as much water as needed.

name: Strawberry Cream Puffs
ingredients:
1 cup Flour
100 ml Milk
100 ml Water
2 tsp sugar
1/2 tsp salt
5 1/2 Tbsp Unsalted butter
4 eggs
2 cups Heavy cream
1/3 cup powdered sugar
1 tsp vanilla extract
Fresh strawberries
directions:
Bring the milk, water, sugar, salt, and butter to a boil. Remove from heat, add flour and incorporate mixing with a wooden spoon until homogeneous. Return over low heat and while stirring cook for 2 minutes to pull out the moisture and pulls away from the sides of the pan. Allow to cool slightly. Add the eggs one at a time, using the wooden spoon or even a stand mixer.
Pipe the dough into 1 to 1.5 inch circles. Bake for 25-30 minutes at 350F until browned and puffed. Prick each with a skewer to release steam and allow to cool on a wire rack.
Whip the cream until it forms stiff peaks. Add sugar and vanilla extract and mix to combine. Split the cream puffs in half and fill them with cream mixture and strawberry slices. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

name: Strawberry Ice Box Cake
ingredients:
1 Ib. vanilla wafers, ground
1/2 cup butter
2 cup powdered sugar
2 eggs
1 qt. fruit: strawberry, pineapple, etc.
1 pint whipping cream, whipped with sugar added
directions:
Pour half ground wafers in 9x13 pan.
Mix butter and sugar then add eggs one at a time and beat hard.
Carefully spread this mixture on wafers; then put on a layer of fruit, (nuts), and whipped cream.
Top with remainder of wafers.
Let stay in refrigerator overnight.
notes: 1 cup pecans or walnuts, chopped (optional)

name: Strawberry Jam
ingredients:
2 cup crushed strawberries (use blender)
2 cup sugar
1 package of strawberry Jell-O.
directions:
Put in pan and boil for 1 minute; stir constantly.
Take off stove and stir in 1 small package of strawberry Jell-O.
Blend well.
Put in bottles/jars and freeze.

name: Sugar Cookies
ingredients:
3 cups all-purpose flour
3/4 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt
1 cup unsalted butter, softened
1 cup sugar
1 egg, beaten
1 Tbsp milk
Powdered sugar, for rolling out dough
directions:
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Place butter and sugar in large bowl or electric mixer and beat until light in color.
Add egg and milk and beat to combine.
Put mixer on low speed, gradually add flour, and beat until mixture pulls away from the side of the bowl.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Sprinkle surface where you will roll out dough with flour. Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thick.
Move the dough around and check underneath frequently to make sure it is not sticking.
Cut into desired shape, place at least 1 inch apart and bake for 7 to 9 minutes or until cookies are just beginning to turn brown around the edges, rotating cookie sheet half way through baking time.
notes: store up to a week

name: Sugar Cookies
ingredients:
3 cups flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. baking soda
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1/2 cup butter
1/2 cup shortening
2 eggs
1-1/2 cup sugar
1/2 tsp. vanilla
directions:
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda.
Cut in butter and shortening.
Beat eggs and sugar until fluffy. 
Add flavoring and combine mixture.
Roll dough.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes.

name: Summer Pasta Salad
ingredients:
1/2 Ib Mezzi rigatoni
Extra virgin olive oil
5 Whole cremini mushrooms
1 Carrot
1/2 English cucumber
1/2 cup Red bell pepper
1/3 cup Fresh corn kernels
8-10 Cherry tomatoes
1/3 Kalamata olives
3-4 Small fresh Bocconcini
4-6 Lrrge fresh basil leaves
Salt and pepper, to taste
directions:
Cook pasta al dente in abundantly salty water, drain and add a drizzle of olive oil. Stir to coat and set aside to cool.
Slice the mushrooms, carrot, cucumber and red pepper into bite-sized pieces. Add to a large bowl along with the corn kernels. Halve the cherry tomatoes and add to the bowl as well.
If using olives with pits, take a small clean rag and lay olives across one half of the towel. Fold the other half over the olives and press down firmly on them to gently squash them. Pits will easily slide out while retaining the shape of the olive. Discard pits and add olives to the bowl.
Break apart the cheese and tear the basil into bite-sized pieces, directly into the bowl.
Stir to combine so the tomatoes release some of their juice. Drizzle with 2 Tbsp olive oil and stir to coat. season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve at room temperature; the longer you this dish sit, the better it tastes!

name: Sunrise Smoothies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Milk
2 Tbsp frozen orange juice concentrate
1/2 cup Frozen peaches
1/4 cup Greek yogurt
1/2 tsp Vanilla extract
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Put milk, juice, and the peaches into a blender. Blend for about 45 seconds. 
Then add the yogurt, vanilla, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Serve it as a smoothie or turn the mixture into Popsicles.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
ingredients:
10-12 chicken tenderloins (or 6-8 chicken breasts)
2/3 cup sugar
1/2 cup white vinegar
1/4 cup water
3-4 Tbsp. ketchup
1 Tbsp. soy sauce
1 tsp. seasoning salt
1/2 tsp. salt
directions:
Put chicken in 9x13 baking pan.
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium sauce pan, mix everything else and bring to a boil.
Stir constantly.
Pour hot liquid over chicken.
Cover pan with tin foil and cook for 4o minutes for tenderloins or an  hour for chicken breasts.

name: Sweet and Sour Pork
ingredients:
2 Tbsp + 1 1/2 tsp Paprika
1 1/2 lbs. Boneless pork loin roast, cut into 1-in strips
1 Tbsp Canola oil
1 can (20 oz.) Unsweetened pineapple chunks
1 Medium onion, chopped
1 Medium green pepper, chopped
1/4 cup Cider vinegar
3 Tbsp Brown sugar
3 Tbsp Reduced-sodium soy sauce
1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
1/2 tsp Salt
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/4 cup Cold water
Thinly sliced green onions (optional)
directions:
Place paprika in a large resealable plastic bag. Add pork, a few pieces at a time, and shake to coat. Select saute setting on a 6-qt electric pressure cooker and adjust to medium heat; add oil. Brown the pork in batches, then return all pork to pressure cooker.
Drain Pineapple, reserving juice, onion, green pepper, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce and salt to the pressure cooker. Lock lid; make sure the vent is closed. Select manual; adjust pressure to high and set time for 10 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Select saute setting and adjust for high heat, bring liquid to a boil. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth; gradually stir into pork mixture. Add pineapple. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened (1-2 minutes). 
If desired, sprinkle with green onions and serve over rice.
notes:
Prep: 20 min
Cook: 15 min

name: Sweet Chili Pork & Cabbage Stir-Fry with Cilantro & Crispy Fried Onions
ingredients:
1/2 cup Jasmine rice
4 Tbsp Sweet soy glaze
1 oz Sweet thai chili sauce
12 ml Ponzu sauce
5 tsp Rice wine vinegar
10 oz Ground pork
1 tsp Garlic powder
4 oz Red cabbage and carrot mix
1 Crispy fried onion
1/4 oz Cilantro
directions:
Wash and dry produce. In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups for 4 servings), and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, in a small bowl, combine sweet soy glaze, chili sauce, ponzu, and half the vinegar (all for 4 servings). TIP: If you like a sweeter sauce, stir in a pinch of sugar.
Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork* and garlic powder; season with salt and pepper. Using a spatula, press into an even layer. Cook, undisturbed, until browned on bottom, 3-4 minutes. Break up meat into pieces and continue cooking until pork is cooked through, 1-2 minutes. Stir in sauce and cook, stirring, until slightly thickened, 1 minute more.
Stir red cabbage and carrot mix into pan with pork; cook until just tender, 2-3 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat. Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted. Divide rice between bowls and top with stir-fry and crispy fried onions. Pick cilantro leaves from stems; roughly tear and sprinkle over bowls. Serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 830

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
ingredients:
3 cup cooked canned yams, mashed with fork
1 stick soft margarine
1 cup sugar
1 tsp. vanilla
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 egg

Bag of small marshmallows
1/3 cup flour
1 cup packed brown sugar
directions:
Mix yams, butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon and egg and pour into casserole dish.
Mix flour and brown sugar and spread over top.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Then spread marshmallows on top and bake for 10 minutes.
notes: 1 cup chopped nuts

name: Sweet Soy Sauce
ingredients:
1/4 cup Soy sauce
1/2 cup Mirin
1 tsp. Sugar
2 Tbsp. Water
directions: Combine all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

name: Tiffany's Pizza Recipe
ingredients:
2-1/2 cups flour
1 Tbsp. sugar 
1 Tbsp. yeast
1/2 tsp. salt
1 cup warm water
2 Tbsp. oil
directions:
Mix 2 cups of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add water and oil; mix well.
Add remaining flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough.
Add sauce and toppings.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
notes: Makes one pizza crust.

name: Tri-Color Neapolitan Cookies
ingredients:
2 1/2 cups All-purpose flour
1/2 tsp Baking powder
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Butter, softened
1 1/2 cups Granulated sugar
1 Egg
1 tsp Vanilla
1/2 tsp Almond extract
6 Drops red food coloring
1/2 Chopped walnuts
1/4 cup Unsweetened cocoa powder
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg until incorporated. Stir in vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture and mix until a soft dough forms.
Divide dough into three equal portions. Place one portion in a small bowl. Add almond extract and red food coloring in and knead until fully integrated into the dough.
Spread this portion evenly over the bottom of the prepared pan. Add nuts to another portion and knead well. Spread this portion evenly over the first layer. Add cocoa to the last portion and knead until it is evenly distributed throughout the dough.
Spread this portion over the second layer. Cover with plastic wrap or waxed paper and refrigerate overnight.
When ready to bake, remove from pan and cut loose in half lengthwise. Cut each half into slices 1/4 thick. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until firm.
notes:
9x5 inch loaf pan, bottom and sides lined with wax paper
Cookie sheet, ungreased

name: Virginia's Dinner Rolls
ingredients:
1 pat butter, melted
2 cups hot water
2 tsp. salt
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs, beaten
1/3 cup warm water
2 heaping Tbsp. yeast
1/2 cup powdered milk
7-8 cup flour
directions:
Melt butter.
Add very hot water, salt and sugar.
Stir to dissolve.
Place in mixing bowl.
Add 3 cups of flour and powdered milk; mix very well.
Add beaten eggs.
add yeast which has been dissolved in 1/3 cup warm water. 
Add flour gradually. Turn out on floured board.
Cover, let rest for 10 minutes.
Knead till smooth and satiny.
Place in container to raise. Let raise until double.
Roll out on lightly floured board, 1/2 inch thick. Cut rolls and place on greased pans.
Let raise and bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes. 
Brush with melted butter after baking.

name: Waffle Donut
ingredients:
Dough:
3/4 cup Lukewarm milk
1/4 cup Sugar
1 Tbsp dried yeast
3 Egg yolks
2 1/2 cup Plain flour, plus extra
3 1/2 oz. Chilled butter, cut into small cubes
Icing:
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
1/4 cup Maple syrup
1 cup icing sugar
directions:
Combine milk and a pinch of the sugar into a medium sized bowl. Sprinkle over yeast and set aside for 5-6 minutes or until foamy. Stir in the remaining sugar and egg yolks until combined.
In a large bowl add the flour. Rub the butter to the flour until the mixture resembles a bread crumb consistency. 
Pour in the egg mixture and stir until a rough dough forms. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until a smooth dough forms.
Place into a lightly oiled bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide into 12 equal portions and roll each into a ball and then flatten slightly.
Spray a waffle maker with grease and place 4 balls on the hot iron. Press down and cook using the machines normal timing.
Once the donuts are all cooked and cooling begin making the glaze. In a bowl combine the melted butter, maple syrup and icing sugar. Whisk until smooth. Dip each waffle donut in the glaze and top with small ripped pieces of the candied bacon.
notes: Make candied bacon: Preheat oven to 375 F. Place bacon strips on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Drizzle 1 tsp of maple syrup over each slice of bacon. Bake for 10 minutes, flip strips and bake for another 5 minutes. Use 1 tsp of maple syrup for each strip of bacon.

name: Waffle Peach Topping
ingredients:
1/2 cup. sugar
2 heaping Tbsp. Corn Starch
1 small can peaches
1/2 cup cold water
1 tsp. butter
A sprinkle of nutmeg
directions:
Put 1/2 cup of sugar into sauce pan.
Put 2 heaping tsp. of corn starch into sugar.
Drain peaches into mixture.
Add 1/2 cup of cold water into mix. 
Mix mixture.
Cook until thickens, stirring constantly.
Add chopped peaches. 
Add 1 tsp. of butter.
To top it off, add a sprinkle of nutmeg.
notes:
*May need to add more liquid after adding chopped peaches.
*Delicious on waffles!

name: Waffles
ingredients:
1-3/4 cups flour
1 Tbsp. baking powder
1/2 tsp. salt
1-3/4 cup milk
2 eggs
1/2 cup oil
directions:
Mix all dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl.
Mix milk, eggs, and oil in a separate bowl.
Add milk, eggs, and oil mixture to dry ingredients.
Mix well.

name: Wassail
ingredients:
1 gal. apple juice (100%)
1 jug cranberry juice (100%)
5 cinnamon sticks
15 cloves
10 allspice
2 ginger (omit or use candied ginger?)
6 cups of water
1-1/2 cups white sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
directions:
Boil water and sugar until dissolved.
Add all spices, cover and let stand 1 hour
Add juices.
(Optional: Add 1 cup orange juice.)
notes: Serve hot or cold.

name: Watermelon Banana Smoothie
ingredients:
2 cups Chopped watermelon
3 cups Peeled and sliced Bananas
1 1/2-2 cups Vanilla yogurt
directions:
Blend all ingredients together until smooth. 
Either chill, drink, or make Popsicles with the smoothie mixture.
notes: Go easy on the yogurt, especially if you're using Greek yogurt.

name: Watermelon Salsa
ingredients:
1 cup Watermelon, diced
1/2 cup Tomato, diced
1/3 cup Orange bell pepper, diced
1/4 cup Red onion, diced
1 Tbsp Cilantro, minced
2 Tbsp Freshly squeezed lime juice
Salt and pepper to taste
directions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Serve with chips.
notes: 1 jalapeno, minced and optional

name: Watermelon Sorbet
ingredients:
1 (2-pound) piece seedless watermelon, rind removed and flesh cut into 1-inch pieces to yield about 3 1/2 cups
1 (6-ounce) can pineapple juice, chilled
3/4 cup ginger ale, chilled
1/3 cup fresh lime juice (from about 3 large limes)
1/2 cup grenadine (recommended: Rose's)
directions:
In a blender, blend the watermelon, pineapple juice, ginger ale, lime juice, and grenadine until smooth. Pour into an ice cream maker and freeze, according to the manufacturer's instructions, for about 35 minutes.
Spoon into glasses or small bowls and serve.

name: Whipped Cream
ingredients:
1/2 cup Heavy cream
1 Tbsp Powdered Sugar
1/2 tsp Vanilla
directions: Place all ingredients in a mixing bowl or electric mixer and whisk until medium peeks.

name: White Cheddar Wonderburgers with Caramelized Onion, Special Sauce & Old Bay Fries
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
12 oz Yukon gold potatoes
1 OLD BAY Seasoning packet
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Ketchup
2 tsp Dijon mustard
10 oz Ground beef
1/2 cup White Cheddar cheese
2 Potato buns
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil and half the Old Bay Seasoning (you'll use more later). Season lightly with salt and pepper. TIP: No need to season generously- there's already salt and pepper in the seasoning! Roast on top rack until browned and crispy, 20-25 minutes.
While potatoes roast, heat a large drizzle of oil in a medium, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and softened, 8-10 minutes. Add 1 tsp sugar (2 tsp for 4 servings) and a splash of water; cook until onion is caramelized and jammy, 2-3 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a small bowl.
Meanwhile, in a second small bowl, combine mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, and as much remaining Old Bay Seasoning as you like. Set aside. Form beef* into two equal-size balls (four balls for 4 servings); season all over with salt and pepper.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for onion over medium-high heat. Once pan is hot, add beef. Firmly flatten each ball with a spatula to create very thin patties. (TIP: Do so carefully; oil may splatter a bit.) Cook to desired doneness, 3-4 minutes per side. (Don't worry if the patties aren't perfectly round-those irregular edges will turn crispy.) In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top patties with cheddar; cover pan until cheese melts. Remove from heat.
While patties cook, halve and toast buns. Divide buns between plates and fill with patties, caramelized onion, and half the special sauce. Serve Old Bay fries on the side with remaining special sauce for dipping.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1020

name: White Chicken Chili
ingredients:
6 Frozen chicken breasts
2 Jars Pace picante (16 oz per jar)
4 Cans Great northern beans
1 cup Water
Garlic Salt
Monterey Jack Cheese
directions:
Put all ingredients into crock-pot for 4-6 hours.
Once it's finished cooking (6-8 hours on low), shred the chicken and add cheese.
notes: 4 hours on high or 6+ hours on low.

name: Whole Wheat Bread
ingredients:
5-1/2 cups water
2/3 cups sugar
2 Tbsp. yeast +1 cup flour
2 Tbsp. salt
2/3 cups oil
10-13 cups flour depending on the altitude
directions:
Mix all ingredients together having the mixer on while adding cups of flour.
Let dough rise with lid unlatched.
Shape into loaves (4).
Grease pans with Crisco. Sprinkle flour in pan. 
Let rise until double in size.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. 
Bake for 35 minutes.

name: Yucatan Citrus Chicken Bowls with Poblano, Smoky Red Pepper Crema & Pickled Onion
ingredients:
1 Mandarin Orange
1 Lemon
1 Yellow Onion
1 Poblano Pepper
1/4 oz Cilantro
10 oz Chicken
2 Tbsp Tex-Mex Paste
1 Tbsp Southwest Spice Blend
1/2 cup Rice
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Smoked Paprika
1 tsp Ancho Chili Pepper
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve mandarin. Zest and quarter lime. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Halve, core, and thinly slice poblano crosswise into strips. Roughly chop cilantro. Pat chicken* dry with paper towels; place in a medium bowl. Toss with Tex-Mex paste, juice from mandarin, lime zest, half the Southwest Spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), and juice from one lime wedge (two wedges for 4 servings).
In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water (1.5 cups water for 4 servings), remaining Southwest Spice, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, in a small microwave-safe bowl, combine 1/4 of the onion, juice from half the lime, 1/4 tsp sugar (1/2 tsp for 4 servings), and a pinch of salt. Microwave until onion is softened, 1 minute. Set aside. In a separate small bowl, combine smoky red pepper crema and a pinch of salt. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until slightly softened, 3-4 minutes. Add another drizzle of oil and remaining onion; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until veggies are tender, 4-6 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken in a single layer; cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly charred and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Add a pinch of chili powder to taste. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in veggies, then remove pan from heat.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted. Season with salt to taste. Divide rice between bowls and top with chicken and veggies, crema, and as much pickled onion (draining first) as you like. Sprinkle with cilantro. Cut remaining lime into wedges and serve on the side.
notes: Prep 10 min. Cook time 35 min. Calories: 630

name: Zucchini Fries Dipping Sauce - Arrabiata Sauce
ingredients:
1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
2 Cloves garlic, whole
1 Clove garlic, finely chopped
1 tsp Crushed red pepper flakes
1 (16 oz) Can chopped tomatoes
Basil leaves, chopped
directions:
In a medium saucepan, warm the olive oil and cloves of garlic over medium heat. Cook the garlic until fragrant and lightly brown, about 4 minutes, moving occasionally. 
Remove and discard the garlic. Add the chopped garlic to the pan and cook gently until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and cook for about 10 minutes over medium heat to reduce. 
Remove from heat and stir in chopped basil leaves; adjust seasoning accordingly with salt.
